loans.name: Soda's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composer de 6 femmes qui habitent le même quartier et font toutes le commerce.Il est à son 10éme prêt. Soda est la représentante du groupe, elle est âgé de 46 ans, marié et mère de 11 enfants dont 2 garçons et 9 filles. ils on ente 29 et 6 ans. elle fait du commerce de produits halieutique et fait en même temps de la couture.Avec son prêt elle compte acheter une machine à coudre à 150000f et 250000f de produits halieutiques. Elle vend ses produits dans le marché du poisson de la ville.Elle a une expérience de plus de 30 ans. Avec ses bénéfices elle satisfaits les besoins de ses enfants et épargne dans le banc villageois.
texts.en:
This group is made up of six women who live in the same neighborhood and are all involved in retail business.  This is their tenth loan.

Soda is the group's representative.  She is 46 years old, married, and the mother of 11 children, including two boys and nine girls.  Her children's ages range between 29 and 6 years old.  

Soda sells fish-related goods and also works as a seamstress.  She plans to use her loan to buy a sewing machine for 150,000 francs and fish-related products for 250,000 francs.  She resells her goods at her city's fish market.  She has more than 30 years of experience in her field.

She uses her profits to meet the needs of her children and to strengthen her savings within the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and some fish-related products.

loans.name: Laura Marcela

texts.es: Laura Marcela es una mujer de 22 años de edad, es soltera y aún no tiene hijos. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogo y mercancía en general, como ropa, accesorios, entre otros; actividad que realiza desde el año 2009, con la cual ha logrado obtener ingresos para apoyar económicamente a su familia y además le permitió cumplir uno de sus sueños que era graduarse como Técnica Auxiliar en Salud Oral. Laura es una persona emprendedora, con habilidad comercial intuitiva y espíritu de superación; para generar mayores utilidades ella aprovecha las promociones internas que sacan en los catálogos y luego vende la mercancía al precio estipulado para el público general. Con el crédito que solicita en la Corporación desea comprar más mercancía (cremas corporales, perfumes, bisutería, productos de aseo, cosméticos) y una vitrina que requiere para exhibir los productos; de esta forma podrá ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes, incrementar sus ventas y por ende aumentar el nivel de ingresos. Su principal sueño es hacer carrera en el área de las ventas y desea aprovechar la oportunidad que se le presenta con la venta de productos por catálogo, para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Laura Marcela is a 22-year-old woman who is single and has no children. She currently sells catalog products and general merchandise such as clothing, accessories, and other items. Laura has been doing this type of work since 2009 and it has allowed her to earn income to support her family financially. This also allowed her to fulfill one of her dreams, which was to graduate as a Certified Dental Assistant.

Laura is an enterprising person who has a natural instinct for business and the drive to succeed. In order to generate more profit, she takes advantage of internal promotions offered through the catalogs and then sells the merchandise to the general public at a stated price. With the loan she is requesting from Interactuar, Laura will buy more merchandise such as body crèmes, perfumes, trinkets, toiletries, and cosmetics, as well as a display cabinet that she needs to exhibit her products. As a result, she will be able to offer a greater variety to her customers, increase her sales, and eventually raise her income level. Her main goal is to establish a career in sales, so she wants to take advantage of this current opportunity of selling catalog products in order to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and a display cabinet for exhibiting her products.

loans.name: Fatama

texts.en:
Fatama lives and works in St. Paul, which is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for its fish due to its location by the sea. St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past the Freeport. It is one of the poorer areas, and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing.

Fatama is 28 years old and is single with two children, ages 8 and 3; the children are in school and live at home. For the past 7 years, Fatama has been operating a table where she sells fish. She says sometimes the buying goes slowly. She started this business by selling around in the communities with the few goods she could afford, a method she learned from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for her business. She plans to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business

loans.name: Nueva Estrella Group

texts.es:
Nueva Estrella esta en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas tienen la esperanza de mejorar sus vidas por medio del programa de comités. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 10  se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con ingresos muy bajos.
Patrocinia es una mujer que trabaja mucho, ella se dedica a la costura, y cuenta que tiene muy buena clientela que siempre le hacen muchos pedidos. Ella es muy hábil con lo que hace y es por eso que sus clientes siempre vuelven a ella y le traen mas trabajo. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo y el día de mañana tener mas maquinas y poder dar trabajo a otras personas.
Agradece por esta oportunidad y solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos y demás insumos para poder seguir con su trabajo y luchando por crecer así según sus deseos.
texts.en:
“Nueva Estrella” (New Star) is in its cycle #1 in the women’s committee program where they all hope to improve their lives by means of the committee program.  They are taking the poverty elimination survey and ten of them are below the poverty line, that is to say very low income.

Patrocinia’s a woman who works much.  She sews and says she has a good clientele because they always place many orders.  She’s very skilled in what she does and this is why her customers return to her and bring her more work.  Her goal is to continue growing so that in future to have more machines and be able to provide employment for others.

She is grateful for this opportunity and requests this loan in order to buy fabric and thread and other supplies to continue with her work and striving to grow according to her wishes.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Jenny Lizbeth

texts.es:
Jenny es una joven de 22 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica, al lado de sus padres a quienes quiere muchísimo y sobre todo cada día se esfuerza por  salir adelante cada día para poder  ser un orgullo para ellos.  Con mucha dedicación Jeny se encuentra estudiando la carrera de enfermería y para poder solventar algunos gastos de sus estudios Jenny tiene su pequeño negocio de ropa, ella atiende alrededor de 10 personas al día ya y le dedica alrededor de 3 horas ya que acude a su centro de estudios; ella cree que esta saliendo adelante porque es muy responsable.

Jeny está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar algunos materiales para poder refaccionar el cuarto donde habita, con lo cual podrá tener un mejor ambiente donde vivir y podra seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:” Ser una gran profesional y poder tener un gran negocio”.
texts.en:
Jenny is a young woman who is 22 years old. She lives next to her parents, who she loves a lot, in the city of Ica. Primarily, she strives to get ahead every day so she can be their pride and joy. With much dedication, Jenny is studying nursing. To cover some of her education expenses, Jenny has a small clothing business. She serves around 10 people a day already and devotes about 3 hours, since she goes to school. She believes she is getting ahead because she is very responsible. 

Jenny is very grateful for Kiva lenders. Thanks to the help that they will have given her, she will be able to buy some materials to renovate her room. With this, she will have a better environment to live in and she will be able to keep fighting to make her dreams come true. Her biggest dream is to be a great professional and to have a great business.

loans.use: to buy materials to renovate her room.

loans.name: San Blas Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Blas  está en el 10° ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante desde el año 2008, es decir que este ya es un grupo bien formado y donde toda ya se conocen muy bien.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Sonia, quien día tras día se esfuerza por poder crecer. Ella tiene las esperanzas puestas en que por medio del programa de comité podrá seguir creciendo y ayudando a su familia, que es su principal motor. Ella tiene una despensa bien surtida, y cuenta que empezó con un pequeño negocio, y que poco a poco está creciendo gracias a su esfuerzo.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en cargar con mas productos su negocio, como ser: frutas, verduras, hortalizas, productos a granel y demás. Ella quiere que conforme pase el tiempo todas sigan mejorando sus vidas.
texts.en:
The “San Blas” group is in its 10th cycle in the women’s committee program where they’ve all worked and helped each other out since 2008, that is to say this is a well-established group where they all know each other very well.

One of the members is Sonia who day to day strives to be able to grow.  She hopes that by means of the committee program she’ll be able to continue to grow and to help her family which is her main motivator.  She has a well-stocked store and she relates that she started out with a small business that’s been gradually growing thanks to her effort.

She requests this loan to be able to stock more merchandise like fruit, vegetables, bulk items, etc. in her store.  She wants that as time goes by all of their lives will continue to improve.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for the store.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 33 year-old married father of two children. He owns a farm where he rears cattle and different kinds of birds. He makes his revenue by selling cow milk and chicken eggs. His wife is unemployed, and both his children are still in school.

Hussein's income is insufficient to provide a healthy life for his family, especially since schooling expenses are costly. As a result, Hussein contacted Al Majmoua to acquire a loan and purchase more cattle, which would greatly increase his output and thus also increase his revenue. As for the future, Hussein wishes to expand his farm.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle, which would greatly increase his output

loans.name: Astou's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de 7 femmes qui son unies par de bonnes relations sociales et font toutes le commerce. Astou est la représentante du groupe ,elle est âgée de 61 ans , mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont 2 garçons et 3 filles qui ont entre 30 et 15 ans.Elle fait du commerce de produits halieutiques.Elle part dans la ville côtière la plus proche  pour acheter ses produits et vient au marché pour exposé. Elle fait cette activité depuis son adhésion dans le banc villageois( 5 ans). Avec son prêt elle compte acheter 200kg de poisson fumé à 50000f ;100kg de poisson séché à 100000f et 80 k de cymbium a 104000f.Avec ses bénéfices elle aide ses enfants dans les dépenses de la maison .
texts.en:
This group consists of seven women who are united by good social relationships and all work in retail.

Astou is the group's representative.  She is 61 years old, married, and the mother of five children (two boys and three girls) whose ages range between 30 and 15 years old.  

Astou sells seafood.  She goes to the nearest coastal town to buy her goods and resells at the market.  She has been involved in this activity since she joined the banc villageois five years ago.

She plans to use her loan to buy 200 kilos of smoked fish at a total price of 50,000 francs, 100 kilos of dry fish at 100,000 francs and 80 kilos of cymbium (a type of sea snail) at 104,000 francs.

She uses her profits to help her children cover their household expenses.

loans.use: to buy smoked and dry fish, as well as sea snails (cymbium).

loans.name: De La Paz

texts.es:
De la Paz es una estudiante sacrificada de la ciudad de Ybycui, está siguiendo la carrera de Administración de empresas, la cual le gusta mucho y por la que se esta esmerando mucho.
Ella tiene como meta poder ser una gran profesional que sea útil a las demás personas y también a su familia, ya que ellos siempre han estado al lado de ella apoyándola en sus metas y anhelos.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en útiles para su universidad, como así también otros gastos que surjan en su vida de universitaria. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo, que le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
De La Paz is a self-sacrificing student from the city of Ybycui. She is pursuing a degree in Business Administration because she enjoys this field and takes a great interest. Her goal is to become a successful professional so that she will be of use to other people and also to her family. They have been by her side, supporting her in her goals and ambitions.

De La Paz is requesting this loan so that she can invest in supplies for her university studies, as well as other expenses that are related to being a college student. She appreciates the opportunity she has received since it will be of great help.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her university studies and to pay for a few other expenses.

loans.name: Rudy

texts.en:
Rudy lives in Cibubur, about one hour from Jakarta. Rudy manages a small shop selling snacks and mobile phone airtime credit. Rudy is married and living with five persons in the family home.  

Rudy joined Ruma two years ago because he wanted to expand his mobile airtime business. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Rudy sees improvements in his shop.  For the last three months, he has earned an average of $37–$40/day in mobile phone airtime credit sales. He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions.  

His goal for his business is to expand into more new businesses in the future.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Leonel

texts.es:
El joven leonel es originario de Piedras Negras en donde tiene viviendo desde hace 34 años, es una persona  muy responsable y trabajadora, él desde muy pequeño empezo a trabajar para así sostener los gastos de su casa para ayuda de su madre que no trabajaba al igual ayudar a sus seis hermanos ya que su papá los abandono desde hace muchos años.
El joven Leonel tuvo que dejar sus estudios de arquitectura y se dedico a trabajar de lleno, ahora ya se hace cargo solamente de su mamá pues sus hermanos se hicieron independientes y tienen sus propias familias.
Pide apoyo através de KIVA porque quisiera remodelar su casa empezando por el baño el cual se encuentra muy deteriorado, y quisiera realizar una mejora para así darle una mejor calidad de vida a su madre que tanto le agradece por haberlo formado con valores que lo han hecho crecer en la vida y le han permitido entrar en una empresa reconocida en donde labora de capturista desde hace 4 años.
texts.en:
Leonel is a young man who is originally from Piedras Negras, where he has been living for 34 years. He is a hardworking and responsible person. From a very young age, Leonel has had to work in order to contribute to the household expenses and support his unemployed mother and his six siblings since his father abandoned them many years ago.

Leonel quit his studies in architecture so that he could work full-time. Now he is only supporting his mother since his siblings are independent and have their own families. He is requesting assistance from Kiva so that he can begin remodeling the bathroom in his house, which has greatly deteriorated. Leonel wants to make this improvement so that his mother can have a better quality of life. He is grateful that she has instilled the values that have enabled him to grow up in life. This allowed him to obtain a job as a computer operator at a well-known company, where he has been employed for the past four years.

loans.use: to remodel the bathroom in his house.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Unidas se formo con la unión de 21 amigas y vecinas de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, el grupo está en su ciclo número 9 del programa de comité de mujeres. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 15 mujeres mostraron tener un ingreso muy bajo, pero son conscientes que deben de seguir trabajando y no desanimarse.
Modesta vende productos Avon, y cuenta que por medio de sus ventas está saliendo adelante y luchando por su familia, para poder darles lo mínimo que puedan necesitar. Ella sabe que la única forma de salir adelante es trabajar, y es por eso que se está esforzando el doble. Quiere poder tener algún día su propio negocio independiente en su casa.
Solicita este crédito para la compra de productos Avon, para poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes, agradece por esta oportunidad que están recibiendo todas.
texts.en:
“Mujeres Unidas” (United Women) formed when 21 girlfriends and neighbors from the city of San Lorenzo came together.  The group is in cycle #9 in the women’s committee program.  They are filling out the poverty elimination survey and 15 of them are of very low income but aware that they must continue working and not become discouraged.

Modesta sells Avon products and relates that she’s getting ahead and fighting for her family in order to provide for their minimum needs by means of her sales.  She knows that the only way to get ahead is by working and this is why she’s putting in double effort.  She wants someday to be able to have her own independent businesss at home.

She requests this loan to buy Avon products to fill pending customer orders; she’s grateful for the opportunity all of them are getting.

loans.use: To buy Avon products to sell.

loans.name: Handini

texts.en:
Handini runs a small stall which sells mobile phone airtime credits. She lives in Cibubur, a semi-urban area about one hour from Jakarta. Handini is married and lives with four persons in the family home. 

Handini began working with Ruma one and a half years ago because she wanted to try a mobile airtime business. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last three months, she has had around $51-$55/day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). 

As the business continues, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Yayan

texts.en:
Yayan lives in Serang, about two hours from Jakarta. He manages a small shop selling snacks, drinks and mobile phone airtime credit.  Yayan is married and living with three persons in the family home.  

Yayan joined Ruma two months ago because he wanted to expand his mobile airtime business. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Yayan sees improvements in his shop. For the last two months, he has earned an average of $47–$50/day in mobile phone airtime credit sales. He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions.  

His goal for his business is to expand into more new businesses in the future.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en: Lawrence is a single man. He describes himself as credible. He operates a clothing store where he sells trousers, shirts, dresses etc. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a profitable area, and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as poor infrastructure, which leads to high transport costs. He will use the loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy materials for making clothes, such as thread and a sewing machine. His business goal is to become the leading dealer of clothes within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be self-reliant.

loans.use: buy materials for making clothes, such as thread and a sewing machine

loans.name: Yadi

texts.en:
Yadi runs a small stall which sells mobile phone airtime credits. He lives in Serang, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta. Yadi is married and lives with three persons in the family home. 

Yadi began working with Ruma two months ago because he wanted to get more income. He feels really excited to expand his business of selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last two months, he has had around $36–$40/day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). 

As the business continues, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en:
Ismail is a 38-year-old single man living in a village in the Bekaa valley. He owns a small garage where he maintains and paints cars. His income is barely sufficient to provide for one person, which is why he needs to enhance his business if he wishes to settle down and build a family. 

He has contacted Al Majmoua and requested a loan that would help him achieve his wishes. In fact, this loan would enable him to buy a new work kit that would be up-to-date with the new technologies on the market. 

As for the future, Ismail hopes to boost his business by expanding the garage.

loans.use: to buy a new work kit that would be up-to- date with the new technologies on the market.

loans.name: Eka

texts.en:
Eka runs a small stall which sells drinking water and mobile phone airtime credits. She lives in Serang, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta. Eka is married and lives with three persons in the family home. 

Eka began working with Ruma two months ago because she wanted to try a mobile airtime business. She feels really excited to expand her business of selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last two months, she has had around $46-$50/day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). 

As the business continues, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Minas

texts.en:
Minas is 42 years old and lives with his nice family in the village of Tsovagyugh, which is in the Gegharkunik region. Minas has two sweet daughters. His wife does not work since she takes care of both their children and their cute farm. Minas has a vocational education with the specialty of machinist, but he has never worked in his specialty. For several years, he has worked as a builder, and he has been engaged in farming and agriculture for twenty years. The farm he has today has been developed through hard work, days and nights, and through his purposefulness and stubbornness in wanting to provide a better future for his family. His farm has seven cows, four calves, ten sheep, and eighteen chickens. He also cultivates beans, tomatoes, cucumbers, and greens. Minas manages to hand the milk of his farm cows over to a big dairy-products factory that is very famous in Armenia. He also sells meat to the local butchers, who are very satisfied with the quality of his farm products.

Minas is asking for a loan to buy a hay-mowing machine as cutting the hay manually is very hard and just a waste of time.

loans.use: To buy a hay-mowing machine

loans.name: Aby's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de 7 femmes qui font toutes le commerce et ont une bonne cohésion sociale, il est a son 10éme prêt. Aby est la représentante du groupe ,elle est âgée de 53 ans marié et mère de 4 enfants dont 2 garçons et 2 filles qui ont entre 35 et 20 ans.Elle fait du commerce de tissu et de cosmétique.elle part dans un pays frontalier pour acheter sa marchandises et vient exposer sur la route devant la boutique de sa sœur.Elle s’en sorte très bien car l'emplacement de son activité est très fréquenté.Avec son prêt elle compte acheter 300000f de tissu et 200000f de produit cosmétique a savoir parfum, gel de bain et crème de corps.Avec ses bénéfices elle aide ses enfants dans leur besoins ,elle épargne aussi dans le banc villageois et aide son marie dans les dépenses de la maison.
texts.en:
This group is made up of seven women who all work in retail and are united by good social relationships.  This is their tenth loan.

Aby is the group's representative.  She is 53 years old, married, and the mother of four children (two boys and two girls) whose ages range between 35 and 20 years old.  

She sells fabrics and beauty products.  She travels to a neighboring country to buy her goods and then resells along a road, in front of her sister's shop.  Her business is doing very well because the location where she sells her products is a very busy one.

With her loan, she plans to spend 300,000 francs to buy fabrics and 200,000 francs to buy beauty products (perfumes, shower gels and body lotions).

With her profits, she supports her children, helps her husband cover the household's expenses, and saves some money within the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and beauty products (perfumes, body lotion and shower gel).

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en: Alfredo is a 59-year-old married man from Talibon, Bohol. He has 6 grown children. He engages in fishing. He catches and sells fish to earn a living. He has been in the fishing business for more than 10 years. In order to continue his fishing livelihood, he requested a loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy fishing materials such as fishing nets. In the future, Alfredo would like to expand his fishing business to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials such as fishing nets

loans.name: Ophelia

texts.en:
Please meet 43-year-old Ophelia from St. Paul in Liberia. St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for its fish due to its location by the sea. St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past the Freeport.  It is one of the poorer areas, and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. Ophelia is a widow who completed 10th grade. She has two children, aged 23 and 20, who live at home.

For the past ten years, Ophelia has been operating a small table where she sells items such as flour, sugar, onions, and oil. She started this business by selling for a friend and learned this method of selling from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more flour, sugar, onions, oil, etc. for her business. She cites fewer goods on her table as her biggest challenge. Her favorite thing about her business is that it makes her independent. In the future, she would like to own a house. She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more flour, sugar, onions, oil, etc, for her business.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas tiene 60 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene 6 hijos. Vive con sus 6 hijos. Actualmente, se dedica a la agricultura, y el comercio. Desde hace 30 años llevaba la comida hasta el lugar donde trabajaba su papá y fue de esa manera que aprendió a trabajar viendo como era el manejo que se le daba al cultivo, además se dedica a comercializar productos como reliquias y venta de verduras en el mercado, hace 15 años felicitas observaba que su hermana vendía cacaricos(pez) en el mercado, fue en ese entonces donde le nació la idea de comprar cerdos, engordarlos y venderlos, luego que fue creciendo puso una venta de reliquias y una venta de verduras que actualmente posee.

Los insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, herbicidas e insecticidas los compra en la ciudad. Felicitas traslada los insumos en el autobús haciendo un tiempo promedio hasta la entrada del caserío de 30 minutos y desde ahí los tiene que trasladar su compañero de vida con sus hijos cargando en la espalda los sacos de fertilizante.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 4 quintales de fertilizante, 4 litros de herbicidas, un bote de insecticida y otra parte lo invertirá en la compra de verduras como por ejemplo 2 sacos de ejote, 1 caja de tomates, y 1 saco de cebolla. 

Se le apoyara con el crédito para que pueda comprar los insumos que va a necesitar para cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y así tener el cultivo en buenas condiciones para una mejor y mayor producción de granos básicos, además invertirá un poco más en el pequeño puesto de venta de verduras que tiene en el mercado.

Además, mejorará su alimentación ya que se le apoyara para la compra de insumos agrícolas y así pueda trabajar la agricultura junto con su compañero de vida y obtener los granos básicos para la alimentación de sus hijos. Y también tener un ingreso mayor de la venta de verduras que tiene y así ir cubriendo las necesidades de sus hijos.

Ella quiere remodelar su casa para tener una casa más bonita y vivir en mejores condiciones de vida, además quiere continuar cultivando la tierra como lo ha hecho desde hace mucho tiempo.
texts.en:
Felicitas, 60, has a spouse and six children.  She lives with her six children and currently works in agriculture and in commerce.  Thirty years ago she’d take her father his lunch to the place where he was working and this is how she learned how working the crops was done; she also worked selling relics and vegetables in the market.  Fifteen years ago she watched her sister selling fish in the market and that’s when she got the idea of buying pigs, fattening them up and selling them.  She gradually grew and then started selling relics and vegetables, the business she currently has.

She buys the supplies like fertilizer, herbicide and insecticide in the city.  She transports the supplies by bus and the trip to the entrance of her settlement takes on average 30 minutes.  From there her life companion and her sons have to transport them carrying the sacks of fertilizer on their backs.

The loan she’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy four quintals of fertilizer, four liters of herbicide and one can of insecticide; she will use the rest to buy vegetables like for example 2 sacks of green beans, one box of tomatoes and one sack of onions.

She will be supported with the loan so that she can buy the supplies she will need to cultivate 7,000 square meters of corn so that she can keep her crop in good condition for better and more abundant basic grins production; she will also invest a bit more in her small vegetable stand she has in the market.

Also, she will improve her nutrition because she will be helped to buy agricultural supplies so she and her spouse can work in agriculture and get the basic grains needed for their children’s food while also earning higher income from the sale of vegetables and thus be able to cover their children’s needs.

She wants to remodel her house so that it will be prettier and to live in better conditions; she also wants to continue cultivating the land like she’s been doing for a very long time.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Simon Honorato

texts.es:
Simon tiene 59 años de edad pero tiene una vitalidad y una alegría de un joven de 15 según nos comenta y es porque para él si se deja ganar por el mal humor no va a trabajar bien y sobre todo no podrá estar bien para su familia, vive al lado de su esposa quien es su mano derecha y sobre todo su amiga y el hombro en el cual él se puede recostar cuando necesita de un apoyo; su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Camaná, esta se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido en cualquier época del año, y se le denomina la tierra del sol eterno,  se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de arroz, frejol, entre otros. El tuvo estudios secundarios pero le hubiera gustado estudiar para ser ingeniero agrónomo.

Con mucho esfuerzo y sobre todo el deseo de Salir adelante Simon trabaja en su parcela en la cual cosecha frejol; el le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día, sobre todo porque siempre vela porque a sus plantas le de ninguna plaga para que su cosecha sea buena; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy dedicado y muy conocido por los clientes.

Simon está muy feliz y agradecido por la ayuda que le han brindado los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar insumos, fertilizantes y abono para su plantas y así poder mejorar la cosecha para el otro año y mejorar su ingreso, de esta manera el podrá seguir luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar de construir su casa de material Noble”.
texts.en:
Simón is 59-year-old but has the vitality and joy of a young 15-year-old according to what he says.  And that’s because he believes that if he lets a bad mood take over he won’t work well and above all won’t be able to be good for him family.  He lives with his wife who is his right hand and above all his friend and the shoulder on which he can rest when he needs support.  His house is located in the city of Camaná which is noted for its hot weather all year round, it’s called “Land of Eternal Sun.”  Agriculture, especially growing rice and beans, among others, is common.  He attended secondary school but would have liked to have studied Agronomy.

With much effort and above all the wish to get ahead, Simon works his land growing broad beans.  He spends about 10 hours daily at work above all because he’s careful to keep his plants free from pests so that harvest will be good.  He believes he does well in his business because he’s very dedicated and well-known by his customers.

Simón is very happy and grateful for the support Kiva lenders are providing because thanks to their help he will be able to buy supplies like fertilizer and manure for his plants to improve harvest for next year and improve his income.  In this way he will be able to continue striving every day to make his greatest dream reality: to finish building his house out of substantial materials.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer, among others.

loans.name: Eugenia Maria

texts.es: DOÑA EUGENIA DE 48 AÑOS ES HABITANTE DE UNA COMUNIDAD RURAL UBICADA EN EL MUNICIPIO DE EL VIEJO CHINANDEGA. ACTUALMENTE TRABAJA COMO APOYO EN EL CENTRO DE SALUD DE LA COMUNIDAD. DESDE HACE 25 AÑOS DONDE DIARIAMENTE VIAJA 7 KILÓMETROS EN BICICLETA PARA LLEGAR A SU CENTRO DE TRABAJO.  ELLA VIVE CON SUS PADRES, UN HERMANO Y DOS SOBRINOS QUE CUENTAN MAS QUE CON EL APOYO DE ELLA: RUDDY DE 19 AÑOS Y AXELL DE 5 AÑOS. EUGENIA HA VIVIDO TODA LA VIDA EN ESTA COMUNIDAD  DONDE NO HAY LUZ ELÉCTRICA, Y  PARA ALUMBRARSE EN EL HOGAR  POR LAS NOCHES UTILIZAN  CANDELAS Y FOCO CON BATERÍAS. SU DESEO ES TENER UN PANEL SOLAR PARA ILUMINAR SU CASA, Y QUE SEA UTIL PARA LOS CASOS DE EMERGENCIAS NOCTURNAS. CON EL PRÉSTAMO EL VA A OBTENER UN SISTEMA SOLAR DE 100 WATT. "CUANDO MI HERMANO  MURIÓ TUVIMOS QUE GASTAR MUCHO DINERO ALQUILANDO UNA PLANTA ELÉCTRICA PARA PODERLO VELAR DE NOCHE. EN ESE MOMENTO NOS DIMOS CUENTA DE LO TRISTE Y DIFÍCIL QUE ES NO TENER ENERGÍA ELÉCTRICA EN MOMENTOS DE EMERGENCIA".
texts.en:
Eugenia is 48 years old and lives in a rural community located in the municipality of Chinandega. She currently works as an assistant in the community health center. She has worked there for 25 years bicycling the seven kilometers to the center everyday. She lives with her parents, one brother and two nephews (Ruddy, 19 and Axell, 5) have more support than just that of Eugenia. 

Eugenia has lived in this community, where there is no electricity, her whole life. In order to light up the house at night, they use candles and battery-powered light bulbs. Her hope is to have a solar panel to light her house and have for emergency situations at night. With this loan she will get a 100 watt solar home system. 

"When my brother died we had to spend a lot of money to rent a generator to have light during the night. At that moment we realized how sad and hard it is to not have electricity during times of emergency."

loans.use: to buy a solar home system to provide light in her home.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 31-year-old married father of two children. Since water in Lebanon is heavily polluted and people cannot drink tap water, Mohammad decided to open up his own business and distribute drinkable, fresh, and clean water to his neighborhood.

Because he needs to satisfy a large number of people in order to maximize his profit and provide a healthy life for his family, he contacted Al Majmoua to request a loan to purchase two motorbikes that will help him and his staff reach their customers more easily, deliver their requests, and secure new contracts.

As for the future, Mohammad wishes to expand this business and maximize the number of customers who can benefit from healthy water.

loans.use: to purchase two motorbikes to help him and his staff reach their customers more easily

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en: Dioscora earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Dioscora needs a loan for her store. She is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell in her store like soda and beverages, biscuits and snack foods, etc. With this, she will be able to improve the variety of her store, thus attracting more buyers and customers. Dioscora dreams of making her business sustainable and a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her store like soda and beverages, biscuits and snack foods, etc.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose  tiene 32 años de edad muy carismático y con muchas ganas de progresar y es porque para él si se deja ganar por el mal humor no va a trabajar bien y sobre todo no podrá estar bien para su familia y sobre todo porque tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad, vive al lado de su esposa quien es su mano derecha y sobre todo su amiga y el hombro en el cual él se puede recostar cuando necesita de un apoyo; su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Pisco, esta se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido en cualquier época del año, y se le denomina la tierra del sol eterno,  se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de maíz, frejoles, pallares, entre otros. El tuvo estudios secundarios pero le hubiera gustado estudiar para ser ingeniero agrónomo.

Con mucho esfuerzo y sobre todo el deseo de Salir adelante Jose trabaja en su parcela en la cual cosecha maíz; él le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día, sobre todo porque siempre vela porque a sus plantas le de ninguna plaga para que su cosecha sea buena; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy dedicado y muy conocido por los clientes.

Jose está muy feliz y agradecido por la ayuda que le han brindado los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar insumos, fertilizantes y abono para su plantas y así poder mejorar la cosecha para el otro año y mejorar su ingreso, de esta manera el podrá seguir luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
José, 32, is very charismatic and very much wants to make progress.  He believes that if he lets a bad mood take over he won’t work well and above all won’t be good for his family above all because he has a 2-year-old son.  He lives with his wife who is his right hand and above all his friend and the shoulder he can rest on when he needs support. His house is located in the city of Pisco noted for its hot weather year-round; it’s called ‘City of Eternal Sun.”  Agriculture, especially corn, broad beans, white beans and others is common here.  He attended secondary school but would have liked to have studied Agronomy.

With much effort and above all a strong wish to get ahead, José works on his land growing corn.  He works about 10 hours daily in his business above all because he’s always watchful to keep his plants safe from infestations so that the harvest will be good.  He believes he does well in his business because he’s dedicated and very well-known by the customers.

José is very happy and grateful for the help Kiva lenders are giving him because thanks to the support they’ve provided he will be able to buy supplies like manure and fertilizer for his plants to be able to improve next years’ harvest and improve his income.  In this way he will be able to continue striving daily to make his greatest dream reality: to own a house.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Agus

texts.en:
Agus runs a small stall which sells mobile phone airtime credits. He lives in Cilegon, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta. Agus is married and lives with two persons in the family home. 

Agus began working with Ruma one year ago because he wanted to get more income. He feels really excited to expand his business of selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last two months, he has had around $100–$110/day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). 

As the business continues, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Herawati

texts.en:
Herawati runs a small stall which sells mobile phone airtime credits. She lives in Cilegon, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta. Herawati is married and lives with two persons in the family home. 

Herawati began working with Ruma three months ago because she wanted to try a mobile airtime business. She feels really excited to expand her business of selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last three months, she has had around $82-$85/day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). 

As the business continues, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia esta estudiando la carrera de contabilidad en una de las mejores universidad de su ciudad. Ella esta poniendo todo de si para poder ser una de las mejores.
El dia de mañana quiere ayudar a las personas por medio de sus conocimientos. También quiere seguir haciendo cursos y capacitarse, ya que una persona nunca deja de aprender.
Solicita este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar las cuotas de su universidad, lo cual le ayudará mucho a seguir con sus proyectos.
texts.en:
Sonia is studying the career of Accounting in one of the city’s best universities.  She’s putting in everything she can in order to be one of the best.

In future she wants to help people by means of her skills and she also wants to continue taking courses and training because a person never stops learning.

She requested this loan to pay her university fees which will help her very much to continue with her projects.

loans.use: to pay university tuition fees.

loans.name: Tahmina

texts.en:
Tahmina, an 18-year-old single woman, could not enter university because her parents couldn't support her financially. She therefore decided to start an animal husbandry business to generate an income with which she can contribute to her home’s finances.

To acquire business skills, Tahmina took a course called ‘To Get Ahead,’ offered by a women's organization, and she will manage her enterprise alone. Hardworking and smart, she is determined to be a very successful businesswoman. Tahmina is requesting a loan of 2000 somoni to buy cattle for her new venture. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle for organizing a new business

loans.name: Mamagul

texts.ru: Мамагуль 57 летняя вдова, проживающая в районе Бохтар. Она вежливая, отзывчивая и добрая женщина. У нее двое взрослых сыновей. Старший сын работает мигрантом за рубежом, а другой здесь предоставляет услуги мастера по ремонту домов. У Мамагуля есть невестка и она работает медсестрой в больнице. Сама Мамагуль пенсионерка и, несмотря на свой пожилой возраст занимается животноводством. Она закупает, откармливает и перепродает крупно-рогатый скот последние 5 лет. В ведении бизнеса ей помогает сын. Мамагуль берет кредит для закупа коров и телят, чтобы продолжить продвижение своего бизнеса. Она в дальнейшем хочет увеличить поголовье продаваемого скота.
texts.en: Mamagul is a 57-year-old widow that lives in Bohtar, Tajikistan.  She is a polite, responsible and kind woman.  She has two grown sons.  The older is a migrant worker abroad and the other is a home repair contractor.  Mamagul has a daughter-in-law who works as a nurse at a hospital.  Mamagul herself is a pensioner who, despite her age, works with livestock.  For the past five years, she has purchased, fattened, and resold cattle.  Her son helps her run her business.  Mamagul is taking out a loan to buy cows and calves in order to continue to expand her business.  At the moment, she wants to increase the number of animals she sells.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Soliha

texts.ru: Солиха 53-летняя вдова с тремя сыновьями. Она проживает в городе Дангара. Солиха в течение 7 лет занимается купле-продажей детских одежд. Ей в бизнесе помогает средний сын. Старший сын находится на заработках в другой стране, а младший еще учится в школе. Торговая точка Солихи расположена на рынке города. Солиха получает доход, который едва хватает на обеспечение семьи и на продвижение деятельности. Солиха очень целеустремленная женщина. Сейчас она хотела бы увеличить товарооборот и продвинуть бизнес. Она просит кредит для закупа ассортимента сезонной детской одежды на продажу. Этот кредит поможет Солихе приобрести разнообразный ассортимент товара и таким образом увеличить продажу и улучшить ее доход. Солиха надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Soliha is a 53-year-old widow and has three sons.  She lives in Dangara, Tajikistan.  For seven years, Soliha has sold children's clothing.  Her second oldest son helps her run the business.  Her oldest is a migrant worker in another country and her youngest is still in school.  She has a place from which to sell her goods that is located at one of the city's markets.  The income Soliha receives is barely enough to provide for her family and to keep the business going.  She is a hardworking woman.  Now, she wants to increase her turnover and move her business forward.  She is asking for a loan to buy an assortment of seasonal children's clothing to sell.  This loan will help Soliha obtain more diverse inventory which will increase sales and, consequentially, her income.  She relies on your support.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of seasonal children's clothing

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lima De Conchacalla Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SANTA ROSA DE LIMA DE CONCHACALLA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Toribia ella es conviviente, tiene 40años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia continua con su negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas entre otros, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia a la vez se dedica a la agricultura, la socia lleva años dedicándose a esta actividad la cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes y abono para su chacra.

La foto se tomo en dos grupos porque los socios de uno de los grupos pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de leche, negocio de venta de maíz, negocio de venta de comida, venta de queso, venta de lubricantes, tienda de abarrotes.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “Santa Rosa se Lima de Conchacalla” Communal Bank. This bank is located in the Anta district, Anta province, Cusco department.  

The member’s name is Toribia.  She is 40 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has two children.  She continues her business of breeding small animals such as guinea pigs, chickens, and others.  She breeds these small animals and later sells them to customers that request them.  At the same time, Toribia is engaged in farming.  She has been engaged in this activity for many years and it is going well thanks to the hard work she puts into her business every day. She is requesting the loan to purchase fertilizer and organic fertilizer for her farm.

The photo was taken in two groups because the members of one of the groups requested permission to arrive at the meeting late because they had to work.  The other members of the group are engaged in selling milk, corn, meals, cheese, lubricants, and groceries.  Toribia is grateful to those who are part of this dream by this means, and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and organic fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Mollecato Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “MOLLECATO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Augusta ella  tiene 51 años y tiene 6 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de productos secos como trigo, cebada y maíz, la socia venden algunas ferias y mercados, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los granos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar maíz, cebada y trigo.
El socio que esta tapado su cara con un circulo ya no pertenece al banco comunal Mollecato.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de comida, negocio de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de granos.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “MOLLECATO” communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Urcos, belonging to the province of Quispicanchis and the department of Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

The featured member is Mrs. Augusta. She is 51 years old and has 6 children. She works on her business selling dry goods like wheat, barley and corn. She sells at a few fairs and markets, working from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m. Augusta has been in this business for 5 years and it is going very well. Her dream is to have a space where she can sell the grains. She is asking for the loan to buy corn, barley and wheat.

The member whose face is covered with a circle doesn't belong to the Mollecato communal bank anymore.
 
The other members make a living from a business selling food, an animal business, a grocery store business and a business selling grains.

Augusta thanks those who form part of this dream in this manner, and she commits to paying her fees in the time established.

loans.use: to buy corn, barley and wheat

loans.name: Edwin Ciro

texts.es:
Edwin es un joven de 19 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica y es un joven muy carismático y sobre todo con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Día a día Edwin trabaja como obrero en un fundo agrícola, el labora alrededor de 10 horas al día y con el fruto de su trabajo apoya a su familia con los gastos del hogar; Edwin cree que está saliendo adelante porque se esfuerza mucho y sobre todo es muy responsable.

Edwin está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar una cocina a gas para su hogar, ya que actualmente cocina a Kerosene y el humo que emana  es muy toxico y debido a ello ha tenido algunos accidentes; de esta manera Edwin podrá colaborar con el bienestar de su familia y seguir luchando cada día para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una carrera universitaria y poder seguir apoyando a su familia”
texts.en:
Edwin, 19, lives in the city of Ica.  He’s a very charismatic young man above all with a strong wish to get ahead.  Day to day Edwin works as a laborer on a large agricultural estate; he works about ten hours daily and is able to support his family and cover household expenses with the fruits of his labor.  Edwin believes he’s doing well because he puts in much effort and above all because he’s very responsible.

Edwin’s very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they’ve provided he will be able to buy a gas stove for his home because he currently cooks with kerosene and the smoke it produces is very toxic and because of it he’s had some accidents.  In this way Edwin will be able to contribute towards his family’s well-being and continue striving daily to make his greatest dream reality: to have a university career and to be able to continue supporting his family.

loans.use: to buy a gas stove.

loans.name: Mae

texts.en: Mae is a 60-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. A mother of a 12-year-old daughter, she runs a sari-sari (variety) store business. She sells various items ranging from biscuits, eggs, canned goods, noodles and beverages. Mae requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy more merchandise like soft drinks, condiments, and dry goods. In the future, Mae would like to expand her sari-sari (variety) store to provide her child with good food, and to save for her child's quality education.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise  like soft drinks, condiments, and dry goods

loans.name: Manuel Roberto

texts.es:
Manuel es un  joven de 19 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica, la cual se caracteriza por su clima cálido y acogedor, es un joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, ya que para poder salir adelante trabaja como vendedor de materiales de construcción y con el fruto de su trabajado solventa los gastos de preparación en una academia pre-universitaria, ya que el esta postulando para ingresar a la facultad de ingeniería de sistemas, ya que es lo que más le gusta y sobre todo  porque quiere ser el orgullo de sus padres.

Manuel está muy agradecido con los prestamistas ya que gracias al gran apoyo que le están brindando el podrá pagar la mensualidad de su academia, lo cual le permitirá tener una mejor preparación y poder ingresar a la universidad, así el podrá seguir luchando y trabajando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:”  Ser un ingeniero de Sistemas  y poder apoyar a su familia a salir adelante”.
texts.en: Manuel is a young man of 19 who lives in the town of Ica, which has a warm and welcoming climate. He does his utmost to improve his lot in life and, to this end, sells construction materials, an activity that enables him to pay for school fees, as he is attending a school that prepares students who wish to enter university. He wants to study systems engineering, a career that is very appealing to him. His greatest wish is to make his parents proud. Manuel is very grateful to Kiva lenders since, thanks to their tremendous help, he will be able to pay for school fees, which will enable him to be better prepared for his entry into university. This way, he will keep improving his lot in life and working to make his greatest dream come true: "I want to become a systems engineer and be able to help my family have a better life".

loans.use: to pay for school fees.

loans.name: Virgen De Guadalupe-Cusco Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE GUADALUPE-CUSCO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia es la Sra. Mercedes ella es conviviente y tiene 48 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de librería, la socia vende útiles de escritorio y librería como cuadernos, libros, lapiceros, lápices, borradores entre otras utiles, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de librería. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuadernos, libros, borradores, lápices y lapiceros.

Los socios que estan pegadas a la foto grupal se le tomo despues la foto porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de librería, negocio de venta de muebles, negocio de taller de carpintería y negocio de servicio de taxi.


 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members are part of the communal bank Virgen de Guadalupe - Cusco, located in the district of Cusco, province of Cusco (Department of Cusco). 

Mercedes is one of the communal bank's members. She is a 48-year old woman, has 2 children and owns a bookstore, where she sells office supplies such as notebooks, books, pencils, pens and erasers, among others, and works from 8am to 9pm. Her dream is to expand the business. 

She's now requesting a loan to buy notebooks, books, erasers, pencils and pens, and is grateful to all that make this possible. She commits to complying with her payments as scheduled. 

The other group members work in various businesses, such as bookstore, furniture sale, carpentry and taxi services. 

The members whose photos have been added to the group picture were absent for work reasons.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, books, erasers, pencils and pens.

loans.name: Zuniati

texts.en:
Zuniati runs a small stall which sells mobile phone airtime credits. She lives in Bogor, a semi-urban area about one hour from Jakarta. Zuniati is married and lives with six persons in the family home. 

Zuniati began working with Ruma two months ago because she wanted to try a mobile airtime business. She feels really excited to expand her business of selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last two months, she has had around $28-$30/day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). 

As the business continues, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Safar

texts.ru: Сафар является фермером, проживающим в районе Хуросон. Ему 57 лет. Он женат и отец пятерых детей. Сафар трудолюбивый и образованный человек. Он имеет среднее техническое образование. По специальности Сафар бухгалтер и проработал в этой сфере 15 лет. Одновременно Сафар занимается земледелием в течение 18 лет. Ему нравится эта работа, он занимается посевом огородных культур на собственной земле и выращивает в основном помидоры, огурцы, морковь, лук, а также кукурузу. Сафар полученный урожай продает и продвигает быт. С этой целью он берет кредит для закупа семян овощей, минеральных удобрений, топлива для повторного посева. С полученной прибыли Сафар хочет купить телегу для своей земледельческой деятельности. Он надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Safar is a farmer and lives in Khuroson, Tajikistan.  He is 57 years old, married and a father to five children.  Safar is a hardworking and educated man.  He has a technical degree.  He is trained as an accountant and has worked in the field for 15 years.  At the same time, Safar has worked in agriculture for 18 years.  He likes this work and plants his garden on his own land where he grows mostly tomatoes, cucumbers, carrots, onions and corn.  Safar sells his crops to live on.  With this goal, he is taking out a loan to buy vegetable seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel for garden machinery.  With the profits, Safar wants to buy a cart for his garden.  He relies on your support.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds and fertilizers as well as fuel for machinery.

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel lives in Sevan, which is a small city in Gegharkunik region. He has his own business retailing vegetables, fruits, and berries on a rented stall in the center of their city. Samvel’s stall is very popular and beautiful, colorful and very often visited by a lot of customers every day. Samvel sells a perfect assortment of berries and fruits: strawberries, mulberries, currants, apples, and apricots. He also sells peppers, cucumbers, and grape leaves, which are used to prepare Armenia's national delicious and very tasty dish, dolma. Samvel brings all the products he needs with a rented car from the Yerevan wholesale markets. 
Samvel’s wife helps him very much in his occupation. Samvel’s family is a very big one; they have five sons. Three of them live and work in Russian Federation and the others are still school-aged. Samvel worked as a builder for 20 years, but now he is engaged only in the retail business.
Samvel is asking for a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams to buy a lot of products for his stall and also to pay the rent bills for it.

loans.use: To buy a lot of products for his fruit and vegetable stall and also to pay the rent bills

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is a 50-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She has eight children. The oldest is 19, while the youngest is 4. 

Sylvia runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells canned goods, noodles, seasonings, coffee, cooking oil and soap. Her husband is a fisherman. His income is not enough to meet the family's daily needs, so Sylvia requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy additional stock to sell like detergents, shampoo, seasonings, beverages and soft drinks. In this way, she would be able to cater to the needs of her customers, and at the same time, maintain her store full of stock. 

Sylvia hopes that she can expand her sari-sari store business in order to send all her children to school for their bright future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like detergents, shampoo, seasonings, beverages and soft drinks.

loans.name: Shahbana

texts.en: Shahbana, 30, is a vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for the last two years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR from the Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of lace, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she can generate a healthier source of income. She is in her 3rd loan cycle and thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of lace, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Matrasul

texts.en:
Matrasul lives in Serang, about two hours from Jakarta. He manages a small shop selling snacks, groceries, and mobile phone airtime credit. Matrasul is married and living with three persons in the family home.  

Matrasul joined Ruma two months ago because he wanted to expand his mobile airtime business. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Matrasul sees improvements in his shop. For the last two months, he has earned an average of $51–$55/day in mobile phone airtime credit sales. He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions.  

His goal for his business is to expand into more new businesses in the future.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a buffalo for their livestock and dairy business

loans.name: M.ridho

texts.en:
Ridho lives in Cibubur, about one hour from Jakarta. He manages a small shop selling snacks, drinks and mobile phone airtime credit. Ridho is single and living with two persons in the family home.  

Ridho joined Ruma five months ago because he wanted to expand his mobile airtime business. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Ridho sees improvements in his shop. For the last three months, he has earned an average of $51–55/day in mobile phone airtime credit sales. He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions.  

His goal for his business is to expand into more new businesses in the future.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine, a 34-year-old married mother of two children, five and eight years of age, describes herself as optimistic. For eight years she has been operating a grocery store where she sells potatoes, tomatoes, onions, greens, etc. Her business is located in a business area, and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital.

Josphine, the recipient of a previous SMEP DTM loan of Kes 20,000, since repaid, will use this Kes 50,000 loan to buy stocks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions, greens, etc. Her business goal is to have a bigger premise within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have more branches.

loans.use: to buy stocks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions, greens, etc.

loans.name: Sahak

texts.en:
Sahak and his family live in the village of Geghamavan which is in the Gegharkunik region. Sahak is married and he has a daughter and a son. His wife and daughter work at the local school as teachers of Armenian language and literature and their son is a student of Yerevan State Pedagogical University in the Department of Philology. Sahak has a specialty as a history teacher and he has worked at the village school for many years.

Today Sahak has a farm and perfectly manages farming and agriculture. On his plot of land he cultivates mainly grains. On his farm he has four cows, four bulls, two heifers, three piglets, one horse, six sheep and fifteen chickens.

Sahak has decided to cooperate with Kiva lenders, since he needs some money to organize hay mowing activities and to buy several new cultivating blades because his blades have became very worn out.

loans.use: To buy several new cultivating blades and to organize hay mowing activities

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She has been engaged in the farming business for more than 25 years now. She helps her husband in tilling their farm.

Erlinda is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, they will be able to improve their farm as well as their harvest.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a 53-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has three grown children. She is engaged in farming. She tills the soil and grows rice as a source of her livelihood. Aside from farming, she also raises pigs to augment her income. She has been farming rice for more than 10 years now. 

Victoria requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy fertilizer and additional pigs to expand her business. In the future, Victoria hopes that she will be successful  in both businesses for the improvement of their livelihood status.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and additional pigs

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is married and she has two small children. They live in the village of Lchashen which is in the Gegharkunik region. Her husband’s work (he does house repairing) is not constant and he manages to help Liana around their farm. On their farm they keep cows, sheep and chickens, and the sale of their farm products (milk and meat) has come to be the main source of income for their family. Land cultivation (mainly potatoes and greens) fully remains on the fragile shoulders of this nice lady, but she says that working with land relaxes her and gives her positive thoughts.

Liana is very happy again to have a deal with Kiva lenders. Last time’s cooperation has supported her family very much and they managed to buy two calves, potato seedlings and fertilizer. Today Liana again has a request; she want to buy two cows, three piglets and ten chickens, and also a lot of  fodder for her farm animals in order to be safe from cold winter surprises.

loans.use: To buy two cows, three piglets and ten chickens, and also a lot of fodder for animals.

loans.name: Fortuna Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Fortuna está en su primer ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres,  ellas están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas, y tienen mucho entusiasmo por salir adelante. Ellas son de la ciudad de Curuguaty, una zona bastante alejada de la zona céntrica, con difícil acceso, cuando hay lluvias quedan cerradas y no pueden salir.
Una persona digna de destacar es la Sra. Juana, quien a través de la venta de remedios naturales está luchando por salir adelante, y ayuda a su familia. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora, que con mucho esfuerzo lucha por ir creciendo. Agradece por esta ayuda que está recibiendo, la cual es una gran oportunidad.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de remedios naturales, con lo cual ella puede seguir intentando ayudar a su familia y procurar por ir creciendo.
texts.en:
The group called Fortuna is in its first loan cycle of the women's communal bank program. They are learning to work together and show a lot of enthusiasm in getting ahead in life. They are from the city of Curuguaty, an area that is quite far from the central area and is difficult to access: when it rains, they are cut off and cannot leave. 

A noteworthy person is Juana, who via the sale of natural medicines is fighting to make her way in life and help her family. She is a very hardworking person who, with a lot of effort is fighting to grow as a person. She is grateful for this help that she is receiving which is an excellent opportunity. Juana is seeking this loan to buy natural medicines with which she can continue trying to help her family and trying to grow.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines for sale.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a 36-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has 3 children, ages 9, 7 and 5. She operates a motorcycle transport service. Her husband is the driver and the one who transports the passengers from one barrio to another. Merlinda has been operating the motorcycle transport service for almost 5 years now.

To be able to continue her livelihood, Merlinda requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy motorcycle parts, and to cover expenses for house repair. In the future, she would like to expand her motorcycle transport services to provide her family with the best, and to send her children on to a college education.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle parts, and cover expenses for house repair.

loans.name: Rebeccah

texts.en: Rebeccah is a 36-year-old married woman. She has 2 children between the ages of 4 and 8. She describes herself as optimistic. She operates a poultry business where she sells eggs. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a potential business area and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of enough capital. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to add more poultry. Her business goal is to have over 1000 hens within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will generate more income from her business. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add more poultry.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is a 31-year-old single woman. She has 1 child who is 11 years old. She operates a beauty salon where she does hair treatment, hair plaiting, and other services. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in an area appropriate for business and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of local products. She will use this 50,000 KES loan to add hair weaves, cosmetics, and other items to her stock of beauty products. Her business goal is to have a well-established beauty supply shop within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of 50,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add hair weaves, cosmetics, and other items to her stock of beauty products.

loans.name: Luz Yaneth

texts.es: Luz Yaneth es una mujer de 39 años de edad, madre de 2 hijos y actualmente vive en unión libre con su pareja. Hace 12 años realizó la capacitación en el área de belleza y, gracias  a ello, tomó la decisión de montar su propio salón de belleza, con lo cual ha obtenido los ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia y llevar los gastos del hogar. La prestataria se muestra como una mujer luchadora, trabajadora y con espíritu de superación. Con el crédito que solicita en la Corporación, desea realizar mejoras en el local, comprar pintura para las paredes y renovar las herramientas de trabajo (secador, plancha, cepillos), lo que le permitirá generar una nueva percepción a sus clientes y atraer a nuevos usuarios para incrementar sus ingresos. Su mayor sueño es hacer crecer su negocio hasta convertirlo en un spa, para mejorar su calidad de vida y generar nuevas oportunidades de empleo.
texts.en:
Luz Yaneth is a 39-year-old woman and the mother of two children. She and her partner are currently in a common-law relationship. Twelve years ago, she completed her training in the field of cosmetology. As a result, she made the decision to establish her own beauty salon. With the income she earns, Luz is able to move her family forward and take care of the household expenses. She has demonstrated that she is a determined and hardworking woman and possesses the spirit to succeed.

With the loan she is requesting from Interactuar, Luz will make improvements to her shop and buy paint for the walls. She will also replace her work equipment such as a hair dryer, curling iron, and brushes. This will enable her to project a new image to her customers and attract new ones so that she can increase her earnings. Her greatest wish is to grow her business and convert it into a spa so that she can improve her quality of life and create new job opportunities.

loans.use: to make improvements to her shop, buy paint for the walls, and replace her work equipment.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is married with three children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a cashew nuts business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her dream is to establish a rental house in the near future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts to sell to her clients. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts to sell to her clients.

loans.name: Nothiyata

texts.en: Nothiyata is an old client who has borrowed three times before. She is married and has 3 children, ages 5, 4 and 3. She has a beer depot and also sells goats for additional income. She would like to expand her goat project and wants the loan to build a shelter for the goats. Her customers are the people who live within range of her shop; however, she sells the goats in the market. Her dream is to have a bigger beer depot in the future. Her current challenge is that she has fewer customers due to the increased price of beer.

loans.use: To build a shelter for the goats.

loans.name: Ma. Cecille

texts.en: Ma. Cecille is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and has two children. She is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides. With this, she will be able to improve her farm as well as her harvest. In the future, she hopes of making her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children and to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Zoya

texts.en:
Zoya lives in the Shamb community with her husband (in the photo). They have been involved in agriculture for many years. Zoya keeps chickens on her farm and cultivates different types of fruits and vegetables (potatoes, corn, haricot (beans), apricots, peaches, apples, pears, and nuts). Their income comes from selling the gathered harvest in local markets, and that's why agriculture is very important to them. 

Zoya has requested this loan to purchase seeds and fuel for transporting the gathered harvest to the market. This will give them an opportunity to cultivate more vegetables and gather more harvest. Despite the fact that both Zoya and her husband are retired, they are very hardworking and attractive farmers and run their farm with great love and pleasure. They hope to receive your support and continue the expansion of their farm.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and fuel.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Please meet 30-year-old Fatu from St. Paul in Liberia. St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for their fish, due to its location by the sea. St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past the Freeport. It is one of the poorer areas and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. 

Fatu completed 10 grades and is married. Her husband is a teacher. She has 5 children between the ages of 10 and 1. Three are in school and they all live at home. Fatu owns her own shop and has been selling used clothes for the past 5 years. She will use the loan proceeds to purchase more used clothes for her business. 
 
On average, she works 10 hours a day at her business. She started her business with money from her husband. She transports her merchandise by taxi.  She cites her small income as her biggest challenge. Her favorite part of her business is the profit making. In the future, she would like to build a house. She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is engaged in fishing with her husband in Bien Unido, Bohol. They have been in the business for more than 30 years now. This is the source of their income. 

Veronica is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and others supplies. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. Veronica dreams of expanding their fishing business and making it a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Divino Niño Group

texts.es:
