Hazel requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional equipment for barbering. In the future, Hazel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment for her barber shop

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of one child, Marieta works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from keeping a general store and owning a house for rent.

Marieta is borrowing PHP 4,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy more ingredients for the foods she will serve at her restaurant. Marieta has been sustaining her business activities, with the help of one previous loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save money and expand her business even more.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for the foods she will serve at her restaurant.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine has been involved in agriculture for 12 years. Over these 12 years of hard work, Marine now owns a beautiful and successful farm which includes 20 chickens and a pig and also comprises a plot of agricultural land where she cultivates corn, cucumbers, tomatoes and greens. 

Marine lives in a small and beautiful village Poqr Vedi, which is located in Ararat region. She lives together with her husband and two children who help her with farming activities. 

Marine's only income comes from agriculture; that's why it is very important for her to enlarge her farm and earn more income. In applying for this loan Marine plans to purchase fertilizer and seeds for expanding the cultivation of the land.

Marine has great plans for her farm and she hopes that lenders will support her to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and seeds for cultivation

loans.name: Margarit

texts.en:
Margarit works at a local bakery and has many years of experience in this field. Margarit lives in Vedi village with her family which consists of her husband and three grown-up children. In order to cover family costs Margarit is also involved in agriculture. She owns a small plot of land where she cultivates tomatoes, peaches, apricots, and apples. Margarit's husband doesn't work and helps her with running the farm. He sells the gathered harvest in the local market and gets income which is very important for them.

Margarit has applied for this loan to pay for wheat and fertilizer, which is very important for successful cultivation of their land. This loan is important for the whole family to earn more income and make their life better.

They wait for your support!

loans.use: to pay for wheat and fertilizer

loans.name: Anna's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de 7 femmes unies par de bonnes relations sociales et économiques. Anna est la représentante du groupe, elle est âgé de 44 ans ,marié et mère de 4 enfants dont 2 garçons et 2 filles.ils ont 22,19,17,et 11 ans. Elle fait du commerce de chaussures de boubous et de parfum.Elle part dans un pays frontalier pour acheter  sa marchandise ,puis elle dédouane et vient chez elle pour vendre.Elle s'en sorte très bien et son point fort s'est le faite qu'elle a beaucoup de connaissance et sait comment négocier pour recouvrer son argent.Avec son prêt elle compte acheter 50 paires de chaussures garçons à 175000f; 50 paires filles à 100000f, 20 boubous de bazin teint à 250000f. Avec ses bénéfices elle paie le scolarité de ses enfants et aide son marie dans les dépenses familiales .
texts.en:
This group is composed of seven women, united by good social and economic relationships. Anna is the group representative; she is 44, married, and the mother of four children, two sons and two daughters, aged 22, 19, 17, and 11. She sells shoes, boubous (wide African robes) and perfume. She goes to a neighboring country to buy her merchandise and after going through customs, comes home to sell her goods.

She does very well at this and her strong point is the fact that she knows a lot of people and knows how to negotiate to recoup her money. With her loan she intends to buy  50 pairs of shoes for boys for 175,000 f; 50 pairs of shoes for girls for 100,000 f, and 20 boubous made of dyed damask for 250,000 f. With her profit she pays her children's school fees and helps her husband with family expenses.

loans.use: to buy 50 pairs of shoes for boys for 175,000 f; 50 pairs of shoes for girls for 100,000 f, and 20 boubous made of dyed damask for 250,000 f.

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en:
Oretha, a 40-year-old business woman from Liberia, is married and has seven children between the ages of 25 and 12. Only three are currently attending school, and they all live at home. Oretha completed grade 12 before starting her business. She describes herself as a hardworking woman.

Oretha lives and works in Buchanan, the capital City of Grand Bassa County. It is located by the sea and is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents love eating fufu, cassava based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia.

For the past three years Oretha has had a table business which sells fresh fish. She works from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. daily, and her greatest business challenge is low income. Oretha intends to use the loan to buy more fresh fish to resell. She hopes to one day own a house.

Oretha wants to thank Kiva lenders in advance for their help.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to resell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a Liberian. She resides in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County. The county is located by the sea and is known for its beaches and fish. In addition, many logging companies are also located in the city. People in Buchanan are known in the country for their love of fufu, a cassava based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. 

Elizabeth is 30, married with three children 12 to 5 years old who are currently living at home and attending school. She has owned her own small shop selling bread with fry eggs, tea, etc. for the past five years. She will use the loan proceeds to purchase more eggs, bread, oil, milk, sugar, tea, etc.  

On average, she works eight hours at her business from Monday to Saturday. She started her business with a small amount of money from her husband. She transports her merchandise by shared taxi. She cites the rainy season as her biggest challenge. Her favorite part of her business is the money she makes. In the future, she would like to build a house.  

She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more eggs, bread, oil, milk, sugar, tea, etc.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 35-year-old businesswoman from Liberia.  She is married and has three children, between 19 and 2 years old.  Only two are currently attending school, and they all live at home.  Ruth completed the sixth grade, before starting her business.  She describes herself as a hard-working woman.

She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County. Buchanan is located by the sea.  It is well-known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are also based in the city.  Residents of the city love eating 'fufu,' a dish made from a cassava-based dough that is typically eaten with soup or sauce.  Most people in the city speak Bassa, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia.
 
Ruth has a table business, where she has been selling food items like Vita, oil, pepper, and onion, for the past three years.  She started in business by selling for her mother.  She works at her business from 8:00AM to 4:00PM each day.  Her greatest challenge in business is low income. She intends to use the loan to buy more Vita, oil, pepper, onion and similar items, to resell at her table.  She likes her business, because it helps her to support her home.  She hopes one day to own a house.  She wants to thank the Kiva lenders, in advance, for their help.

loans.use: to buy more Vita, oil, pepper, onion and similar items, to resell at her table business.

loans.name: Denis Patricia

texts.es: Denis Patricia es una mujer de 38 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Actualmente se dedica a vender postres, actividad que aprendió cuando decidió capacitarse para poder trabajar como independiente y generar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. El crédito que solicita con la Corporación será invertido en un curso de capacitación, que le permitirá ampliar sus conocimientos y poder aumentar la venta de sus productos para generar mayores ingresos económicos. Su principal sueño es tener un buen negocio que le permita mantener una estabilidad económica y un mejor nivel de calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Denis Patricia is a 38 year-old woman. She is single and does not have children. 

She currently earns a living selling desserts. She learned this activity when she decided to train to be able to work independently to generate the income required to maintain her home. 

The loan that she is requesting from Kiva will be invested in an advanced training course. This will allow her to expand her knowledge and to increase her sales to generate a higher income. 

Her dream is to have a good business that provides economic stability and a better quality of life.

loans.use: pay for an advanced training course.

loans.name: Jovulet

texts.en:
Jovulet is aged 63 years and a widow. She has six children, only one of whom is still in school. She also has one orphan who stays with her, because of vulnerable reasons.

Now she has taken a loan of UGX 1,000,000. She is going to finish up her rental houses. She has no other sources of income. She started this business in 2002, when a university was set up in her area, which led to a higher demand for housing by students. She is going to finish the rentals before the school term begins.

She started the rental business with the aim of getting school fees for her children. Her major challenge is paying tuition for her child at university. Another challenge is that the rental income is irregular. She hopes that after finishing, her rental income will increase. She is a hard-working lady. She thanks the institution for coming to her rescue, in a time of need.

loans.use: To buy things needed to finish up the rental units, including paint and cement

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Jose está en su ciclo número 7 del programa de comité de mujeres. Ellas gracias al trabajo en conjunto que vienen haciendo a través de los ciclos están pudiendo mejorar sus vidas y las de su familia, y esa es la pretensión de cada una de ellas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Jeremias, quien se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de productos, como ser ropas, perfumes, zapatos y todos esos accesorios. También se debe destacar que ella es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante e ir mejorando su vida, es por lo cual se viene esforzando.
La Sra. Jeremias Solicita de este crédito para la compra de de prendas, calzados, perfumes y demás, con lo que podrá seguir haciendo sus ventas y procurando los ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: The “San José” group is in its seventh cycle in the women’s committee program.  Thanks to the work that they are doing together through the loan cycles, they are able to improve their lives and the lives of their families, and that is the aspiration of each one of them.  One of the members is Jeremías, who is engaged in the sale of all types of products such as clothing, perfume, shoes, and all the accessories. In addition, it must be noted that she is a person with a great desire to succeed and improve her life and for this reason, she is working hard.  Jeremías is requesting this loan for the purchase of clothing, footwear, perfume, and other items so that she can continue making sales and earning income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase of clothing, footwear, perfume, and other items.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.es:
La señora Ninfa es costurera, elabora juego de sabanas; vive en casa propia con un acabado fino y piso de machimbre, su vivienda esta ubicada el la zona de Irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz.
Ninfa elabora juego de sabanas, del cual genera sus ingresos para cubrir sus gastos de alimentación, luz, agua;  el crédito lo  requiere para la compra de materia prima comprara tela, encaje, hilo; para mejorar su ingresos y su calidad de vida.
El sueño de Ninfa es tener un taller de costura.
texts.en:
Ninfa is a seamstress, and she makes sets of bed sheets. She lives in her own house with wood flooring. Her home is located in the Irpavi area of La Paz. 
Ninfa makes sets of bed sheets from which she earns income to cover her food, electricity, water. She needs the loan to buy raw materials such as fabric, lace, and thread, which will improve her income and her quality of life.
Ninfa dreams of owning her own seamstress shop.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado SAN CAYETANO está en su ciclo número cuarto del programa de comité de mujeres, donde ellas formaron un grupo muy trabajador y unido, donde ponen todo de sí y se esfuerzan por crecer.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lucía, quien se dedica a la decoración de eventos, comenta que es muy hábil en lo que hace, y eso la ayuda a hacerse promoción por sí misma y de esa forma hacerse de muy buena clientela, ella es muy trabajadora, y cuenta que gracias a su buen trabajo está saliendo adelante y dando a su familia todo lo que necesitan.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, globos, cintas y demás productos para poder seguir con su trabajo y por medio de eso seguir ayudando a su familia. Todas agradecen por la oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The group called SAN CAYETANO is in its fourth cycle of the women's committee program. They form a very hard-working and united group, where they give of themselves entirely and make an effort to grow.

One of the members is Lucía, who makes a living by decorating for events. She comments that she is very skilled in what she does, and that helps her to promote herself and thus gather a very good clientele. She is very hard-working and says that thanks to her good work she is getting ahead and giving her family everything it needs.

She is asking for this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of fabrics, balloons, ribbons and other products to be able to continue with her work and thus keep helping her family. All of the women appreciate the opportunity that they are receiving.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, balloons, ribbons and other products

loans.name: Alba Nelly

texts.es: Alba Nelly es una mujer soltera y madre cabeza de hogar. Actualmente se dedica a atender su negocio donde vende todo lo relacionado con productos para peluquería y belleza en general, después de haber laborado muchos años como operaria, en una empresa de confecciones. Es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada, mientras laboraba en las confecciones fue ahorrando hasta completar su capital para montar su propio negocio, en el cual labora largas jornadas cada día. Con el crédito que solicita desea comprar dos vitrinas para exhibir los productos y más surtido (tratamientos capilares, cosméticos, esmaltes para uñas, tintes) con el fin de tener mayor disponibilidad de productos y diversidad de marcas para satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes. Su principal sueño es montar otro negocio en un local más central para que su hija lo administre y de esta forma incrementar sus ingresos para el sostenimiento de las necesidades de su hogar.
texts.en:
Alba Nelly is a single mother head of household. Currently she has a business selling hair salon and beauty products in general after having worked many years in a dressmaking business. She is a very hardworking and dedicated woman. While she worked as a dressmaker she saved money until she had enough capital set aside to start her own business. She worked long hours every day to do so.

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase two glass cabinets to display her merchandise, as well as more supplies (hair treatments, cosmetics, nail polish, dyes) with the goal of having a greater diversity and quantity of products available to satisfy her clients’ needs.

Her principal dream is to start another business in a more central location so that her daughter can manage it and in this way she can increase her income and thus support her household’s needs.

loans.use: to purchase two glass cabinets to display her products and more supplies (hair treatments, cosmetics, nail polish and dyes).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make repairs on her home

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La señora Martha tiene una tienda de barrio en su domicilio, vive en casa propia en un acabado de fino y piso de machimbre, su vivienda esta ubicada el la zona de Irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz.
Martha tiene una tienda de barrio donbde vende diversos productos, del cual genera sus ingresos para cubrir sus gastos de alimentación, luz, agua;  el crédito lo  requiere para el aumento de capital comprara gaseosas, galletas, arroz, azúcar y otros para surtir su tienda y asi mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
El sueño de Martha es ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Martha has a neighborhood store in her home. She lives in her own home, with finished walls and tongue and groove wood flooring. Her home is located in the Irpavi area of the city of La Paz.

Martha has a neighborhood store where she sells various products, from which she generates income to cover expenses for food, electricity and water. She needs the loan to increase her working capital. She will buy soft drinks, cookies, rice, sugar and other items to stock her store and thus improve her income and her quality of life.

Martha's dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, cookies, rice, sugar and other items for her neighborhood store.

loans.name: Dayana

texts.es:
La señorita Dayana es empleada de un restaurante;vive en  alquiler con sus padres con un acabado de adobe y piso de cemento, su vivienda esta ubicada el la zona de Irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz.
Dayana es empleada, del cual genera sus ingresos para cubrir sus gastos de alimentación, transporte y educación,  el crédito lo  requiere para la matricula de universidad ella estudiara administración de empresas y así mejorar su nivel de educación.
El sueño de Dayana es culminar sus estudios
texts.en:
Srta. Dayana works at a restaurant. She lives with her parents in a rental property that contains a pair of rooms that have an adobe finish and cement floors. Her home is located in the Irpavi area of the city of La Paz.

Dayana is employed and the income from her job is used to cover expenses such as food, transportation, and education. The loan she is requesting will be used for her university tuition. She is studying Business Administration and in this way she will improve her level of education.

Dayana’s dream is to finish her studies.

loans.use: to pay the university tuition where she is studying business administration.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario se dedica a la elaboración de diversas masitas, vive en casa propia en un acabado fino  y piso de cemento, su vivienda esta ubicada el la zona de Irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz.
Rosario elabora masitas como ser empanadas, queques y otros, para cubrir sus gastos de alimentación, luz, agua; el crédito lo requiere para la compra de insumos como ser harina, azúcar, mantequilla, y asi mejorar su ingresos y su calidad de vida.
El sueño de Rosario es tener su pastelería.
texts.en: Rosario works making various baked goods. She lives in her own finished house that has a cement floor; it’s located in the city of La Paz’s Irpavi zone. Rosario makes baked goods like turnovers, cakes and other baked goods to pay for her food, electricity and water costs. She needs the loan to buy ingredients like flour, sugar and butter to improve her income and her quality of life. Rosario’s dream is to own her own pastry shop.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for use in her bakery.

loans.name: Marco

texts.es:
Marco  es carpintero, elabora muebles y puertas de madera, vive en casa de sus padres en un acabado fino y piso de machimbre, su vivienda está ubicada en la zona de Irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz.
Marco  es carpintero, del cual genera sus ingresos para cubrir sus gastos de alimentación, luz, agua;  el crédito lo  requiere para la compra de materia prima (madera) y así aumentar su producción y  mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
El sueño de  Marco  es ampliar su taller de carpintería y terminar sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en: Marco is a carpenter; he makes wooden furniture and doors. He lives in his parents’ house; it is a finished home with a wood floor. His house is located in the city of La Paz’s Irpavi zone. Marco is a carpenter and earns income to cover his food, electricity and water expenses. He needs the loan to buy raw materials (wood) to increase production and improve his income and quality of life. Marco’s dream is to expand his carpentry shop and to finish his university studies.

loans.use: to buy wood for use in his carpentry business.

loans.name: Diana Yaneth

texts.es: Diana es una mujer de 26 años de edad, es madre de un hijo de 8 años y actualmente vive en unión libre con su pareja. Se dedica a la venta de productos Amway desde hace varios meses, actividad que conoció por medio de una amiga que la invitó a una charla sobre los productos. Inicialmente los compraba para su uso personal y luego comenzó a recomendarlos a las personas que conocía y, de esta forma comenzó a crecer su negocio, con lo cual ha obtenido ingresos para el sustento de su hogar. Con el crédito que solicita en la Corporación desea comprar más mercancía de Amway (productos de aseo para el hogar, aseo personal, vitaminas y nutrientes) con un descuento del 42%, con el fin de poder ofrecer más variedad y tener mayor rentabilidad en sus ventas. Su principal sueño es aumentar sus ventas hasta lograr ganancias millonarias por mes para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Diana is a 26 year-old woman, who is the mother of an 8 year-old son and lives in a common law relationship with her partner. She has been selling Amway products for several months, a business she learned about through a friend who invited her to a talk about the products. Initially she bought them for her personal use and then began to recommend them to people she knew and in this way her business began to grow. Thus she has generated an income to support her household.

With the loan she has requested from Interactuar she wants to purchase more Amway merchandise (household cleaning products, personal cleaning items, vitamins and nutrients) at a 42% discount with the goal of being able to offer more variety and of earning more profits in her sales. 

Her principal dream is to increase her sales to make millions in earnings each month in order to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more Amway merchandise (household cleaning products, personal cleaning items, vitamins and nutrients)

loans.name: Joselyn Verónica

texts.es: Joselyn Verónica, tiene la edad  de 18 años, está soltera,  vive con sus padres y hermanos, los cuales son mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de  algunos materiales  que le puedan facilitar la reparación de su vivienda y pagar mano de obra de la reparación, y de esta manera eliminar algunas  problemas de entradas de agua a la vivienda en el periodo de lluvia que ya está iniciando y así poderle ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Con esta compra pretende hacer una mejora de buena calidad a su casa y que su familia mejoré su calidad de vida y aprovechar precios bajos en algunos materiales y que son de buena calidad. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Joselyn Verónica is 18 years old, single, and lives with her parents and siblings, who are her greatest priority. With her loan she intends to buy some materials that can help with the repair of her home and pay laborers who will be making the repairs, and in this way eliminate some problems with water entering the home as the rainy season is now starting, and in this way she can offer a better quality of life for her family. With this purchase she intends to improve the quality of her house and the quality of life for her family, taking advantage of the lower prices for some good quality materials. This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR. She hasn't received other loans from banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided a loan more easily and with much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to make home repairs.

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.es: Rosalba es una señora de 69 años de edad, es viuda y madre de 4 hijos. Actualmente es ama de casa, pero desea capacitarse porque le gusta y además quiere montar un negocio con uno de sus hijos. El crédito que solicita es para el pago de un curso de Panificación que ofrece la Corporación, ya que ven es este curso una idea de negocio para un futuro cercano y de esta forma poder generar ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Su mayor sueño es poder montar su negocio, establecerlo y trabajar para que sea reconocido.
texts.en:
Rosalba is a 69 year-old lady. She is a widow and the mother of four offspring. Currently she is a homemaker but she wants to get training because she enjoys it and she wants to start a business with her children. 

She is applying for a loan to pay for a bread making course that Interactuar offers because this course gives her an idea for a business in the near future. In this way she will be able to generate an income to maintain her household.

Her greatest dream is to able to start a business, establish it and work so that it will be well known.

loans.use: to pay for a bread making course.

loans.name: Mujeres Con Propósito (Women With A Purpose) Group

texts.en:
This group is named Mujeres con Propósito (Women with a Purpose).  It is composed of 8 hard working women that participate in buying and selling and food production at the local market in Cuyotenango, Suchitepéquez.
The group is eager to learn more about their expenses and profits.  

Some of them have had their businesses for a long time and are aware that they do not know how to effectively manage their money and separate personal and business expenses.  

They are excited about the educational sessions they are going to receive and the monthly visit from the Business Advisor for the next  9 months.

One of the members of this group is Angélica, a 68 year old widow, who for 22 years has been selling small chickens (she buys 1 day chicks, feeds them for about a week and then sells them again).  Angelica has a 6th grade education.  

She has devoted her life to taking care of her family; her kids are all grown and one of them and his family now lives with her.  She supports herself and also provides for her son´s family.  Angélica is very well known in her community.  When she started this business she sold 100 little chicks per month and now she sells up to 3,000 chicks a month with an approximate profit of Q3,275 (US$425). She works 120 hours a month  averaging $3.54/hour.  

Angelica hired one person to help her take care of the chickens because last year she lost her sight in one eye due to a cataract. Her dream is to improve her profits by 29% to be able to save enough money for cataract surgery.

loans.use: Increase profit

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is Liberian. She resides in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa county. The county is located by the sea and is known for its beaches and fish. In addition, many logging companies are also located in the city. People from Buchanan are known for their love of fufu, a cassava based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. 

Esther is 46 years old, she is married and has three children between 26 and eight years old. Two of her children are currently living at home and attending school. Esther has owned her own business, selling rice, pepper, oil, vita, onions, etc., for the past eight years. She will use the requested loan proceeds to purchase more rice, pepper, oil, vita, onions, etc. to resell. On average, Esther works ten hours a day from Monday to Saturday. She started her business with a small amount of money from her husband. She transports her merchandise by shared taxi. Her largest challenge is the rainy season. Her favorite part of her business is her income. In the future, she would like to build a house. She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, oil, vita, onions, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es: Freddy, tiene la edad  de 18 años, está soltero, vive con sus padres y hermanos  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de una vaca con una cría al destete y también se encuentra preñada. La idea es aprovechar el espacio que tiene de pasto de buena calidad y con un desarrollo adecuado y la disponibilidad de agua potable y las buenas condiciones de terreno y clima para poder tener estos animales y a la vez obtener algo de leche y desarrollar terneros para en el futuro venderlos para carne. Con esta compra podrá desarrollar una actividad más, y a la vez tener un ahorro que le permitirá ir teniendo más animales e invertir más en la propiedad.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Freddy is 18-years-old, he is single, lives with his parents and brothers who are his main priority. With the loan he will buy a pregnant cow that also has a weaning calf. The idea is to take advantage of the following situation: space available with high quality grass, gradual development of the cow, the disposable water, the good condition of the land, the ideal climate to have animals, the ability to have milk, and growing the calves to sell them for meat in the future. With this purchase, he will be able to develop one more activity and simultaneously have a savings that will allow him to purchase more animals and invest in his property.

This is his first loan that he is receiving through Fudecosur. He has not had previous loans in banks, but Fudecosur has provided the loan with greater ease and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and meat

loans.name: Prudencia

texts.es:
Prudencia se dedica al lavado de arena y ademas elabora mantas de hilo para señoras de pollera, vive en alquiler con un acabado de abode y piso de cemento, su vivienda esta ubicada el la zona de Irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz.

Prudencia lava arena y elabora polleras, del cual genera sus ingresos para cubrir sus gastos de alimentación, luz, agua;  el crédito lo  requiere para el aumento de capital: comprará hilo para aumentar su producción de polleras y así mejorar su ingresos y su calidad de vida.
El sueño de Prudencia es tener un taller de tejido y tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Prudencia makes a living from washing sand and also makes shawls of thread for women who dress in the traditional manner. She lives in a rented adobe house with a cement floor. Her home is located in the Irpavi area of the city of La Paz.

Prudencia washes sand and makes traditional clothing, from which she generates her income to cover expenses for food, electricity and water. She requires the loan to increase her working capital. She will buy thread to increase her production of shawls and thus improve her earnings and her quality of life. 

Prudencia's dream is to have a weaving workshop, and to own a house.

loans.use: to buy thread for her business

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James lives in the Muranga area of Kenya, which lies in the central Rift Valley. He has 4 children and has been doing this work for 33 years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, crops, and an employer pension.

He stated that dairy farming is pleasurable to him because it is not labor-intensive and because of the regular income. His biggest challenge is a lack of water for irrigation. Animals on the farm have been given the names of Munyaka, meaning luck, and Wanjiku, after his late wife.

James said that he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because he wants to expand his farming projects. During Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, this client learned that microfinance gives loans with minimal collateral.

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. He said that this loan will benefit his family by allowing him to further expand his fairy business and earn more income. 

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. James owns a cow, poultry, and a pump, but does not own a pig, bicycle, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has a mosquito net, electricity, running water, TV, and DVD player in his house, but does not have solar power, or a sewing machine.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down."

loans.use: to purchase a dairy unit.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, tiene la edad  de 51 años, está casada,  vive con su esposo y sus hijos los cuales su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de semilla de frijol de buena calidad y que se desarrolle bien en las condiciones de la zona, fertilizantes adecuados y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra y así que tenga una buena geminación, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Rosa is 51 years old, married, and lives with her husband and their children which are her major priority. With this loan she intends to purchase bean seeds of good quality, and to assure that they will develop well under conditions in this zone, adequate fertilizers and other products for application to the crop, assuring a good germination. Also, she wishes to pay laborers for applying the products and assisting with the plants once they develop, in this way, assuring good results.

Rosa intends is to take advantage of the good climate and soil conditions the zone enjoys for the crop and, also, to put in practice her experience of various years in managing basic grains. In addition to being able to buy products of the best quality to assure that her plantings may have a good and healthy development and an adequate production, she hopes for an important harvest in the short run. 

The income Rosa expects to obtain from the harvest will be utilized for her family's well-being and the education of her children, and to comply with other family goals, plus continue investing in her crops.

This is Rosa's 1st loan through FUDECOSUR. She has had no previous loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered her the loan under the best terms and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to plant and raise beans on her farm.

loans.name: Leivis Eduardo

texts.es: Leivis Eduardo, tiene la edad  de 21 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa y su hija, los cuales su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra y así que tenga una buena geminación, y semilla de frijol de buena calidad, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también aprovechar  la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Leivis Eduardo is 21-years-old, is married, and lives with his wife and daughter who are his main priority. With his loan he will buy fertilizer and other products for sowing. This way he will have a good germination and seeds of beans that are good quality. Additionally, he will pay a workforce for the application of products and help in the plantation once he has growing harvest. This way he will be able to complete good work. 

He wants to take advantage of the good climate, good soil for this cultivation, and also take advantage of his experience for several years working with basic grains. Also he wants to be able to buy the best products of the best quality so that his plantation has a good crop, have a healthy suitable crop, and to have a short-term important production. 

With the income from the crops he hopes to be able to use it for the well-being and studies of his family. He hopes to accomplish some family goals and continue to invest in more crops. 

This is the first loan that he has received from Fudecosur. He has not had loans before, but Fudecosur has provided the loan with greater ease and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to harvest beans

loans.name: Noami

texts.en:
This is Noami from Liberia. She resides in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County.  The county is located by the sea and is known for its beaches and fish. In addition, many logging companies are also located in the city. People in Buchanan are known in the country for their love of fufu, a cassava based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. 

Noami is 26 years old and single with two children. Her children are between the ages of four and six. They are currently living at home and attend school.  Noami owns her own small shop selling fashion clothes and handbags, which she has done for the past eight years. She will use the loan proceeds to purchase more fashion clothes and handbags for her business.  

On average, she works 10 hours at her business from Monday to Saturday. She started her business with a small amount money from her fiancee. She transports her merchandise by shared taxi. She cites rainy season as her biggest challenge.  Her favorite part of her business is controlling her own money. In the future, she would like to build a modern shop.  

She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more fashion clothes and handbags for her business.

loans.name: Miama

texts.en:
This is 44-year-old Miama from St. Paul, Liberia. St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for its fish due to its location by the sea.  St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past the Free-port. It is one of the poorer areas and one will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. 

Miama completed 12th grade and is married to a policeman. She has three children between the ages of 20 and 13. Only two are in school and they all live at home. Miama has owned her own shop selling used clothes for the past five years. She will use the requested loan proceeds to purchase more used clothes for her business. On average, she works 10 hours a day at her business, which she started with money from her husband. She transports her merchandise by taxi and cites a small income as her biggest challenge. Her favorite part of her business is making a profit. In the future, she would like to build a house. She thanks you in advanced for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Rosas De Lima Group

texts.es:
La señora Miriam Alicia es casada, cuenta con 30 años de edad, de escolaridad primaria completa, tiene 4 hijos y de ellos 2 estan estudiando, ella se dedica a la crianza de ganado porcino, inició este negocio criando 2 cerditos y hasta la fehca lleva 8 años de experiencia, cuenta con el poyo de su esposo quien es agricultor.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de 7 cerditos y concentrado para los mismos, en el futuro desea mejorar su negocio con el apoyo que le darán con el préstamo, las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a crianza de animales domésticos.
texts.en:
Miriam Alicia is married, is 30-years-old, completed primary education, and has 4 children, two of which are studying. She works in the breading of pigs. She began this business raising 2 pigs and to date has had 8 years of experience. She counts on support from her husband who is a farmer. 

She organizes a group that requested a loan that she will use to buy 7 pigs and concentrate for the pigs. In the future she wants to improve her business with the help of the loan. The other members of the group work in the breeding of domestic animals.

loans.use: to purchase pigs

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 34 years old and married with four children.

Alma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, soap, milk, etc.

Alma has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and earns additional income from food vending.

Alma aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, soap, milk, etc

loans.name: El Rincon Group

texts.es: José Juan es un muchacho trabajador el vive en una localidad Mazahua, el se dedica al comercio de frutas y legumbres en la ciudad de México ya que tiene un puesto en la central de abastos, dice que trabaja de lunes a viernes y por la noche del viernes se regresa a su comunidad y su padre le ayuda a vender los días sábados y domingos, dice que emprendió su padre el negocio y como no alcanzaba lo que ganaba como jornalero su papa se lo llevo a trabajar en el puesto de México, con el tiempo hace 8 años se independizo ya que quería ganar su propio capital y también porque se caso joven y tenía que mantener a su familia y hacerles una casita para vivir, dice que con mucho esfuerzo ha sacado adelante su familia y mas porque dos de sus hijos estudian y quiere que tengan una carrera ya que el trabajo de comerciante es muy pesado, el está pidiendo un crédito para comprar frutas y legumbres de temporada ahí mismo en la central de abastos para revender en su puesto, dice que gracias a VisionFund su negocio ha crecido. José Juan dejo descansar un ciclo porque tuvo un accidente en una moto y que estuvo fracturado de su pie y le era imposible viajar para hacer sus pagos, ahora que está bien quiere surtir un poco mas de fruta de mejor calidad para vender un poco mas ya que es lo que busca el cliente calidad y bajos precios. Los demás integrantes del grupo se llaman Gonzalo, Silvino, Ausencio, Camila, Albina, Eliseo y María Carmen ellos invertirán en sus negocios de cultivo de aguacate y para la compra de insumos para mejorar huerto, para la compra de frutas y legumbres de temporada y para la compra de borregos para cría y venta.
texts.en:
Jose Juan is a hard worker and lives in Mazahua. He works in the sale of fruits and vegetables in Mexico City. He has a place in the center of the grocery store. He says that he works Monday through Friday and Friday night he returns to his neighborhood. His father helps him to sell on Saturday and Sunday. He says that he learned the business from his father because he did not earn enough as a laborer that his father would take him to work in the storefront in Mexico.  Eight years ago he become independent which had taken time because he wanted to earn his own income and also because he was young and had to support his family. He made them a small house to live in.  He says that with a lot of effort he has been able to get his family ahead. He has two children who are studying and he wants them to have a career because working as a salesman is very difficult. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase fruit and vegetables that are in season in the central grocery store to resell them at his store. He says that thanks to VisionFund his business has grown. Jose Juan had to stop working for a time because he had a motorcycle accident and had a foot fracture. It was impossible for him to travel to complete his payments. Now that he is well he wants to supply more fruit at a good quality to sell more because his clients search for quality at low prices. 

The other members of the group are: Gonzalo, Silvino, Ausencio, Camila, Albina, Eliseo and María Carmen. They invest in their business such as the growing of avocado, to purchase supplies to improve garden and to purchase fruit and vegetables in season, and the purchase and breading of sheep.

loans.use: to purchase fruit and vegetables in season

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is 44 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. Celia works very hard to provide for them.

Celia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 40,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Celia has been in this business for 17 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Celia would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Yarmah

texts.en:
This is Yarmah from Liberia. She resides in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County. The county is located by the sea and is known for its beaches and fish. In addition, many logging companies are also located in the city. People in Buchanan are known in the country for their love of fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. 

She is 39 and married with three children. Her children are between the ages of 23 and 11. Only one is currently living at home, and two are in school. 
 
Yarmah owns her own small local shop business, selling drinks for the past 10 years. She will use the loan proceeds to purchase more drinks (soft drinks, beer, etc.) for her business.
  
On average, she works 10 hours at her business from Monday to Saturday. She started her business with a small amount of money from her husband. She transports her merchandise by shared taxi. She cites the rainy season as her biggest challenge. Her favorite part of her business is controlling her own money. In the future, she would like to build a modern shop.  

She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more drinks (soft drinks, beer, etc.) for her business.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is a 44-year-old married man. He has seven children with ages ranging from 2 years to 15 years. He describes himself to be a problem solver, innovative and creative. 

He operates a farm where he keeps livestock. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a semi-arid area, and his primary customers are seasonal customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be shortage of capital. 

He will use the 10,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy a cow. His business goal is to expand more within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his living standards. He will use the anticipated profits to buy more cattle.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Bonifas

texts.en: Boniface is a 35-year-old married man. He has 1 child. He describes himself to be aggressive. He operates a butcher shop where he sells meat. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in an area fit for business and his primary customers are hotels and workers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be government policies. He will use the 20,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan to add stocks of meat. His business goal is to be stable and successful within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of meat

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 29-year-old single woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates an M-pesa business, where she offers M-pesa services, i.e., withdrawing money and depositing. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are local subscribers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

She will use the 30,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan to add float. Her business goal is to open a mobile phones and accessories shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans of 20,000 KES and 10,000 KES were paid successfully. Previously, she was involved in poultry farming.

loans.use: add float to her M-pesa money transfer business.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 40-year-old married man. He has 5 children. He describes himself to be committed. He operates a farm where he keeps sheep. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in an area fit for business and his primary customers are butcheries.

He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. He will use the 20,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan to buy more sheep. His business goal is to be stable and successful within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to pay back his children's school fees and repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy more sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to open another salon: buy hair weaves, cosmetics, equipment and rent a place, etc.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is a married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 6 years to 14 years. She describes herself as polite. She is a hawker and she sells biscuits, suits, torches, key holders etc. on the streets. She has been involved in this business for 14 years. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are local residents.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in climatic conditions, especially during the rainy season as selling becomes difficult. She will use the 50,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan to buy materials such as iron sheets and nails to put up a permanent shop. Her business goal is to have a large shop within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy materials like iron sheets and nails to put up a permanent shop

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is a married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 15 years to 26 years. She describes herself as organized and honest. She operates a retail store where she sells sugar, rice, maize flour, wheat flour etc. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a favorable place and her primary customers are local residents.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finance to expand. She will use the 50,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan to add stocks of rice, sugar, wheat and maize flour etc. Her business goal is to be well established and generating a good income within 5 years. She will use the profits to expand the business and repay the loan.

loans.use: to add stock of rice, sugar, wheat and maize flour etc.

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en:
Oretha is a Liberian. She resides in Buchanan, the capital of Grand Bassa County.  The county is located by the sea and is known for the beaches and fish.  In addition, many logging companies are also located in the city.  People in Buchanan are known in the country for their love of fufu, a cassava based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.
 
Oretha is 30 years old and married with a nine-year-old child who is currently living at home and attending school. Oretha has owned her own small shop business selling lappa (traditional cloths) and slippers for the past eight years.  She will use the loan proceeds to purchase more lappa and slippers. On average, she works 10 hours at her business from Monday to Saturday.  She started her business small money from her husband. She transports her merchandise by shared taxi.  She cites rainy season as her biggest challenge.  Her favorite part of her business is the money she makes.  In the future, she would like to build a house.  

She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more lappa and slippers.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a 48-year-old married woman. She has two children, ages 21 and 24 years old. Lucy describes herself as an optimistic woman. She operates a retail business, where she sells cereals, drinks, snacks, beauty products, etc. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located within a [good] potential business area and her primary customers are local residents. Lucy describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use this 40,000 Kenyan shilling loan to add stock of drinks, cereals, snacks, etc. Her business goal is to have more branches and create employment within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of drinks, cereals, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia has more than five years of experience in the carpet cleaning industry and has owned her own company for the same amount of time. Along with her two part-time employees, Patricia offers carpet and tile cleaning services for residential properties in the San Antonio area.

One day while searching online for opportunities to apply for business loans, Patricia came across the Accion Texas Inc. website, www.acciontexas.org. She inquired with the microlender and began taking the necessary steps to apply for a microloan. Once approved for her Accion loan, Patricia utilized the money to pay for marketing and advertising efforts. She began contracting with vendors to create fliers, informational door hangers, and a website for her business. Her goal is to grow her business large enough to hire an additional two part-time employees.

Patricia said without the loan, "I would not have been able to pay for marketing and continue to grow my business."

loans.use: to pay for marketing and advertising efforts.

loans.name: Yucabeth

texts.en: Yucabeth is a Kiva borrower aged 27 years. She is married and has one child. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a chemist to earn an income where she sells different types of medicine. The business is located in a competitive area. She has been in this business for three years now and she faces a challenge of lack of capital. She will use the loan of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to add to her stock of medicine for resale. She hopes that in the future she will own a bigger chemist. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of medicine for resale

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Start-up business owner, Jessica, has more than five years experience in the magazine business.  Jessica and her business partner, Izanama, decided to publish a beauty guide for the residents in the Dallas and Fort Worth area.  

The Beauty Guide, a premiere resource directory for beauty services and products around the Dallas area is printed and also available online.  This publication provides individuals with a range of information regarding local beauty industry professionals and related products and services.  

Inside the publication you will find beauticians, spas, eyelash salons, nail salons, tanning salons, barbers, beauty colleges, waxing salons, makeup artists, weaveologists, wig salons, natural hairstylists and many more services at your fingertips.

The first issue is scheduled to be released Summer 2013 in over 500 locations throughout Dallas and Fort Worth, including local Central Markets, Kroger Grocery Stores and HEB.

Jessica and her business partner came to Accion Texas Inc. after discovering the microlender from the Small Business Administration.  Once referred to Accion, they applied and received approval for their $5,450 loan.  The loan allowed the duo to pay for web design, marketing, printing and advertising.

Without the Accion loan, Jessica and Izanama said “we would not have been able to start our business together.”

loans.use: to pay for web design, marketing, printing and advertising.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 34-year-old married woman. She has one child who is 8 years old. She describes herself to be self-driven and independent. She operates a health supplements shop where she sells health supplements. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are clinics and individuals.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of knowledge from the community about health supplements. She will use the 20,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan to add stock of health supplements. Her business goal is to have a supplements super-store within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, her business will have branches all over the country. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add to her stock of health supplements

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is a 50 year-old woman who has been engaged in raising hogs for six years now.  She live in Valencia, Bohol with her family. She is married with five children. Her eldest is 27 and her youngest is 14 years old. Amalia is asking for a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy two sacks of hog-grower, one sack of hog-starter and two sacks of fattener. She hopes that with her loan she can maintain and expand her business and make it more profitable.

Her income will be used for food and school fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of hog-grower, one sack of hog-starter and two sacks of fattener

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is a 62 year-old woman from Valencia Bohol. She is married with five grown children. Ana is engaged in selling home-cooked snacks such as puto (rice cake). She also helps her husband in their rice farming business.  Her business started 10 years ago and earns her 6,000 PHP per month. She is asking for a loan to buy cooking oil, flour, and vanilla extract. Her income provides food for herself and her husband.

In the future, she hopes to make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, flour, and vanilla extract

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Creating comedy and drama films out of the greater Dallas area, Anthony is a director with multiple upcoming projects and five complete films.  When he’s not filming creatively, Anthony offers free filming to local businesses as a way to market himself and the other business on YouTube.

But to keep the reel moving, Anthony decided to apply for an Accion Texas Inc. loan and upgrade his equipment and continue producing his nine upcoming films and bid on advertising contracts. 

Since his approval for his Accion loan, Anthony is now able to compete against other filmmakers and was awarded a contract to work with the Baylor Hospital. His business, Good Luck Pictures, has participated in multiple film festivals, such as the Bare Bones Film Festival in Oklahoma. His website has a full list of upcoming films. View it to find Anthony’s range of style: http://www.goodluckpictures.com/.

loans.use: to update equipment.

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
Azucena is 42 years old from Valencia, Bohol. She is married with three children ages 8 to 14.
She is engaged in a food-vending business making food like pancakes, banana cue (deep fried banana in caramelized sugar), and turon (deep-fried ripe banana in a lumpia wrapper). 

She is asking for a loan of 4000 PHP to be used for school fees.  Her income helps in meeting the needs of her family and help support the income of her husband from rice farming.

In the future,  she hopes that all her children will be successful in their studies.

loans.use: to pay for school fees

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 38-year-old married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 6 years to 15 years. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a bakery where he cooks cakes, African doughnuts, etc., for sale. He uses a motorcycle to transport his products to buyers. He has been involved in this business for one year. His business is located in an area good for business, and his primary customers are local residents.

He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds to expand the business. He will use the 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan to buy wheat flour, cooking oil and other items to boost his business. His business goal is to be a wholesale supplier of cakes within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, cooking oil and other items to boost his business.

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline is a 40-year-old married woman. She has six children with ages ranging from 9 months to 15 years. She describes herself to be hopeful. She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables. Her business is located in a rural area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of stock. 

She will use the 5,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan to add stock of vegetables like tomatoes, kale, onions, etc. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to feed and educate her children. She will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan.

loans.use: to add stock of vegetables like tomatoes, kale, onions, etc.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is a 58 year old from the community of Valencia, Bohol. She is married with two adult children. Carmen’s husband is a carpenter. She has been helping support the family by operating a Sari-sari store (variety store) business for six years now. She sell toiletries, canned goods, noodles, eggs, and seasoning. She is asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy additional stocks of shampoo, bath soap, coffee, cooking oil, biscuits, and canned goods. Her income provides food for her family.
 
In the future, she hopes to have a bigger business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of shampoo, bath soap, coffee, cooking oil, biscuits, and canned goods

loans.name: Enrica

texts.en:
Enrica is 45 years old from Valencia, Bohol. She is married with five children ages 3 to 14. Her husband works as a rice farmer. For eight years now, Enrica has been engaged in a food vending business. She sell siakoy (a fried dough twisted and sprinkled with sugar). She earns an average income of 6,000 PHP per month from this business. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy flour, sugar and vanilla extract.

In the future, she hopes to see her children graduate from College and be successful.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, and vanilla extract

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 40 years old, from the town of Valencia, Bohol. She is married with four children, ages 12 to 15. She has engaged in a hog raising business for 15 years now, earning her 6000 PHP per month. She is asking for a loan of 6000 PHP to buy additional piglets to raise. The income that she generates from this business helps her meet basic household needs like food and school fees for her children.

In the future, she hopes to become a more successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Wendell

texts.en:
At the age of 5, Wendell knew he had the knack to rap, but he never took music seriously until he reached 19, when he began recording and producing music. “I knew I could do some nice things with it and open a lot of doors,” he says, reflecting on his initial thoughts of rapping. He says now, “My goal is to try to make a million copies and sell to people; that’s my goal.”

Rapping about life, poverty, life-changing experiences, and general struggles under the name “Lock”, Wendell records and produces his own music in his home. Determined to be successful, Wendell converted a former pool house in his back yard into a studio where he produces music off a Compaq computer his mother gave him. Earning $500 to $2,000 per show, the Baton Rouge native plans to be noticed by major labels. Wendell says he tries to perform three shows per month, but it has been slow. He says he could record and produce other rapper’s music, and is currently taking courses in audio engineering for that, but says he needs to prioritize his wants and needs and is focusing on himself at the moment.

Needing funds to further his label, Wendell ventured to Accion Texas Inc. after a friend informed him about the nonprofit microlender. “Y’all really helped me out a lot,” he says about Accion. The loan went to update the old computer and purchase studio equipment including monitors, programs, microphones, microphone stands, headphones, and photo shoots. He doesn’t yet have a website but is using the free video site, YouTube, to house his music videos. Check out his music there: http://bit.ly/11ZOHq5

As Wendell continues to work alone, he reminds himself of one thing along the way: “I always keep God first in everything I do; without him we are nothing.”

loans.use: to update his equipment.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a Liberian. She resides in Buchanan, the capital of Grand Bassa County. The county is located by the sea and is known for the beaches and fish.  In addition, many logging companies are located in the city.  People in Buchanan are known in the country for their love of fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce
. 
Martha is 30 years old and married with seven children between 20 and 2 years old.  Only four of her children are currently living at home and attending school. Martha has owned her own table business selling red oil and rice for the past eight years.  She will use the loan proceeds to purchase more rice and oil to resell.
  
On average, she works 10 hours at her business from Monday to Saturday.  She started her business with a small amount of money from her husband. She transports her merchandise by shared taxi.  She cites the rainy season as her biggest challenge.  Her favorite part of her business is the money she makes.  In the future, she would like to build a house.  

She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more rice and oil to resell.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is a Liberian. She resides in Buchanan, the capital of Grand Bassa County.  The county is located by the sea and is known for the beaches and fish.  In addition, many logging companies are located in the city.  People in Buchanan are known in the country for their love of fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.
 
Marie is 30 years old, married and has six children between 20 and 13 years old.  Only four are currently living at home and attending school. 
 
Marie has owned her own small shop business selling rice, soap, pepper, oil, etc for the past eight years.  She will use the loan proceeds to purchase more rice, soap, pepper, oil, etc to resell. On average, she works 10 hours at her business from Monday to Saturday.  She started her business with a small amount of money from her husband. She transports her merchandise by shared taxi.  She cites the rainy season as her biggest challenge.  Her favorite part of her business is the money she makes.  In the future, she would like to build a house.  

She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more rice, soap, pepper, oil, etc to resell.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is 49 years old, from the municipality of Valencia, Bohol. She is married with two adult children. For 20 years now, she has been engaged in selling home-cooked snacks like banana cue (deep-fried banana in caramelized sugar) and tuba (coconut wine). Her business helps her meet the needs of her family while supporting her husband, who is a farmer. She is asking for a loan of 7000 PHP to buy flour, bananas, sugar, sesame seeds, margarine and cooking oil.

In the future, she hopes to continue improving her business for a better profit.

loans.use: to buy flour, bananas, sugar, sesame seeds, margarine and cooking oil.

loans.name: Arnel

texts.en:
Arnel earns a living through his sari-sari or variety store business, selling various goods and items to the people in his area. Arnel lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. 

Arnel is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell in his store like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, and others. With this, he will be able to improve his store and attract more buyers, thus augmenting his sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in his store like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, and others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: with studio expansion, equipment purchase and marketing.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is from the community of Valencia, Bohol. She is married with six children ages 12-29. Nora sells Ukay-ukay (slightly used branded clothes) for a living in order to support her family. She is asking for a loan to buy more blouses, t-shirts and shorts that she can resell at a profit. 

In the future, she hopes to continue sending her children to school and see them become successful.

loans.use: to buy more blouses, t-shirts and shorts.

loans.name: San Isidro Labrador Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Isidro Labrador esta integrado por 7 mujeres, cada una de ellas tiene una actividad en económica la cual desarrolla con el objetivo de brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Este grupo se encuentra ubicado en una comunidad donde la principal actividad económica esta en el campo en la siembra y cultivo de caña de azúcar.

Doña Francisca es integrante de este grupo y platica que  por mas de 7 años se a dedicado a la venta de carne cerdo, ella realiza sus ventas, una vez por semana y un día antes de la venta sale casa por casa con sus con sus amigas y vecinos para ofrecer la carne y levanta pedidos para el dia siguiente alinear el cerdo y salir a entregar la carne. Ella comenta que al cerdo se le aprovecha mucho ya que vende la carne pero también hace carnitas, chicharrones, tacos dorados  y carne enchilada lo cual ayuda a tener más ganancias.
Un crédito de VisionFund le dará la oportunidad de comprar más cerdo para continuar con sus ventas.
Ella espera que su negocio continúe progresando ya que tiene 3 hijos y quiere seguirles dando estudios y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Ella y sus compañeras agradecen la oportunidad de obtener un crédito ya que por medio de él podrán invertir en sus negocios y hacerlos progresar.
Los demás integrantes de grupo son:
Concepción –venta de pollo
Minerva-Venta de antojitos
Ines-Venta de ropa
Felipa-Venta de ropa
Marcelina-Venta de ropa
Cecilia-Venta de antojitos.
texts.en:
The group San Isidro Labrador is made up of 7 women, each one of whom carries out a different economic activity with the goal of giving her family a better quality of life. The group is located in a community where the main source of income is in agriculture, planting and harvesting sugar cane. 

Francisca is one of the members of this group, and she says that for more than 7 years she has sold pork. She makes her sales once a week, and on the day before the sale she goes house to house with her friends and neighbors to offer them the meat and take orders. The next day she lines up the pork and goes out to deliver the meat. She says that she takes full advantages of the pigs, not only selling the meat but also making carnitas, pork rinds, tacos and enchilada meat that helps her to earn more money. 

A loan from VisionFund will give her the opportunity to buy more pigs to continue her sales. She hopes that her business continues to make progress since she has 3 children and she wants to pay for their studies and improve their quality of life. She and her colleagues are thankful for the opportunity to get a loan since it will allow them to invest in their businesses and make them move forward.

The other members of the group are:
Concepción – sells chickens
Minerva- sells snacks
Ines- sells clothing
Felipa- sells clothing
Marcelina- sells clothing
Cecilia- sells snacks.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

location.town: La Breña, San Miguel Soyaltepec Oaxaca

loans.name: Elita

texts.en:
Elita is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and has been in the business for more than 20 years now. Elita helps her husband in tilling their land.

Elita is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides. With this, they will be able to improve their farm as well as their harvest. Elita hopes to expand their farm so that it will generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a certified public accountant who has a large number of clients heavily comprised of large corporate enterprises. Beginning in 2009, Paul’s home-based business has been located in a rural area, so it has often become complicated to expand as a CPA.

Together with his wife, Paul looked to nonprofit microlender Accion Texas Inc. for further financial support to market his business. He says his marketing will help grow his client base and increase revenue for his business. He plans to create one part-time job in the near future and not be the sole employee.

loans.use: to update equipment for his business as an accountant

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Doña Norma vive en un municipio aun muy rico en cuanto a cultura. En este lugar se sigue conservando la lengua mazahua, su vestimenta típica -trajes coloridos-, sus alimentos  como huaraches, quesadillas, sopes etc.  Norma es una persona muy sonriente pero sobretodo muy trabajadora se ha dedicado en cuerpo y alma para lograr el bienestar de sus hijos. Norma tiene 40 años de edad está casada con el señor Javier desde hace 23 años juntos han formado una familia con tres hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando la universidad. Norma se dedica a rentar mobiliario como sillas, mesas y mantelería para eventos especiales desde hace 15 años platica que iniciaron su negocio por que su esposo Javier trabajaba en el ayuntamiento del municipio y un día acompaño a una persona encarga de esos eventos ahí fue donde le sugirieron iniciara con la actividad porque era muy buena. Les va muy bien en temporadas ellos enfrentan dos grandes dificultades la competencia con sus vecinos y cuando sus clientes no le terminan de pagar, para Doña Norma es una pérdida de ganancia pero a pesar de dichas dificultades no se da por vencida: “Muchos podrán iniciar la misma actividad pero pocos son los que podrán saber aguantar el trabajo que se requiere para levantar el negocio”. Sus clientes ya son conocidos los trata muy bien para que les de la confianza de regresar nuevamente. Norma ademas de la renta de mobiliario también esta iniciando a vender postres gracias a los cursos que ha tomado en la institución. Agradece a Kiva y VisionFund por la oportunidad de recibir un crédito. El sueño de Norma es ayudar a sus hijos para que puedan terminar su carrera universitaria, para después dedicarse de lleno a su negocio solo para asegurar su vejez.
texts.en:
Norma lives in a town that is still very rich in terms of culture. In this place they still maintain the Mazahua language, the typical dress - coloured outfits, and food such as huaraches [a fried dough base with toppings], quesadillas, sopes [a similar dish to huaraches], etc. Norma is a very sunny person but most of all, a very hard worker. She has dedicated herself body and soul to ensure the wellbeing of her children. Norma is 40 years old, she has been married to Javier for 23 years. Together they have created a family with three children who are currently studying at university.

For the last 15 years, Norma has been working renting furniture like chairs, tables and table linens for special events. She says that they began their business because her husband Javier was working in the town hall and one day he accompanied a person in charge of those events. It was there that they suggested to him that he begin this business because it was very good. It is going very well for them but at times they face two great challenges: competition with their neighbours and when their customers don't pay them in the end. For Norma this is a loss of profit but despite these difficulties she does not give up: "Many people can begin the same business but there are few who know how to withstand the work that is required to start up the business". Her customers are already acquaintances, she treats them very well so that they are instilled with confidence to come back again. In addition to the furniture rental, Norma is also starting to sell desserts as a result of courses that she has taken at an educational institution. 

She thanks Kiva and VisionFund for the opportunity to receive a loan. Norma's dream is to help her children to finish their university courses and afterwards devote herself fully to her business in order to finance her later years.

loans.use: to buy three sets of tables and chairs

loans.name: Ma. Josephine

texts.en:
Ma. Josephine is from the town of Valencia, Bohol. She is 32 years old and married with three children ages 7-15. For four years now, she has made doormats for an income. She is asking for a loan of 4000 PHP to buy cloth for doormats. This business helps in supporting her family’s basic needs like food and school fees. 

In the future, she hopes to make a bigger business. She also dreams of seeing her children being successful in their studies.

loans.use: to buy cloth for doormats.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a married woman from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been engaged in the fishing business with her husband for more than 20 years now. This is the source of her income.
