Elvira is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. Elvira wants to save part of their income for the schooling of their children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is a married woman from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been engaged in the fishing business with her husband for more than 25 years now. This is the source of their income.

Florencia is asking for a loan to buy a new engine for the fishing boat. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for the fishing boat

loans.name: Precious

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 49-year-old Precious from Bulawayo. She is married and has one child. Precious runs a manufacturing business. She specializes in the manufacturing of school uniforms for various schools around town, and outside as well. The business has been in operation for two years. She says the main challenges faced are unavailability of raw materials and other material for use in her business. 

Precious has requested a loan of $500 to order more cloth. She needs to buy the raw material in bulk so as to cut costs instead of buying in smaller quantities. The price for a roll of cloth costs around $120, which is much cheaper by at least 30 percent than when buying in smaller quantities. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to increase business capacity and fulfill outstanding orders. This will also enable her to operate profitably on the finished products when pricing them. In the future Precious plans to open a bigger factory as well as a shop selling her products. She also intends to purchase modern machinery for use in the business, which will improve turnaround time.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita, 52, is from Valencia, Bohol. She is married with 10 children ages between the ages of 8 and 27.  To support her children, she has had a tailoring business for 15 years now. She is asking for a loan of 6000 PHP to buy additional fabric, needles and thread. She knows that with hard work and perseverance she can improve her business and provide better for her family.

In the future, she hopes to be more driven in making a success in her business together with her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fabric, needles and thread.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en: Lucena is a 48-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. She lives with her family in the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is asking for a loan to buy an engine for the fishing boat. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. Lucena dreams of making their business a success.

loans.use: to buy an engine for the fishing boat

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a married woman from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been engaged in the fishing business together with her husband for more than 10 years now. This is the source of their income.
 
Norma is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets and a new engine for the fishing boat. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and a new engine for the fishing boat

loans.name: Vergenia

texts.en:
Vergenia is a 49-year-old married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol and the mother of eight children. She has been engaged in the fishing business together with her husband for more than 25 years now. This is the source of their income.

Vergenia is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. Vergenia hopes to make their business a success and stable source of their income.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is a 59-year-old married woman from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. Zosima is engaged in making sacks for selling. She has been in the business for more than five years now. This is the source of her income.

Zosima is asking for a loan to buy more sacks for tailoring and selling. With this loan, she will be able to improve her business and augment her income.

loans.use: to buy more sacks for tailoring and selling.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita earns a living through her hog-raising business. She is a married woman and has been in the business for more than 10 years now. This is the source of her income. 

Anita is asking for a loan to buy feeds for the pigs. With this loan, she will be able to improve her business and augment her income.

loans.use: to buy feeds for the pigs

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna is a married woman and a mother of three children from San Miguel, Bohol. Erna runs a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. 

Erna is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries. With this loan, she will be able to improve her store and attract more buyers, thus, augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en: Manuela runs a sari-sari or variety store as a source of her income. She lives with her family in the town of San Miguel, Bohol. Manuela is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries, biscuits and snack foods. Through this loan, she will be able to improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries, biscuits and snack foods.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place in San Miguel, Bohol. This is the source of her income.

Rosario is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap, toiletries, biscuits and snack foods. With this, she will be able to improve her stock and attract more buyers, thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap, toiletries, biscuits and snack foods

loans.name: Jeramie

texts.en:
Jeramie is a married woman and the mother of two young children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is engaged in the fishing business together with her husband. This is the source of their income. 

Jeramie is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en: Marciana earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. She is asking for a loan to buy stock like canned goods, candies, noodles, soda, beverages, soap and toiletries to sell. With this, she will be able to improve her stock and attract more buyers. Marciana hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy stock like canned goods, candies, noodles, soda, beverages, soap and toiletries to sell

loans.name: José Manuel

texts.es: José Manuel, tiene la edad  de 30 años, está en unión libre,  vive con su esposa y sus hijos los cuales su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes adecuados para el cultivo de frijol y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra y así que tenga una buena geminación, y semilla de buena calidad, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: José Manuel is 30 years old and is in a common-law marriage. He lives with his wife and his children, who are his biggest priority. With his loan he hopes to purchase some fertilizers for his bean crops and other products for his crops so the germination will go well, in addition to purchasing good-quality seed and paying for labourers to apply the products to his crops and help him with the field once the crops have grown. What he is trying to do is take advantage of the good weather and ground conditions this zone has for planting this type of crop, and also put his experience of several years in managing staple grains to use. Besides being able to buy the best products of the greatest quality so that his crops will grow well and be healthy and he will have a good harvest, he wants to have a large output soon. He wants to use the income he hopes to obtain from the harvest for the well-being and education of his family, as well as to fulfil some family goals and continue investing more in his crops. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has no previous loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan on better terms and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to plant beans

loans.name: Las Ranitas Group

texts.es:
Doña Teresa es una integrante de un grupo llamado Las Ranitas, ella tiene la edad de 63 años, solo estudio la secundaria y esta casada con el señor Macario que trabaja como Jornalero.
Doña Teresa se dedica al cultivo de noni desde hace un poco mas de 10 años, ella tiene su casa una pequeña huerta de arboles de Noni  los cuales ellas cuida y cosecha. Ella dice que la mayoría de veces vende sus cosechas a una fábrica y allí ellos lo convierten en jugo.
Ella comenta que algunas vences hace trueque, entrega su fruta a esta empresa y ellos pagan con botellas de jugo las cuales las vende y es cuando ve sus ganancias.
Doña Teresa dice que lo que mas le gusta su actividad es que vende un producto natural que ayuda a curar muchas enfermedades e incluso ha estudiando sobre las propiedades curativas del noni.
Doña Tere, además, realiza venta de ropa para dama y caballeros para obtener un ingreso extra.
Un crédito de VisionFund le ayuda a dar mantenimiento a su camioneta y a comprar ropa (camisas, blusas, pantalones, shorts, faldas y ropa interior).

Ella quiere que su negocio continúe progresando y así mejorar su calidad de vida.

Los demás integrantes del grupo son:
Alejandrina-venta de comida y miel
Veronica-venta de abarrotes
Agustina-venta de productos naturistas.
texts.en:
Doña Teresa is a member of a group called Las Ranitas. She is 63 years old, married to Macario, a day laborer, and only has a middle school education. 

Doña Teresa has grown noni fruits for a little more than a decade, caring for a small orchard at her home and harvesting the fruit. She says that most of the time she sells the fruits to a factory that produces juice from them. Doña Teresa also notes that she sometimes trades noni fruits in exchange for bottles of juice from the factory, which she sells to generate income. 

Doña Teresa says that the best thing about her work is that she sells a natural product that helps cure many illnesses. She has also begun to study the curative properties of noni fruit. 

Doña Tere also sells clothing for men and women to earn extra income. A loan from VisionFund will help her pay for truck maintenance and purchase clothing  (shirts, blouses, pants, shorts, skirts, and underwear).

Doña Teresa wants her business to keep growing and provide her a better quality of life. 

The other members of the group are:
Alejandrina, who sells food and honey
Veronica, who sells groceries
Agustina, who sells natural products.

loans.use: to pay for truck maintenance and purchase clothing (shirts, blouses, pants, shorts, skirts, and underwear).

loans.name: La Colonia Group

texts.es:
Grupo La Colonia esta integrado por 13 personas, alegres y emprendedoras, cada una de ellas desarrolla una actividad económica con la intensión de ganar su propio dinero para brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Este grupo se encuentra ubicado a solo 20 minutos de la presa hidroeléctrica Miguel Alemán.
Doña Luciana es uno de los integrantes de dicho Grupo, ella tiene 45 años de edad, solo tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar primaria y esta casada con el señor Julian con el cual tiene un hijo.
Doña Luciana platica que por mas de 15 años se ha dedicado a la venta de antojitos, ella realiza sus ventas en la escuela primaria de su comunidad en la hora del recreo.
Ella  dice que aunque su venta es de solo media hora, su trabajo inicia desde muy temprano en su hogar con la preparación de sus antojitos y alas 9:30 se va a la escuela a instalar su puesto para cuando salgan los niños al recreo a las 10:30 iniciar a vender. Ella ademas con la ayuda de su esposo realiza ventas de carne de cerdo, chicarrones, longaniza, carne enchilada y carnitas, una vez a la semana para obtener un ingreso extra.
Los que mas le gusta de su actividad ademas de ganar su propio dinero es cuando a la gente le gusta su comida y comenta que ha tenido clientes en Tuxtepec y Oaxaca, que cuando están de vacaciones la visitan para comprarle su longaniza o carne enchilada y se llevan a otros lugares esto le hace que ella se sienta feliz.
Ella invertirá este crédito en la compra de Frijol,queso,masa, chiles, huevo,aceite, lechuga, tomates, gas y carne para la elaboración de sus antojitos y cerdo para hacer su venta de carne.
A futuro le gusta poner una carniceria en su hogar, así como mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y construir su casa.
Los demas integrantes del grupo son:
Josefina-venta de zapatos
Trinidad-Venta de pollo
Rosa Elena-Venta de abarrotes
Rubicela-Venta de ropa
Ofelia-venta de abarrotes
Nicolas-Cultivo de Maiz
Alejandra-Venta de zapatos
Leonor-servicio de Herreria
Carmen-Venta de pollo
María-venta de zapatos
Claudia-Venta de Refrescos
Angela-Venta de abarrotes
texts.en:
The La Colonia group is made up of 13 people who are cheerful and enterprising. Each of them performs an economic activity with the intention of earning money to offer his or her family a better quality of life. The group is located 20 minutes away from the Miguel Alemán hydroelectric dam.

Luciana is one of the members of the group. She is 45 years old. She was only able to go to primary school. She is married to Juan and has a son. Luciana says that for more than 15 years, she has sold snacks. She sells in the primary school in her community during recess. She says that although she only sells for a half hour, her job starts very early at home, making her snacks and at 9:30 she goes to the school to set up her sales spot so that when the children come out at recess at 10:30 she starts to sell. With her husband's help, she also sells pork, chicarrones, longaniza, carne enchilada and carnitas once a week in order to make extra income.  

What she likes the most about her activity, in addition to earning her own money, is when people like her food. She says that she has customers in  Tuxtepec and Oaxaca who come to visit her when she is on vacation to buy her longaniza or carne enchilada and they take them to other places. This makes her happy.

She will invest this loan in buying beans, cheese, corn meal dough, chiles, eggs, oil, lettuce, tomatoes, gas and meat in order to make the snacks, and pork for the meat selling. In the future, she would like to open a butcher shop in her home, as well as improve her family's quality of life and build a house. 

The other members of the group are:

Josefina- selling shoes
Trinidad- selling chicken
Rosa Elena- selling groceries
Rubicela- selling clothes
Ofelia- selling groceries
Nicolas- growing corn
Alejandra- selling shoes
Leonor- blacksmithing 
Carmen- to sell chicken
María- to sell shoes
Claudia- to sell drinks
Angela- to sell groceries

loans.use: to buy beans, cheese, corn meal dough, chiles, eggs,oil, meat, lettuce, tomatoes, gas  and pork.

location.town: Colonia Raul Sandoval, San Miguel Soyaltepec, Oaxa

loans.name: Braulio

texts.es:
Braulio  trabaja como coordinador de proyectos de apoyo al sector productivo rural en todo el altiplano paceño, su padre le heredo unos terrenos en el sector de los yungas en el cual implementara una granja para cria de conejos. El vive con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, en su casa propia ubicada en la zona de 1º de Mayo en la ciudad de El Alto del Departamento de La Paz. 

El crédito lo requiere para la compra de materiales de construcción con los cuales realizara la  refacción y ampliación de dicha granja, de tal manera que pueda cultivar forraje con semilla mejorada para sus conejos y al mismo tiempo tener un corral donde sus animalitos puedan sentirse más cómodos. Así, su producción de conejos será más limpia y garantizada.

El sueño de Braulio, es formar una granja con una infraestructura mejorada para tener una producción que vaya en ascenso.

Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Braulio works as a project coordinator supporting rural production in all of the highlands of La Paz.  His father left him land in the tropical valleys where he started a farm to raise rabbits.  He lives with his wife and their four children in their own home in the 1st of May area of the city of El Alto in the department of La Paz.

He is requesting this loan to purchase construction materials to repair and expand his farm so that he can cultivate feed for his rabbits with better seed and also have a corral where his animals will be more comfortable.  This will make his rabbit production cleaner and guaranteed.  

Braulio's dream is to have a farm with improved infrastructure so that he can have increased production.  This is the first loan he has requested with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to repair the farm where he raises rabbits.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Flor, de 34 años de edad, esta casada con Herme, tiene 03 hijos de 12, 10 y  06 años de edad respectivamente, juntos viven en su casa propia. Flor se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles, los cuales los traslada por la carretera de la ciudad a los diversos caseríos que se encuentran cerca a los rios, lleva 4 años en este negocio. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite tener un ingreso económico para solventar sus gastos,  así como el poder conocer otros lugares y nuevas personas  además de ver crecer su negocio a base de su esfuerzo. Por lo contrario, no le gusta tener que estar lejos de casa y no poder cuidar de sus hijos pero sabe que lo hace por el bien de ellos, con su esfuerzo busca brindarles un mejor calidad de vida, por eso se da fuerzas para hacer crecer su negocio. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente feliz de tener un apoyo financiero que le permite seguir adelante con su negocio, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado de 3000 nuevos soles comprará productos comestibles al por mayor tales como arroz, azúcar, leche, entre otros.
texts.en:
Flor is 34 years old. She is married to Herme and has 3 children, aged  12, 10 and  6. They live together in their own house. Flor sells edible products. She transports them from the city to different communities near the river. She has been doing this for 4 years. She likes her business because it allows her to have an income to pay for her expenses as well see other places and meet new people, growing her business based on her hard work. On the other hand,  she doesn't like to be far from home and not be able to care for her children, but she knows she is doing this for their own good, seeking to give them a better quality of life through her efforts. That is why she strives to make her business grow. This is her first loan with Kiva and she is happy to have the financial support that allows her to get ahead with her business. She is also committed to making her payments on time.

With the amount of 3000 nuevos soles that she has asked for, she will buy edible products wholesale, such as rice, sugar, milk and more.

loans.use: to buy edible products such as rice, sugar, milk, and more.

loans.name: Ambrosia

texts.en:
Ambrosia is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She has been in the business for more than 4 years; this is the source of her income. 

Ambrosia is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides for the farm.  This will enable her to improve her farm as well as her harvest.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Akif

texts.en:
Akif is 58 years old, married, and has two sons. His sons are married.

He is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Fizuli city.  Akif lives in the Fizuli region with his family; his wife stays at home, so he is the only one earning an income.  Akif started his business seven years ago to grow, then sell calves. 

Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to make a new stall for the calves. He wants to use the money for his wife's future	
medication. 

In the future, Akif wants to get more calves for his new stall. 

Akif is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him.

loans.use: to make a new stall for calves.

loans.name: Grecia

texts.es: Grecia, de 21 años de edad, es soltera y vive en compañía de su familia en la casa de sus padres. Grecia se dedica a la confección, oficio que aprendió de su madre quien también se dedica a esta labor y con quien se dedica a está actividad en un espacio en su hogar. Le gusta su oficio pues le permite tener una ocupación y generar un ingreso para ahorrar y en ocasiones apoyar a su familia con los gastos del hogar.  Viendo los ingresos económicos que tiene su actividad laboral desea ampliar su negocio y comprar más máquinas para abrir una tienda de ropa donde pueda exhibir sus trabajos. Este será su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante por está razón se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles comprará telas, botones, cierres, elástico y demás accesorios que usa en su negocio.
texts.en:
Twenty-one year-old Grecia is single and lives with her family in her parents' home. Grecia earns a living dressmaking. She learned this skill from her mother who also works as a dressmaker. They work together in a space in their home. 

She likes this activity because it gives her an occupation and allows her to earn an income which she saves and sometimes uses to assist her family in household expenses. Seeing the economic benefits of dressmaking she would like to expand her business and buy more machines to open a clothing store where she can exhibit her work. 

This is her fourth loan with Kiva. She is very thankful for the financial support that she is receiving, which will allow her to move forward. For this reason she promises to make her payments on time.  

With the requested 1500 Peruvian Nuevo Soles she will buy fabrics, buttons, zippers, elastics and other accessories that she uses in her business.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, buttons, zippers, and other items

loans.name: Benkadi Ix Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe  BENKADI IX  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KOMO un des villages de BAGUINEDA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquieme prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le gombo  avec SITAN ,3 eme assise de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 75.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of Benkadi IX Group are married women who average 40 years of age and five children. They all live in polygamous families in Komo, one of the villages in Baguineda, second administrative region of Mali.

They are working with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are seeking their firth loan from the MFI, and the previous ones were repaid without problems.

Sitan (third woman from the left in the sitting row) is growing okra. With her loan she intends to buy farm inputs and seeds, and pay for plowing to maintain 0.5 hectare.

After the harvest, the production is sold at the market in the village, to a clientele comprising resellers and consumers. She intends to turn a profit of XOF 75'000 (ca US$ 150) per planting.

This profit will enable her to repay the loan and also help her husband cover the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds, and pay for plowing to maintain 0.5 hectare

loans.name: Benkadi X Group

texts.fr:
Les  8 membres du groupe  BENKADI X  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KOMO un des villages de BAGUINEDA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le mil  avec DJELIKA ,4 eme debout de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 40.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The eight members of the group called BENKADI X  are married women with an average age of 45 and on average, six children. They all live in polygamous families in Komo, one of the villages of Baguineda, second administrative region of Mali. 
 
They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to succeed with their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution, having correctly reimbursed the prior loans. 

Millet is the crop cultivated by Djelika, standing fourth from left to right in the photo. With her loan she intends to buy farm inputs, seeds, and pay for plowing to cultivate 1/2 a hectare. She sells her harvest in the village marketplace after the harvest, to a clientele composed of resellers and consumers. 

Djelika expects to make a profit of 40,000 F CFA per season. This profit will permit her to repay the loan and also help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, buying farm inputs, and seeds.

loans.name: Girasol Group

texts.es: Noé tiene 40 años de edad él pertenece a un grupo llamado Girasol, dice que sus compañeros le pusieron ese nombre al grupo ya que en la casa donde se reunían a hacer sus pagos había muchas flores de girasol y para que no se les olvidara el nombre decidieron ponerle ese nombre. Él es originario de una comunidad indígena llamada Don Gu una palabra en Mazahua que significa rincón. Noé desde hace 12 años se dedica a vender frutas y legumbres en diferentes tianguis de su localidad y poblaciones aledañas y también se va a las comunidades a andar “rancheando” en su camioneta (recorrer comunidades para vender). El surte las frutas y legumbres en la central de abastos y después las vende en las comunidades, también hay veces que compra por mayoreo la fruta en las huertas de aguacate y durazno y el las revende en el estado de México y así le gana un poco mas cuando vende por mayoreo. El ahorita está pidiendo un crédito para comprar fruta y legumbres de temporada ya que quiere comprar fruta y legumbre de mejor calidad y quiere salir a venderla a la ciudad de México ya que allá es mejor comprada. Dice que es la primera vez que trabaja con una financiera y él espera que le vaya bien el se metió al grupo porque uno amigo de el lo invito y como sabe que si paga y sabia que necesitaba capital para surtir su negocio por eso lo invito a trabajar con VisionFund, agradece la confianza que le están haciendo y dice que se pondrá a trabajar en forma para hacer sus pagos a tiempo. Los demás integrantes del grupo se llaman María, José, Agustina y Félix, ellos están pidiendo sus créditos para la compra de frutas y legumbres de temporada, para comprar  material para hacer costuras.
texts.en:
Forty-year-old Noé belongs to a group called Girasol [Sunflower]. He says that his colleagues chose that name because there were so many sunflowers by the house where they met to pay their bill that they wouldn't forget it. 

Noé is originally from an indigenous community called Don Gu, a Mazahua word meaning "corner." He has sold fruits and vegetables for 12 years at various markets in his town and the surrounding area. Noé also drives around the area in his truck selling produce. He buys fruits and vegetables from a supply center and then sells them in the community. Noé also sometimes buys peaches and avocados wholesale from orchards and resells them in Mexico State, earning a little more when he sells wholesale.

Noé is applying for a loan to purchase seasonal fruits and vegetables. He wants to purchase better quality produce to sell in Mexico City, where demand is higher. Noé says that this is the first time he's worked with a lender and he hopes the process goes well. 

Noé joined the Girasol group at the invitation of a friend. This friend knew that Noé needed capital to grow his business and would make payments, so he suggested that Noé work with VisionFund. Noé is grateful for the trust of his friend and VisionFund and says he'll strive to make payments on time. 

The other members of the group are María, José, Agustina and Félix, who are requesting loans to purchase seasonal fruit and vegetables and sewing materials.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase office equipment and to cover marketing communication costs until business is running as expected.

loans.name: Anndutikeswar Self Help Group

texts.en:
AnnDutikeswar Self Help Group has 10 members who are all from the same neighbourhood. The lady standing in the middle wearing a blue saree in the photo is Shanti, the leader of the group. Shanti is a 33-year-old married woman from Odagaon village of Odisha, India. The couple has two children who are schooling. Shanti lives with her children and, together with her husband, takes care of all the household expenses. 

For past five years she has been involved in the activity of growing and selling vegetables; her husband and her parents help her in this activity. All other members of this group are engaged other different kinds of activities like agriculture, cattle farming, etc. In order to strengthen the business and respond to customer demand, Shanti, together with her group AnnDutikeswar Self Help Group, has requested a loan amount of 250,000 INR for purchasing seeds, fertilizers and pesticides. Their goal is to expand their business activity.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides for cultivating vegetables.

loans.name: Maa Mahamayee Self Help Group

texts.en:
Rina is a 26-year-old lady. She is living in Odisha with her parents, husband and her only child, who is schooling. Her husband is a farmer. For the past two years, Rina has been engaged in the activity of selling cow's milk in her village. Her husband assists her in this activity. 

Rina is a very responsible and ambitious woman. She is the leader of the group, Maa Mahamayee Self Help Group (SHG). There are eleven members in the group and all are women. The members of the group are involved in different kinds of activities like agriculture, and some have grocery shops. She, along with her group, has requested a loan of 154,000 INR. She will use her portion to purchase a cow and to repair her cow shed. 

Rina has a dream to provide better living for her family

loans.use: to pay for purchasing a cow and to repair her cow shed.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI est un groupe de l’association SABOUGNOUMA de OUELESSEBOUGOU. Il regroupe 5 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 50 ans, sont mariées avec en moyenne quatre enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiment à l’image de SITAN  qui est la deuxième personne debout de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à OUELESSEBOUGOU dans la  préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a deux ans. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire. 
SITAN, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à OUELESSEBOUGOU, excelle dans la vente de condiment. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter de condiment alimentaires de différentes sortes (poivre, tomate, oignon,  choux et cube maggi.).  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses condiments à OUELESSEBOUGOU, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
BENKADI is a group belonging to the association SABOUGNOUMA of OUELESSEBOUGOU. It brings together five women who met because of being relatives and neighbors. They have an average age of 50 and are married with on average four children. They have various activities, such as  buying condiments, in the case of Sitan, who is the second person standing from left to right in the photo. They live in big traditional families in  OUELESSEBOUGOU in the prefecture of Kati (Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali). They have been in petty trading for a number of years and their businesses are very much sought after.

Wishing to satisfy the growing needs of their clientele, the members of the group decided to join the credit program of Soro Yiriwaso two years ago. They are on their fourth solidarity loan. 

Sitan, who is the president of the group and well-known in OUELESSEBOUGOU, excels in the sale of condiments. She intends to use her loan to buy condiments of various sorts (peppers, tomatoes, onions, cabbage and Maggi cubes). She buys her supplies in Bamako and locally from wholesalers and sells her condiments in OUELESSEBOUGOU, retail, for cash or credit, to a clientele composed of men and women. 

She hopes to make a monthly profit of 30,000 F CFA, a sum which will allow her to repay the loan and reinvest in her activity.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Maribec

texts.en:
Maribec makes a living running a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells various goods and items to the people in her community. 

Maribec is requesting a loan to buy stocks to sell such as canned goods, candies, noodles, soda, beverages, soap, and toiletries. She will use her loan to increase her stock and attract more buyers. Maribec hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, candies, noodles, soda, beverages, soap, and toiletries

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita makes a living running a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells various goods and items to the people in her community. 

Rosita is requesting a loan to buy stocks to sell such as canned goods, candies, noodles, soda, beverages, soap, and toiletries. She will use her loan to increase her stock and attract more buyers. Rosita hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, candies, noodles, soda, beverages, soap, and toiletries

loans.name: Mais

texts.en:
He is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Fizuli city. Now Mais lives in the Fizuli region with his family. Mais is 45 years old, married, and has four children. His wife stays at home, so he is the only one earning an income. His two sons help him in his business, and his two daughters got married. Mais started his business 12 years ago to grow and resell calves. 

Now, he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat) to repair his farm. He wants to use the money for his family's future. In the future, Mais wants to have more calves for his business. It is Mais' third loan on Kiva. 

Mais is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him again.

loans.use: to repair his farm.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 50-year-old married man with five children whose ages range from two through 25. For the past ten years, he has operated a business selling bananas and cereals such as maize and peas. Francis describes himself to be honest. His business is located in a profitable area and his primary customers are local residents. Francis's biggest business challenge is the unavailability of land to rent and farm. 

Francis is requesting a 15,000 KES loan to rent a piece of land for growing more food crops to sell. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.	 Francis plans to buy a piece of land in the area within five years and hopes that, in the future, he will be self reliant and independent.

loans.use: to rent a piece of land for growing more food crops to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 38-year-old woman with an eight-year-old child. For the past five years, she has operated a farm where she grows and sells maize, beans, and bananas. Jane describes herself as trustworthy. Her business is located in an area conducive for business and her primary customers are local businesspeople. Jane's biggest business challenge is the scarcity of goods to sell.

Jane is requesting a 15,000 KES loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds as well as maize and beans to sell. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. Her business goal is to expand and open a store within five years. Jane hopes that, in the future, she will be self independent.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds as well as maize and beans to sell

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 37-year-old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 4 years to 15 years. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a timber retail store where he sells lumber. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a profitable area and his primary customers are local residents and institutions. 

Robert describes his biggest business challenge to be unavailability of tree seedlings in the area. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy tree seedlings and trees for making lumber. His business goal is to expand and establish a tree nursery within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be self-reliant. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy tree seedlings and trees for making lumber

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 54-year-old single woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 20 years to 30 years. She describes herself to be trustworthy and self-driven. She operates a livestock farm where she keeps dairy cows that produce milk to sell. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. 

Her business is located in an area conducive for business, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of adequate funds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more dairy cows. Her business goal is to be a wholesale supplier of diary products within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will be a large scale producer of milk. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more dairy cows.

loans.name: Maa Mahamayee Self Help Group

texts.en:
Maa Mahamayee Self Help Group consists of 13 members of whom all are women. These entrepreneurs are very humble, hardworking and responsible people with good manners and lots of enthusiasm to improve their lives. One of them is Jhrana who was selected as their president. 

Jhrana is a 22-year-old lady living with her husband and her two children. The lady sitting in the middle wearing a blue saree is Jhrana. Her husband works as a labourer in a factory situated near her village. She runs a variety shop to help her husband financially. She sells betel, grains, lentils, spices, biscuits, soap, detergent, hair oil, etc. in her shop. She has developed a very good relationship with her customers in the village. She likes the fact that she can cater to the needs of the people in her village. 

Jhrana has a plan to make her shop bigger and keep multiple things in her shop to meet her customers' demand. She also wants to purchase items for her shop in bulk, directly from the wholesalers. For this she has requested a loan to purchase items like toothbrushes, toothpaste, soft drinks, wheat flour, rice and other household consumables. Jhrana, along with her group members, has requested a loan amount of 195,000 INR.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing toothbrushes, toothpaste, soft drinks, wheat flour, rice and other household consumables for her variety shop.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Doña Gloria tiene una edad de 43 años, ella es casada, ama de casa y agricultora, madre de tres hijos los cuales estudian y juntos en familia en compañía de su esposo elaboran las diferentes actividades en el campo como ser: corte, limpia, abono entre otras. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria cursado hasta el sexto grado gracias al esfuerzo, dedicación y apoyo de sus padres mismos que la educaron y le enseñaron el valor de la vida la responsabilidad a cada una de sus actividades y compromisos para con sus clientes. La tierra que en compañía de sus hijos y su esposo trabajan es propia la cual está ubicada a unos pocos metros de distancia de su casa de habitación a la cual se trasladan a pie diariamente.   

Ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para dar mantenimiento y asistencia técnica a sus cultivos de café ya que es fuente de ingreso económico para su familia y hogar.

Sus planes son los de poder realizar un cambio para bien en sus cultivos para sacar una excelente cosecha y posteriormente poder sembrar más café en una parcela de tierra que tiene a parte para poder generar más ingresos y poder seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios y a su pareja en la canasta básica entre otros.
texts.en:
Gloria, 43, is married.  She's a housewife, a farmer, and the mother of three children who attend school.  She completed the sixth grade of elementary school thanks to the effort, dedication, and support of her own parents, who raised her and taught her the value of life and her responsibility to each one of her jobs and commitments to her customers.

With her family and her husband she carries out a variety of activities in the fields, including cutting, weeding, and fertilizing.  The land she and her husband and children work is her own.  It's located a few meters away from her house, so they walk there every day.

She has requested a loan from the COMIXMUL cooperative to take care of and provide technical assistance for her coffee crops because it's her source of income for her family and household.

Her plans are to make a change for the good in her crops to get an excellent harvest and later be able to plant more coffee on her plot of land.  She also plans to generate more income so she can continue supporting her children in their studies and her husband with the household necessities and other things.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs

loans.name: Saida

texts.en:
Saida is 20 years old and single. She is an internally displaced person (IDP) from Fizuli city. Now Saida lives in the Fizuli region with her family. For the past two years, she has been growing and selling cattle.

Saida is requesting a 2,300 AZN loan to buy more calves. She will use the money from her loan for her family's future. In the future, Saida wants to have a big farm for sheep and cattle. She also wants to get married and have a big family with four children. Saida is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting her.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Evelith

texts.es:
Evelith, de 27 años es madre soltera de dos hijos con quienes vive en la casa de sus padres. Evelith se dedica a la venta de bebidas heladas de diversas marcas y sabores, para eso cuenta con una refrigeradora en un pequeño local en su hogar, donde atiende de manera amable y cordial a sus clientes. Se inició hace más de 04 años con un capital propio y actualmente cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres quienes atienden cuando ella está fuera de casa. Le gusta su actividad ya que le permiten estar ocupada  y tener un ingreso económico con el cual puede solventar los gastos de su hogar. Escogió éste negocio porque vio poca competencia por la zona. Las ganancias que obtiene le traen tranquilidad emocional y financiera. Por otro lado viendo los buenos resultados que está teniendo, tiene planes de mejorar e implementar su negocio y comprarse otra refrigeradora. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero recibido ya que esto le permite seguir adelante con s negocio, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles, comprará bebidas de diversas marcas y presentaciones, buscando precios bajos por sus compras al por mayor.
texts.en:
Evelith, 27, is a single mother of two children with whom she lives in her parents' house.

Evelith sells cold beverages in a variety of brands and flavors.  She has a refrigerator in a small space in her house, where she serves her customers in a friendly and cordial manner.  She started more than four years ago with her own capital and currently has the support of her parents, who tend to the business when she's not home.

She likes her job because it allows her to stay busy and have an income to pay for her household expenses.  She chose this business because she saw little competition in the area.  Her profits give her emotional and financial peace.  In light of the good results she's getting, she has plans to improve and set up her business and buy herself another refrigerator.

This is her fourth Kiva loan and she's grateful for the financial help she has received because it allows her to get ahead with her business.  In addition, she promises to make her payments punctually.

With the requested amount of 800 nuevos soles [PEN] she'll buy beverages of various brands and sizes, looking for low prices with wholesale purchases.

loans.use: to buy carbonated beverages wholesale

loans.name: Nkio

texts.en:
Nkio is a 55-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 12 years to 30 years. She describes herself to be credible. She does an animal trade whereby she sells goats and calves. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a dependable and profitable area, and her primary customers are local business people and residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inflation of prices of the animals. 

She will use the 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan to buy goats for resale. Her business goal is to be a leading animal trader within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be self-reliant. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy goats for resale.

loans.name: Satenik

texts.en:
Satenik lives in Qarahunj village which is located in the Syuniq region. Together with her husband, Satenik is a devoted parent of three school children. She and her family have been involved in agriculture for 20 years. They run a farm which includes cows, chickens and piglets, and also own a plot of agricultural land where wheat, haricot (beans), potatoes and greens are cultivated. 

For many years Satenik has been also working at a local bakery. However, the main income that her family has is from the farming business. Their farm is not a very big one, but Satenik and her husband plan and desire to make it rich and profitable. For this they need financial support and have applied for this loan. With the loan's help Satenik plans to purchase 2 cows and 3 pigs. She thinks that this purchase will bring a good profit to her family and they will be able to improve their life.

loans.use: to pay for 2 cows and 3 pigs.

loans.name: Everline

texts.en: Everline is a 25-year-old married woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail shop where she sells wheat flour, cooking oil and other items. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a competitive area and all types of people are her customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add stock of wheat flour, cooking oil and other items. Her business goal is to own a bigger shop within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of wheat flour, cooking oil and other items.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 3 years to 16 years. She describes herself to be trustworthy. She operates a retail store where she sells fruits and bananas. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a highly profitable area, and her primary customers are local residents and traders. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of constant supply of goods throughout the year. 

She will use the 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan to buy bananas for selling. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be profitable and independent. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy bananas for selling.

loans.name: Askar

texts.ru: Аскар 37-летний женатый мужчина, проживающий со своей семьей в районе Шахритус в селе Свердлов. Аскар является счастливым отцом. У него 5 заботливых дочерей, которые одновременно и учатся в школе и помогают в домашнем хозяйстве. Сам Аскар мастер по ремонту домов. Это сезонная работа и иногда ему трудно получить заказ. Поэтому Аскар решил начать бизнес в новой сфере. Он выбрал животноводческую деятельность, а именно куплю и продажу крупнорогатого скота, так как это прибыльный бизнес вне зависимости от сезона года. У Аскара есть опыт в разведении скота, так как у них в домашнем хозяйстве имеются коровы. Аскар просит кредит для закупа 6 голов бычков. Он планирует каждый месяц закупать по 6 голов крупноргатого скота, откармливать в течение месяца и затем выводить на продажу на скотный рынок района. Аскар верит, что его новый бизнес будет успешным и приносить хорошую прибыль, в результате которого улучшится финансовое состояние семьи. Он ждет от вас поддержки.
texts.en: Askar is a 37-year old married man living with his family in the village of Sverdlov on the Shahrituz region. Askar has been blessed by five caring daughters who attend school and also help out with household duties. Askar is a building contractor. This work is seasonal, and sometimes it is hard to find customers. This is why Askar decided to launch a business in a different field. He has chosen to raise livestock, more specifically to buy and resell cattle, as this business brings in revenues year round. Askar has experience taking care of animals since his family already keeps cows. Askar is requesting a loan to buy six young bulls. He plans to buy six heads of cattle every month, fatten them for a month and then bring to the animal market in the region. Askar believes that his new business will be successful and bring in good revenues, and, as a result, the financial well-being of his family will improve. He is counting on your support.

loans.use: to buy six bulls and calves so as to launch his livestock business.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is a 23-year-old single woman. She has two children with ages 1 year and 6 years. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail store where she sells sugar, salt, cooking oil and other items. She has been involved in this business for one year. Her business is located in a busy market, and her primary customers are commercial customers and individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for the purchase of stock to meet demand. 

She will use the 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan to purchase more stock, i.e., flour, cooking oil, sugar, etc. Her business goal is to own a supermarket within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her livelihood and have a sustainable business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase more stock, i.e., flour, cooking oil, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a 37-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 2 years to 10 years. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a salon and a boutique where she does hair treatment and weaving and also sells baby clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in an area good for business, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds to boost the business. 

She will use the 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan to buy salon and boutique items like hair weaves, cosmetics, clothes, etc., for resale. Her business goal is to have a salon training college within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will earn more income. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy salon and boutique items like hair weaves, cosmetics, clothes, etc., for resale.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a Kiva borrower. She has 3 children and she describes herself as aggressive. She operates a retail store where she sells second hand clothes. e.g. shirts, skirts and jackets, etc. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a potential area and her primary customers are local residents. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be transportation. She will use the Kes 35,000 loan to add a stock of clothes for resale. Her business goal is to be an importer of clothes within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will have a stable  business. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add a stock of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Myla

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Myla works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns income from buying and selling vegetables and spices. Myla is borrowing PHP 4000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her food vending business.

Myla has been sustaining her business activities through her past 1 loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Zita

texts.en:
Zita is 45 years old and married with six children. Zita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business which involves direct selling Sara Lee products in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of PHP 6000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell.

Zita has borrowed and repaid 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the direct selling business for five years and also earns an income from a general store and from buying and selling charcoal, dried fish and vegetables.

Zita aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell

loans.name: Xenia

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Xenia works hard to support her family. She has a hollow block-making business in the Philippines, and also earns income from motorcycle transport. Xenia is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF to purchase additional sand and cement for her hollow block-making business.

Xenia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 1 loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sand and cement for her business

loans.name: Maryjane

texts.en:
Maryjane is married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maryjane is 41 years old and her three children are in school.

Maryjane has a food vending business in the Philippines. Maryjane requested a 5,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like sugar, milk, ground rice, etc.

Maryjane has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Maryjane would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like sugar, milk, ground rice, etc.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie works hard to support her family. Rosalie is married and has a hollow block making business in the Philippines.

Rosalie requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional sand, gravels and cement for her business. Rosalie has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Rosalie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sand, gravels and cement for her business

loans.name: Izabella

texts.en:
Izabella is from Armavir town where she lives with her two daughters. Her elder daughter, Diana, is a student at Yerevan State University. Izabella works at one of the locals companies and works hard to sustain her family. Unfortunately, her income is hardly enough to cover the daily costs of her family and she is not able to save money for Diana's education.

Izabella is requesting a loan to pay for her daughter's university tuition. She waits for lender support to be able to give her daughter an opportunity to accomplish her education.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university tuition

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit lives in Yerevan with her husband, mother-in-law, and two daughters. She works as a seller at a  local shop and sustains her family's living. Anahit's elder daughter, Meri, is 19 years old and is a student at the Armenian National Agrarian University. 

Anahit is requesting a loan to pay for her daughter's university tuition. It is very important for her to provide for her family's needs and at the same time save money for her daughter's education. Anahit waits for your support!

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university tuition

loans.name: Mahfooz

texts.en: Mahfooz is 25 years old. He is a hard-working and responsible person who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He saved a small amount of capital to establish his business.  He has had a grocery store for one year and his business has been growing little by little, as he offers good prices and gives good service to his customers. He is asking for a youth loan of YER 120,000 to purchase grocery products for his business. He hopes that this loan will increase the goods displayed and, thus, improve his income.

loans.use: to purchase grocery products for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a vehicle, in order to offer services to clients at their nearest location

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 30-year-old Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be humble and respectful. She operates a beauty salon where she does hair treatment, hair braiding, etc. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are women. 

Beatrice will use the Kes 55,000 loan to add stock of hair weaves, cosmetics and other items. She hopes that in the future, she will start a family. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans of Kes 20,000 and Kes 50,000 were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add to her stock of hair weaves, cosmetics and other items

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a 24-year-old single woman. She has one child who is one year old. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail store where she sells bananas and maize. She has been involved in this business for one year. She also has a farm where she grows maize and bananas.

Her business is located in a busy market and her primary customers are local commercial customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of sufficient capital for expansion. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy fertilizer and other farm inputs to increase her supply of maize and bananas. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her livelihood. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and other farm inputs to increase her supply of maize and bananas

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman. She has three children. She is a hawker and she sells  clothes in the streets. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are the general public. 

Jane describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more clothes and other items to sell. Her business goal is to operate a boutique within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more clothes and other items to sell

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 50 years old and married with six children.

Delia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like coffee, milk, cream, spices, etc.

Delia has borrowed and repaid 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 31 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Delia aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like coffee, milk, cream, spices, etc

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling fish in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell. Rosa has been in this business for 4 years. Rosa also earns income from food vending and buying and selling vegetables.

Rosa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines. Analyn requested a loan of PHP 6500 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients for her business. She has been in this business for one year now.

In the future, Analyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 53 years old and married with three children.

Marina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, chips, etc.

Marina has borrowed and repaid 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from buying and selling dried coconut meat and direct selling Avon products.

Marina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, chips, etc.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 4,000 through NWTF to purchase more ingredients for her food vending business. Daisy has been in this business for 3 years. She also earns more income from a prepaid mobile load (prepaid cellular phone credits) business.

Daisy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients for her business

loans.name: Maher

texts.en:
Maher is 23 years old. He is a single man who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He is an employee who earns a low salary. Maher exerts as much effort as he can to save money to buy a taxi, but his salary and savings are not enough. He dreams of the good life. 

Maher is requesting a 300,000 YER youth loan from AMB to buy a taxi to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy a taxi

loans.name: Ramela

texts.en:
Ramela is from the Khot village in the Syunik region, where she lives with her son, daughter-in-law and 3 grandchildren. Ramela is a teacher with 20 years of teaching experience at a local school. However, in order to tackle the family's financial problems she got involved in agriculture 6 years ago. Now she owns a small but beautiful farm where she keeps 2 cows and 2 piglets. 

She has realized that breeding cattle is more profitable and that she can solve her family's living problems. She has requested this loan to purchase 5 calves. This will enable her to get milk, use it in cheese production and gather more income. Among numerous maintenance problems in her life, Ramela wants to solve the one that is the most urgent now -- she wants to repair the house and improve her family's living conditions.

Ramela waits for your support!

loans.use: to pay for 5 calves.

loans.name: Marame F's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe composés de sept femmes habitant dans le même quartier et unies par de bonnes relations sociales et économiques.
Madame Marame est la responsable depuis sa création. Elle est âgée de 61 ans mariée et mère de 9 enfants dont 4 garçons et 5 filles .Son fils ainé est âgée de 40 et le cadet âgée de 20 ans.
Elle s'active dans le commerce par la vente d’arachide.Son nouveau crédit de 400000 francs cfa lui permettra de se payer 5 tonne d’arachide à 275000 francs et 20 paniers de mangues a 100000 francs cfa.
Les bénéfices réalisés par son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge les dépenses alimentaires et sanitaires de sa familles.
texts.en:
This group consists of seven women who live in the same district and who are united by good social and economic relations. Marame has been the group's representative since its creation. She is 61 years old and married with nine children, four boys and five girls. Her eldest son is 40 years old and her youngest is 20 years old.

Marame is an active merchant who sells peanuts. Her new loan of 400,000 Francs CFA will enable her to purchase five tons of peanuts for 275,000 Francs, and 20 baskets of mangoes for 100,000 Francs CFA. The income she earns from her business will allow Marame to pay for the food and health expenses of her family.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of peanuts and baskets of mangoes for resale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a married woman and has 3 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a hardware store where she sells iron sheets and plywood. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a convenient place and her primary customers are builders. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to add stock of iron sheets, plywood and other items for resale. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of iron sheets, plywood and other items for resale.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Victoria works hard to support her family.

She has a prepaid mobile phone load (prepaid cellular phone credits) business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fruits and vegetables and also selling cellphone units. Victoria is borrowing 5,500 through NWTF to buy additional prepaid mobile phone load to resell for her prepaid mobile phone load business.

Victoria has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional prepaid mobile phone load to resell

loans.name: Lyne

texts.en:
Lyne is 27 years old and married with two children.

Lyne works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store like cheese curls, canned goods, egg, noodles, etc.

Lyne has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Lyne aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari store like cheese curls, canned goods, egg, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Anzhela

texts.en:
Anzhela lives with her husband and 3-year-old daughter in Goris town. Since Anzhela was married, she and her husband have been engaged in farming and agriculture. Now they keep 25 piglets and 2 cows. Anzhela's husband works at a local company and earns a monthly income, which is vital for covering the family's needs. Anzhela doesn't work as she has to take care of her little daughter. She manages the farming activities and gets some stable income from agriculture. 

Now, realizing that the agricultural business is very important for them, Anzhela and her husband would like to expand it. Anzhela has requested this loan to purchase 3 more cows. This will enable her to gather more dairy products and sell them at the local market.

Anzhela and her husband are very hardworking and are devoted to their work. They hope that Kiva lenders will support them so they can enrich their farm and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for 3 cows.

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is from Yerevan where she lives with her husband and two children: a 22-year-old son and a 20-year-old daughter. Liana is a teacher at a local school and her husband works at one of the local companies. Liana's daughter, Lusine, studies at the Yerevan State Linguistic University named after V. Bryusov. Liana and her husband work really hard to sustain their family and give their children appropriate living conditions. Unfortunately, their income is hardly enough to cover the family's basic living costs and there is no money left for their daughter's education. 

Liana is requesting a loan to pay Lusine's university tuition. The family waits for your support!

loans.use: to pay her daughter's university tuition

loans.name: Burbuqe

texts.en:
Kindly note that the photo of Burbuqe has been taken at the soon-to-be hair salon, and this is why there is not much displayed in the picture. This start-up loan will enable her to buy equipment and accessories to be used in her new hair salon.
 
Based on thorough research of existing beauty salons in her area, Burbuqe found out that there was a demand for such places/services. She decided to start up such an operation, and she has expressed her passion about it. She worked as a hair stylist in Greece; she lived there for a very long time. Yet, before immigrating to Greece, she was a hair stylist in her home city as well.

Recently, due to the economic difficulties in Greece, she came back to that city and is trying to put her skills to use again. “This will be it - no more moving around. I’m here for good this time. I like it here, it’s my home,” she said, sounding content with her decision. 

Burbuqe is married and has three children.

loans.use: to start up a hair salon business in her homeland.

loans.name: Aghunik

texts.en:
Aghunik is 48 years old and she is already skilled and devoted to her work as a farmer who manages agriculture well. Her farm includes cows, chickens and pigs, and she also cultivates wheat, barley and greens. 

She lives with her husband who helps her with farming activities. Aghunik is sure that she can enlarge their farm and earn a greater profit from it. She wants to increase the number of her livestock by 30 sheep, which is why she is requesting this loan. The loan is very important for her to gather more income and to be able to improve her and her husband's living conditions.

Aghunik has many plans for her farm and she hopes that this loan is one of the first successful steps to reaching her goals.

loans.use: to pay for 30 sheep.

loans.name: Douta's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été créé en mai 2010.IL est composé de membres issus de la même localité.Elles ont pour activité principale le petit commerce.

Celle qui se trouve à l'extrême droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe,elle est âgée de 53 ans,est mariée et mére de 06 enfants dont 03 filles.

Son activité est le commerce de jus de bissap,de pain de singe,du thé,de l'huile de palme et de l'encens.Elle pratique ce type d'activité depuis plusieurs années.

Avec ce prêt,elle compte acheter un sac de pain de singe à3500f,une bassine de bissap à 2000f,01 bidon de 20l de l'huile de palme à 20000f,un sac de sucre à 20000f,60 paquets de thé à 8000f et de l'encens pour une valeur de 30000f.
texts.en:
This group was established in May 2010. It is composed of members who come from the same community. Their main occupations are running small businesses.

The representative of the group is shown in the photo on the far right, with her arm raised. She is 53 years old, married, and the mother of six children, including three girls. Her small business includes the sale of bissap (juice made from hibiscus flowers), monkey bread, tea, palm oil and incense. She has been running this business for several years.

With this loan, she plans to buy a bag of monkey bread at 3,500 Francs, a basin of bissap at 2,000 Francs, a 20L canister of palm oil at 20,000 Francs, a sack of sugar at 20,000 Francs, 60 packets of tea at 8,000 Francs, and 30,000 Francs' worth of incense.

loans.use: to purchase bissap (juice made from hibiscus flowers), monkey bread, tea, palm oil and incense.

loans.name: Jully

texts.es:
Jully, de 26 años de edad, está casada con Carlos y tiene 2 hijos pequeños con quienes vive en la casa de sus padres. Jully, se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles en una tienda instalada en el interior de la casa de sus padres, donde vende productos como arroz, azúcar, huevos, aceites, fideos y otros a sus clientes. 
Se inicio hace más de 04 años, con un capital propio, al cual fue haciendo crecer con los productos que vende a diario. Le gusta su actividad pues puede contar con un ingreso económico que le permite apoyar a su pareja con los gastos de alimentación y la crianza de sus hijos, ya que muchas veces con el ingreso económico de su esposo no les alcanzaba , por está razón pasaron algunas necesidades, siendo ayudados por sus padres. Viendo que eso no podía continuar así decidió iniciar su negocio, ahora cuenta con una regular clientela y  tiene planes de ampliar su negocio y con las ganancias comprarse una pierna ortopédica. Este es su tercer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, comprará productos comestibles tales como arroz, azúcar, fideos, golosinas, entre otros.
texts.en:
Jully is 26 years old and is married to Carlos. They have two young children who live with them at home. Jully makes a living by selling food products in a store located inside of her parents home. She sells products like rice, sugar, eggs, oil, noodles, and other things to her customers.

She started her business over 4 years ago, with her own capital, and she has been able to increase that capital due to the products that she sells daily. She likes her job because she can count on income, which she uses to help her husband with the cost of food and raising their children.

Many times, her husband's income wasn't enough, so they had to seek help from her parents. Because she knew they couldn't continue this way, she decided to start her own business, and now has regular customers and plans to expand her business. With the profits, she plans to buy a prosthetic leg.

This is her third loan with Kiva, and she is grateful for the financial support that she has received to move her family forward. She promises to pay her dues on time. With the requested loan of 1000 nuevos soles, she will buy food products like rice, sugar, noodles, candy, and others.

loans.use: to buy food products like rice, sugar, milk, and others.

loans.name: Virgen Purificada Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Basilia ella es casada y tiene 47 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azúcar,leche y aceite, la socia tiene un puesto en el mercado que es una tienda de abarrotes, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite y arroz.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de librería, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de servicio de taxi.
