La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the "Virgen Purificada" communal bank. This bank is located in the district of Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

The member Basilia is married, is 47 years old and has 2 children. She works in her grocery store business, selling products of basic need like rice, sugar, milk and oil. She has a stall in the market that is a grocery store, and works from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. She has had this business for 7 years and it is going well. He dream is to expand the grocery store business. She is asking for the loan to buy milk, sugar, oil and rice.

The other members make a living from a bookstore business, a clothing sales business, a grocery store business and a taxi services business.  
 
Basilia thanks those who form part of this dream in this manner and she commits to complying with the payment of her fees in the established period.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, oil and rice.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 31 years old and married with four children.  She earns a living by raising poultry in the Philippines. Merlita is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional feeds and vitamins.

Merlita has been raising poultry for 5 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and vitamins

loans.name: Jorgea

texts.en:
Jorgea is 51 years old and widowed with four children.

Jorgea works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, etc.

Jorgea has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from farming and selling vegetables.

Jorgea aspires to save money for business expansion.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Argina

texts.en:
Argina is from Aravus village in the Syuniq region. She lives together with her husband and 22-year-old son who serves in the army. Together with her husband, Argina has been running their farm for 16 years. Currently, they keep on the farm cows, sheep and bulls, and also cultivate some vegetables (wheat, barley and greens) on the family's own land. The gathered harvest is for feeding the livestock and not for sale.

Argina and her husband work hard to make a good income and be able to meet their basic needs. They are sure that they can enlarge their farm and make it more profitable. For this purpose, Argina is requesting a loan to purchase 3 more cows. This loan is very important for them, because with its help they will be able to gather more income and make their life better.

Also, Argina wants to increase her income so she will be able to save money for her son to come back and make his own family.

loans.use: to pay for 3 cows.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a welding shop in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from farming rice and vegetables. Evelyn is borrowing 19000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional equipment for her welding shop.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional equipment for her business.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 40-year-old Cheryl from Bulawayo. She is divorced and stays with her three children. Two of her children go to school. Cheryl runs a retail business selling various clothing items and footwear for both kids, men and women. The business has been in operation for over 10 years. She says the main challenges that she faces are the lack of adequate working capital and competition from bigger retailers who offer credit facilities. Cheryl has requested a loan of $500 to replenish her stocks and introduce new products for the winter season, as well as other winter goods like blankets and winter jackets. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to supplement her household income and improve her business capacity. In the future, Cheryl plans to open a clothing boutique.

loans.use: to increase her stock of various clothing items.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is a hardworking entrepreneur who has been operating a food vending business in the Philippines for 15 years, and earns additional income from a general store. She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Deborah has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money for business expansion in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Benkadi Vi Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  BENKADI VI  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KOMO un des villages de BAGUINEDA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le mil  avec MINATA ,3 eme debout de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 100.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Benkadi VI group are all married women, averaging 35 years of age, with five children. They all live in polygamous families in Komo, a village in the [prefecture of] Baguineda in the second administrative district of Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better manage their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan, having duly repaid their prior loans.
They grow millet, which is the case of Minata, for example. She is the third one standing from the left in the photo. With her loan, she plans to buy agricultural inputs [fertilizers etc] and seeds and pay the cost of labor to work 0.5 ha [about one acre] of land. After harvesting, she sells her produce at the village market to a customer base composed of both resellers and consumers. She plans to earn 100,000 West African francs per agricultural cycle. These revenues will allow her to pay off her loan and also help her husband meet everyday expenses.

loans.use: to pay for the costs of labor, agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Lourdes works hard to support her family. She has a general store in the Philippines, and earns additional income selling prepaid mobile loads and farming rice. Lourdes is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy stocks such as soap, milk, canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, etc. for her store.

Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy stocks to sell such as soap, milk, canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 58 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Perla is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Perla has been raising pigs for 3 years and earns additional income from selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling dried coconut meat in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 22,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell for her business buying and selling dried coconut meat. Daisy has been in this business for 8 years. She earns more income from farming vegetables.

Daisy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 50-year-old Sheila from Bulawayo. She is a single mother with one child. Sheila runs a retail business. She sells a variety of clothing and footwear items for men, kids and women. The business has been in operation for 13 years. She says the main challenges faced that she faces are competition from bigger retailers and exorbitant import duties at the border. Sheila has requested a loan of $400 to replenish her stock and buy a new stock for winter. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve both her business and her lifestyle. In the future, Sheila plans to open a clothing boutique.

loans.use: to purchase stocks for her flea market, including blankets, dresses, men's trousers, ladies' tops, blouses, kids' tracksuits, ladies' and men's jeans.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Doña Marina es una mujer de 46 años casada y madre de 2 hijos, ama de casa y agricultora desde su juventud con 6 años de educación primaria cursados. En la agricultura solo ella y su esposo se involucran desde hace más de 10 años pero fueron sus padres los que en su juventud le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra en lo que es el cultivo de maíz, frijol, y café principalmente. La tierra que ella y su esposo trabajan es propia gracias al esfuerzo que juntos han hecho al abstenerse de muchas cosas para poder algún día tener algo propio.

Ella ha solicitado a COMIXMUL un financiamiento para poder tecnificar sus cultivos de café ya que de esa forma ella podrá proteger sus cultivos de café de la broca que es un bicho dañino y de la roya como enfermedad.

Su sueño es poder extender y ampliar sus cultivos en variedad y calidad para poder ofrecer a sus clientes más de lo que ellos buscan y así poder cubrir sus expectativas ya que de esa forma ella podrá generar mayores ingresos para su familia, podrá apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios ya que su sueño es verlos crecer y convertidos en profesionales.
texts.en:
Marina is 46 years old, married and the mother of two children.  She is head of the household and has worked in agriculture since she was young, having 6 years of education.  Only she and her husband work in agriculture, and have for more than 10 years, but it was her parents who taught her to work with the earth when she was young.  She cultivates primarily corn, beans and coffee.  The earth that she and her husband work in is their own, thanks to the hard work they have put into being frugal to be able to one day have something of their own.

She has requested a loan from COMIXMUL to be able to give better care to her coffee plants, and in this way she will be able to protect her coffee plants from a harmful pests.

Her dream is to be able to extend and increase the variety and quality of her plants to be able to offer more of what her clients are looking for and meet her goals.  In this way she will generate more income for her family and will be able to support her children in their studies.  Her dream is to see them grow and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for her coffee plants

loans.name: Deo

texts.en:
Deo is a 34-year-old man from Gicumbi District in the Northern Province of Rwanda.

He is seeking a loan of 30,000 Rwanda Francs (RWF) to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just 100 RWF. Deo started selling lights in December 2012 and he has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people.

He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself, his wife Agnes, and their 5 children.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is a 42-year-old man from Gicumbi District in the Northern Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of 30,000 RWF to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. Alfred started selling lights in December 2012 and he has sold 30 lights to date, providing clean energy to 150 people. 

He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself, his wife Grace, and their child.

loans.use: to buy 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Antoine

texts.en:
Antoine is a 36-year-old man from the Rulindo District in the Northern Province of Rwanda.

He is seeking a loan of 30,000 Rwanda Francs (RWF) to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just 100 RWF.

Antoine started selling lights in September 2012 and he has sold 30 lights to date, providing clean energy to 150 people.

He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself, his wife Felecite, and their children.

loans.use: To pay for ten low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is a 33-year-old man from the Bugesera District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda.

He is seeking a loan of 30,000 Rwanda Francs (RWF) to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just 100 RWF.

Jean started selling lights in July, 2012 and he has sold 50 lights to date, providing clean energy to 250 people. He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself, his wife Epiphania, and their 4 children.

loans.use: To buy 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Lleny

texts.es: Lleny, de 48 años de edad, está casada con Eduardo quien es empleado y padre de sus 03 hijos.  Vive en compañía de su esposo  y sus 02 nietos en su casa propia. LLleny se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles, para eso abrió una pequeña tienda en su hogar donde tiene a la venta productos como azúcar, arroz, aceites, bebidas, golosinas y otros. Se incio hace más de  15 años en está actividad y hasta el momento  cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo y el de su familia. Le gusta su negocio ya que le permite estar  en casa y cuidar  de sus nietos menores a los que quiere mucho, además de los ingresos económicos que le permiten ayudar a esposo con los gastos de su hogar. Este es su tercer préstamo con kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 1200 nuevos soles, comprará productos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche , entre otros, al por mayor.
texts.en:
Lleny is 48 years old and is married to Eduardo, who is employed. They have 3 children. Lleny and her husband live in their own home with their two grandchildren. 

Lleny makes a living by selling food products out of a small store that she opened in her home. She sells products like sugar, rice, oil, drinks, candy, and other things. She has been working in this business for more than 15 years, and she still has the support of her husband and her family. 

She likes her business because it allows her to be at home caring for her young grandchildren whom she loves very much. Additionally, her income allows her to help her husband with the household expenses.

This is her third loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support that she receives to move her family forward. She promises to pay her dues on time.

With this loan of 1200 nuevos soles, she will buy products like rice, sugar, oil, milk, and others, all in bulk.

loans.use: to buy food products like rice, sugar, milk, and others.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a conservative person who prefers not to have his photo published online, so his father appears in his Kiva profile photo. The picture was taken in the store where he purchased the refrigerator.

Mohammad is a 21-year-old, single young man from Khanyounis. He lives in a small house with his family. Mohammad works as a farmer on the family farm. He plants seasonal crops and sells them in the local market. It is a profitable business, but needs a lot of time and care. 

Mohammad took a USD Murabaha loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to buy a new refrigerator for the family house. By applying for this loan, Mohammad will help his family to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator for the family house.

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en:
Eugenie is a 51-year-old woman from the Kayonza District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda.

She is seeking a loan of 30,000 Rwanda Francs (RWF) to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which she will resell to people without electricity in her village. Every week or so, these customers will return to her to have their lights recharged for just 100 RWF.

Eugenie started selling lights in May, 2012 and he has sold 60 lights to date, providing clean energy to 300 people. She is also a farmer and will reinvest the money she makes into expanding her other business to earn more money for herself and her husband.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Frederic

texts.en:
Frederic is a 28-year-old man from Gakenke District in the Northern Province of Rwanda.

He is seeking a top-up loan of 30,000 Rwanda Francs (RWF) to purchase 10 more rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just 100 RWF.

Frederic started selling lights in December, 2012 and he has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. His light-recharging business has been fully funded by Kiva. With the money he makes from selling and recharging lights, he will pay for the school fees of his 5 children.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity

loans.name: Haidr

texts.en: Haidr, 25, is a married man living in Ibb, Yemen. He has been operating a shoe shop selling different shoes for men and women. Previously, he worked with his father in this shop to support his family. He attributes its success to his being nice to his customers and selling quality goods at affordable prices. He requested a youth loan of 500,000 YER from AMB to buy more shoes to expand his business. This improvement will enable him to increase his income. He hopes to open another shoe shop so that he can increase his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy men's and ladies' shoes to expand his business.

loans.name: Sylvestre

texts.en:
Sylvestre is a 42-year-old man from the Rwamagana District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda.

He is seeking a loan of 30,000 Rwanda Francs (RWF) to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just 100 RWF.

Sylvestre started selling lights in June 2012 and has sold 80 lights to date, providing clean energy to 400 people. He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself and his wife and family.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Jean Damascene is a 42-year-old man from the Gakenke District in the Northern Province of Rwanda.

He is seeking a top-up loan of 30,000 Rwanda Francs (RWF) to purchase 10 additional rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just 100 RWF.

Jean Damascene started selling lights in December 2012 and has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. With the money he makes from selling and recharging lights, he will pay for his children's school fees.

loans.use: To pay for 20 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity

loans.name: Xaver

texts.en:
Xaver is a 55-year-old man from the Bugesera District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda.

He is seeking a loan of 30,000 Rwanda Francs (RWF) to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just 100 RWF.

Xaver started selling lights in December 2012 and has sold 60 lights to date, providing clean energy to 300 people. With the money he makes from selling and recharging lights, he will buy health insurance and pay for the medical costs of his wife Beatrice and 3 children.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Jean Claude is a 34-year-old man from the Rulindo District in the Northern Province of Rwanda.

He is seeking a loan of 30,000 Rwanda Francs (RWF) to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just 100 RWF.

Jean Claude started selling lights in August 2012 and has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself, his wife Marie Chantel, and their 3 children.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a 30-year-old man from Rulindo District in the Northern Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of  RWF 30,000 to purchase ten rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. 

Emmanuel started selling lights in August, 2012 and he has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. With the money he makes from selling and recharging lights, he will be able to provide a better home for his family.

loans.use: to pay for ten low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Jean Marie Vianney

texts.en:
Jean Marie Vianney is a 42-year-old man from Rulindo District in the Northern Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of  RWF 30,000 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. 

Jean Marie Vianney started selling lights in August 2012 and he has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: to pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria, de 43 años de edad, esta casada con Elmer y tiene 03 hijos de 20, 16 y 06 años de edad respectivamente con quienes vive en su casa propia. Gloria se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles tales como arroz, azúcar,  fideos, avena, entre otros, en la tienda que tiene en el interior de su hogar. Se inicio hace más de 04 años en está actividad y hasta el momento lo realiza sin problema ya que considera que su negocio es bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja y por ser su bodega la más surtida de la zona. Le gusta su negocio ya que le permite estar  en casa y cuidar de sus hijos menores a los que quiere mucho. Tiene planeado incrementar los productos de su tienda y abrir un nuevo negocio en el cual se dedicara a la venta de comidas. Este será su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, comprará productos comestibles tales como arroz, azúcar, leche, entre otros.
texts.en:
Gloria is 43 years old and is married to Elmer. They have 3 children, ages 20, 16, and 6, who live with them in their house. Gloria makes a living by selling food products like rice, sugar, noodles, oatmeal, and other things in the store located inside her home. 

She began this business more than 4 years ago and has been working without a problem. She considers her business to be fairly profitable due to the profits that it provides her and since it is the most well-stocked grocery store in the area. 

She likes her business because it allows her to be home to care for her young children whom she loves very much. She plans to increase the amount of products in her store and open a new business which will sell food.

This will be her fourth Kiva loan and she is grateful for the financial support that she receives to move her family forward. She promises to pay her dues on time. With the requested loan of 1500 nuevos soles, she will buy food products like rice, sugar, milk, and others.

loans.use: to buy food products like rice, sugar, milk, and others.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is 33 years old, from Gaza. He is married and has children. Two of them attend primary school.

Since 2002, Mahmoud has owned a shop, selling home appliances and furniture. He has two employees who help him.

He asked Ryada for this loan in order to build an attic for his furniture shop. Through this loan, he will be able to enlarge the space for product display and, hopefully, increase his sales and improve his income.

loans.use: to build an attic for his furniture shop.

loans.name: Ikhtiyor

texts.ru: Ихтиёр опытный дехканин, проживающий в районе А.Джоми. Ему 37 лет. У него жена и двое детей. Его жена вместе с ним ведет сельское хозяйство. Ихтиёр скромный и добрый человек. Он имеет среднее образование. У него достаточно богатый опыт в этой области. Он более 13 лет занимается посевом сельскохозяйственной культуры. У него имеется 0,25 га приусадебного и президентского земельного участка, где он выращивает картофель, помидор, огурцы, морковь, лук и т.д. Ихтиёр продает полученный урожай и таким образом зарабатывает на жизнь. Он запрашивает кредит для продолжения своей работы, чтобы посеять овощи. На сумму кредита он хочет приобрести семена лука, помидора, огурцов, моркови, кукурузы, а также минеральные удобрения и топливо. Ихтиер за счет полученной прибыли хочет купить скот для домашнего хозяйства.
texts.en: Ikhtiyor is an experienced farmer who is 37 and lives in the A. Jomi region with his wife and two children. He and his wife work on their farm. Ikhtiyor is a humble and kind person and has a high school education. He has extensive experience in agriculture and has been planting crops for over 13 years. He has 0.25 hectares of farmland and grows potatoes, tomatoes, cucumbers, carrots, onions, etc. Ikhtiyor sells his crops to earn a living. He has asked for a loan to buy seeds for onions, tomatoes, cucumbers, carrots, and corn, and also mineral fertilizers and fuel, so that he can continue growing vegetables. Ikhtiyor wants to buy cattle for his household with the profits from his next crop.

loans.use: to purchase corn, onion, tomato, cucumber and carrot seeds, as well as fertilizers and fuel

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo de 2 años, ella  posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene 1 años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, está ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad muy transitada, se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda mas surtida, las personas la prefieren y la mantienen delante de la competencia porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan con producto de calidad, a precios accesibles y con un servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes, la clienta desea realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, huevos, pan, bebidas, sopas, refrescos, gaseosas, etc. la clienta  asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The client lives in her own house with her husband and her 2-year-old son. She has her own store where she sells articles of prime necessity; beans, milk, eggs, and bread, among other items. She has had the business for 1 year, giving her experience in sales that has provided better earnings. The store is located in her house in a heavily-traveled area. She has earned many customers because she has the best-supplied store. People prefer it and they maintain the store against the competition because it always has what they want, with quality products and accessible prices, and with an unequaled service always at the customer's order.

The client wishes to make a new investment but she needs the capital. For this she has requested a loan through INTEGRAL that will permit her to purchase basic grains, sweets, eggs, bread, drinks, soups, soft drinks, carbonated beverages, etc. The client assures us that she will be able to pay off the debt and, at the same time, that she is confident she can provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: buy basic grains, sweets, eggs, bread, drinks, soups, soft drinks and carbonated beverages, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Issam

texts.en:
Issam is a 27-year-old single man from Lebanon. He has owned a barbershop for the past 9 years. He has more than 14 years of experience in this occupation; he started to work at a very young age in order to help his father financially and decided to stick with this profession as he believed that it’s his hobby and that he will succeed working it. 

And today, Issam wants to renovate his salon; to do so, he looks forward to have a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. He reports that the renovation will help him attract more customers and therefore he will earn higher income. Issam is very positive and he only aims to improve his business and enhance his way of living.

loans.use: to renovate his salon.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai, 24, is from Tulkarem.

She is married.

She has owned a tailoring shop since 2012 and has 3 employees who help her.

She asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to paint her tailoring shop and buy more fabric.

She hopes that this loan will help her enlarge the scope of work and thus help her improve her family's income.

The one who appears in the picture is Mai's husband. Due to cultural manners, she couldn't take pose for a picture herself.

loans.use: to paint her tailoring shop and buy more fabric.

loans.name: Marwan

texts.en:
Marwan, 28, a single man who lives in Hodeida, Yemen, is hardworking and independent. The owner and operator of a bus providing local transportation, he works hard to meet his daily expenses.

Marwan has applied for a youth loan of 149,500 YER from AMB to buy spare parts for his bus. He hopes to improve his living standards and buy an extra bus in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his bus

loans.name: Ana Del Carmen,

texts.es: Ana de 34 años de edad ella,  se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir. El negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación. Ana es una mujer increíble y muy ejemplar  ya que es muy trabajadora, responsable y positiva, además, muchas personas dan buenas referencias de su persona y de su trabajo. Elabora variedad de prendas de vestir  a precios muy accesibles. También ofrece calidad en su trabajo, razón por la cual muchas personas la prefieren. Tiene 5 años de dedicarse a esta actividad por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia y sobre todo con clientes fijos que cada día la prefieren más. Con las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo logra cubrir algunos gastos de su casa vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en casa propia. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito para comprar los materiales necesarios para su trabajo como: telas, hilos, elástico, botones, etc. Todo esto lo hace con el fin de dar un mejor servicio a los clientes de tal forma que los clientes se sientan motivados a seguir solicitando sus servicios y así sus ventas e ingresos se vean incrementados. Espera lograr su objetivo y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is 34 years old and she makes clothing and accessories.  She began this business in her home.  Ana is an incredible woman.  She is hard-working, responsible, and always positive.  Many people give great references about her as a person and a worker.   

She makes a variety of garments and sells them at reasonable prices.  She provides a high quality of work, which is one of the reasons that many people prefer to buy from her.  She has worked in this job for 5 years and she now has a lot of experience and loyal customers that choose to buy from her more and more.  With her income she can cover some of her household expenses.  She lives with her husband and their two children in their own home.

She has decided to ask for a loan so that she can buy the materials she needs for her work, such as fabric, thread, elastic, buttons, etc.  All that she does is done with the goal of providing a great service to her customers so that they always choose to buy from her and so that she can increase her income.  She hopes to one day reach her goal of improving the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Milton Ivan

texts.es: Milton de 32 años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos en casa propia, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz, pepino y ejote,  tiene 4 años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le  ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, sus cosechas las comercia en los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefieren por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el buen servicio; el necesita invertir por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, insecticida, herbicida, fertilizantes, abonos,  etc. Milton  tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de sus conocidos, y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Milton is 32 years old and lives with his wife and their children in their own home.  He works in agriculture and grows corn, cucumbers, and green beans.  He has worked in agriculture for 4 years and so he has gained the experience he needs to bring in a better harvest.  His sells the products from him harvest throughout the community.  He already has a large customer base because people prefer his products due to their great quality, low prices, and above all, good customer service.  

He is seeking a loan so that he can buy seeds, insecticides, herbicides, fertilizers, compost, etc.  Milton has good business references because he is well-known and very responsible.  He assures us that he will be able to pay back the loan in compliance with the established schedule and he is confident that it will help him economically support his household.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides, herbicides, fertilizers, compost, etc.

loans.name: Zobeyda Nohemy

texts.es: ZOBEYDA VIVE EN UNA COMUNIDAD  RURAL. ELLA TIENE 27 AÑOS DE EDAD, ESTA CASADA Y CON 2 HIJOS: SU HIJA MEYDELIN DE 7 AÑOS, Y SU HIJO MICHAEL DE 5 AÑOS. AMBOS ASISTEN A LA ESCUELA DE LA COMUNIDAD. ZOBEYDA TIENE UNA PULPERIA DESDE HACE UN AÑO, LA CUAL HA SIDO UNA FUENTE DE INGRESO  IMPORTANTE PARA MANTENER SU HOGAR. SU ESPOSO TRABAJA COMO OBRERO  Y SU SALARIO NO ES SUFICIENTE PARA MANTENER A LA FAMILIA, POR LO QUE PARA AMBOS ES IMPORTANTE TENER ESTE PEQUEÑO NEGOCIO. EN SU COMUNIDAD NO HAY LUZ ELECTRICA  Y ES MUY DIFICIL PARA ELLOS QUE LA PULPERIA FUNCIONE DE NOCHE. ACTUALMENTE USAN CANDELAS, KEROSENE Y FOCOS CON BATERIAS PARA ALUMBRARSE, PERO ESTOS SOLO LES FUNCIONAN POR 2 HORAS. PARA ZOBEYDA Y SU ESPOSO ES IMPORTANTE TENER LUZ EN SU HOGAR PARA QUE SUS HIJOS LOGREN TENER MAYOR SEGURIDAD Y NO ESTEN EXPUESTOS A CUALQUIER ACCIDENTE CON LAS CANDELAS Y ENFERMEDADES POR EL HUMO DE KEROSENE . ES POR ESO QUE ZOBEYDA ESTA SOLICITANDO UN PRESTAMO PARA LA COMPRA DE UN PANEL SOLAR  DE 100 WATT EL CUAL BENEFICIARA A TODA LA FAMILIA CON ENERGIA LIMPIA "CON EL PANEL SOLAR PODRE ATENDER POR LAS NOCHES EN LA PULPERIA Y MIS HIJOS HARIAN ALGUNAS TAREAS  ESCOLARES. USANDO CANDELA, KEROSINE Y FOCO GASTO DEMASIADO. REALMENTE ESPERO ME AYUDEN A RECIBIR ESTE CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DEL PANEL SOLAR PORQUE ESTOY SEGURA QUE TODAS  LAS VIVIENDAS CERCANAS TAMBIEN SERAN BENEFICIADAS."
texts.en:
Zobeyda lives in a rural community.  She is married and has two children.  Her daughter, Meydelin, is seven years old.  Her son, Michael, is five years old.  Both of them attend the community school.  Zobeyda has had a grocery store for one year.  It has been an important source of income in order to support her household.  Her husband is a workman, and his salary is not enough to support the family.  Therefore, it is important to both of them to have this small business.

There are no electric lights in her community, and it is very difficult for them to run their grocery store at night.  They currently use candles, kerosene, and lights with batteries to light up the place.  However, these only work for two hours.  It is important to Zobeyda and her husband to have light in their home so that their children manage to be safer and so that they are not exposed to an accident with the candles and illnesses from the kerosene smoke.

That is why Zobeyda is requesting a loan to buy a 100 watt solar panel.  This will benefit the whole family with clean energy.  “With the solar panel I will be able to tend to the grocery store in the evenings and my children will do some school work.  Using candles, kerosene, and lights [run by batteries], I spend too much.  I really hope that you help me get this loan to buy a solar panel because I am sure that all of the houses nearby will also benefit.”

loans.use: to buy a 100 watt solar system for lighting in her home.

loans.name: Savina

texts.en:
Savina is a 70-year-old married woman. She has ten children ranging from 30 to 48 years of age. She describes herself to be motivated. 

Savina operates a cereals business selling maize, beans, and millet. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a busy market area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the shortage of products. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add a stock of maize, beans, and millet. Her business goal is to expand within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM, and the previous loan of Kes 15,000 was paid successfully.

loans.use: to add a stock of maize, beans, and millet.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is a 61-year-old married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself as determined. He operates a farm where he keeps rabbits. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a competitive area and his primary customers are both men and women. He describes his biggest business challenge as a lack of capital to expand. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more rabbits. His business goal is to own a big rabbit farm within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more rabbits.

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en:
Kamal is a 22-year-old man who lives in Ibb, Yemen. He has completed secondary school. 

Kamal opened a grocery store two years ago. He started his business with limited capital and income, provided by his dad. He did his best to improve and expand his business in order to build his future. 

Due to the current bad situation which Yemen faces, Kamal's business is making less profit and his customers are decreasing. Therefore, he is planning to bring new goods to his grocery store in order to keep his customers and improve his income. 

He has requested a youth loan of YER 160,000 from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB) in order to purchase grocery goods, to increase his profit. He hopes that this will enable him to continue running his business successfully and make the business more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase grocery goods, to increase his profit.

loans.name: Ghamdan

texts.en:
Ghamdan is young man who lives comfortably in Ibb, Yemen. He is a hard-working man with strong ambitions to move forward in life and to be happy. He has been operating a business that provides generalized wedding services for customers (grooms & brides). He acquires all needed items on regular trips to the capital. He serves his customers with a very friendly and amenable manner, which keeps them loyal to him and recommends him to others, increasing his customer base.

He describes his business as profitable, as it provides him with good earnings. He requested a loan from AMB to further invest in his business. In the future, he dreams that his business will continue to provide income in order to help his family; in that way, he will provide them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in renting wedding supplies to his customers.

loans.name: Khalid

texts.en:
Khalid is a 29-year-old married man and has five children. He lives in Sana'a, Yemen, and he has been selling fresh fruits and vegetables. He currently has his own business, which is the main source of his income. He has had his business for five years. 

Khalid is asking for a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB. The loan will be used to stock his store better by buying fruits and vegetables like oranges, apples, lemons, potatoes, and onions. 

This will allow him to obtain better daily profits, since his sales will be higher.  This will make it possible for him improve his family’s well-being.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables like oranges, apples, lemons, potatoes, and onions.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a 25-years-old married man. He describes himself as polite. He operates an eyeglass business where he sells spectacles. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are the general public. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more spectacles for resale. His business goal is to own a stall within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more eyeglasses for resale.

loans.name: Adhm

texts.en:
Adhm, a 21-year-old single man, lives in Haja, Yemen, where he is a hardworking sewer. He has striven with great courage in order to provide for his family, laboring very hard so that he can become a professional.

Adhm, who creates and sells clothes to his clients, works daily in his sewing shop and loves what he does. He has applied for a youth loan of 300,000 Yemeni rials (YER) from AMB to buy an additional sewing machine and sewing materials for his business.

loans.use: to buy an additional sewing machine and sewing materials for his business.

loans.name: Gaspar

texts.es: DON GASPAR ES UN CIUDADANO DE UNA COMUNIDAD RURAL EN EL VIEJO CHINANDEGA. EL TIENE 59 AÑOS DE EDAD. DE VIVIR EN LA COMUNIDAD TIENE 8 AÑOS CON EL VIVEN SU SEÑORA Y TRES HIJOS. EL ULTIMO DE SUS  HIJOS NACIO EN  MAYO DE ESTE AÑO.  EL TRABAJA EN UN INGENIO DESDE HACE 6 AÑOS EN LA TEMPORADA DE COSECHA DE CAÑA. CUANDO SALE DE TRABAJAR  DEL INGENIO TAMBIEN  TRABAJA EN UNA FINCA CERCANA Y SIEMBRA SU MANZANA DE MAIZ Y FRIJOLES. SUS  HIJAS  ESTÁN  EN CUARTO Y SEGUNDO GRADO DE PRIMARIA ASISTEN A LA ESCUELA MAS CERCANA. EN LA COMUNIDAD NO HAY LUZ ELECTRICA Y ACTUALMENTE SU FAMILIA  ESTA USANDO FOCO DE BATERÍAS PARA ILUMINARSE. ELLOS COMPRAN BATERIAS POR QUE DURAN MAS Y EVITAN QUE OCURRA  ALGUN INCENDIO EN SU CASA  CON EL USO  DE CANDELAS. EL ESTA SOLICITANDO UN PRESTAMO PARA LA COMPRA DE UN PANEL SOLAR  DE 60 WATT Y ASÍ VIVIR DE UNA MEJOR  MANERA CON SUS  HIJAS Y SU  SEÑORA. CON ESTE SISTEMA LA INTENCIDAD DE LUZ SERA MAYOR Y YA NO TENDRA QUE GASTAR EN LA COMPRA DE BATERIAS. LAS HIJAS DE DON GASPAR  PODRAN REALIZAR TAREAS ESCOLARES  POR LAS NOCHES Y SU ESPOSA  PUEDE CUIDAR MEJOR AL NIÑO RECIÉN NACIDO.  EL ESPERA LE  AYUDEN CON  LA APROBACION DE EL PRESTAMO PARA QUE SU VIDA FAMILIAR CAMBIE.
texts.en:
Gaspar lives in a rural community in El Viejo, Chanandega.  He is 59 years old.  He has lived in the community for eight years with his wife and three children.  The last of his children was born in May of this year.

He has worked for six years at a sugar refinery during the season for harvesting sugarcane.  When he leaves his work at the sugar refinery he also works at a nearby farm, and he grows his ‘manzana’ [a land measurement unit equivalent to 1.740 acres] of corn and beans.

His daughters are in the fourth and the second grades of elementary school, and they go to the closest school.  In the community there is no electrical lighting.  Currently his family is using lights run by batteries.  They buy batteries because they last longer, and they avoid a fire that could be caused by using candles in their house.

He is requesting the loan to buy a 60 watt solar panel.  This way he will live in a better way with his daughters and his wife.  With this system the intensity of light will be greater, and they will no longer have to spend to buy the batteries.  Gaspar’s daughters will be able to do their school work at night, and his wife will be able to take better care of their newborn child.  He hopes to be helped with the approval of this loan so that his family life will change.

loans.use: to buy a 60 watt solar system in order to have light in his home.

loans.name: Thaier

texts.en:
Thaier is 21 years old and is from Gaza. He has owned a barbershop since 2012 and has one employee who helps him.

Thaier asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy materials for hair styling and furniture that he needs for his barbershop. He hopes that the loan will help him gain more customers and thus improve his income.

loans.use: to buy materials for hair styling and furniture that he needs for his barbershop

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en:
Ezekiel is a 51-years-old married man. He has 3 children with ages ranging from 6 years to 11 years. He describes himself to be happy. He has an animal sales business where he sells cows. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in a good area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be poor prices. 

He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy cows for reselling. His business goal is to be rich within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable and will be able to educate his children. Previously he was selling maize to earn an income. He also sells milk to earn extra income.

loans.use: to buy cows for reselling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy five logs of trees.

loans.name: Iyyad

texts.en:
Iyyad is 22 years old and is from Ramallah. He opened a clothing shop two years ago and has five years of experience in clothing sales.

Iyyad asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy more clothes and accessories for his clothing shop. He hopes that this loan will help him increase his sales and thus improve his income.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and accessories for his clothing shop

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is a 25-year-old married man with 3 children living in Sana'a, Yemen. He sells gas cylinders, and he uses his rickshaw to transport his goods. The business is profitable, and he intends to expand it. He has applied for a youth loan of 100,000 Yemeni rials (YER) from AMB to purchase gas cylinders for resale to increase his profit. This loan will help him operate efficiently and increase his route coverage.

loans.use: to purchase gas cylinders for resale to increase his profit.

loans.name: John Bosco

texts.en:
John Bosco is a married man, aged 46 years, who is also a proud father of six children. He mainly trades in unprocessed tea with additional income from rentals. He started his business in the year 2000, and he has been doing it successfully for 12 years running. 

The money we extended to him amounting to 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings was to buy organic fertilizers to boost his trade and expand the tea plantation. He hopes to educate his children further with the proceeds he gets from the tea trading, as he has an 18-year-old daughter he has successfully educated  who needs university tuition. He is hoping her fellow siblings will follow. John Bosco is hardworking, committed and proud of what he does.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers for his tea plantation.

loans.name: Froduard

texts.en:
Froduard is a 28-year-old man from the Gakenke District in the Northern Province of Rwanda. He is seeking a loan of 30,000 Rwandan francs (RWF) to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just 100 RWF.

Froduard started selling lights in November, 2012, and has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. He is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: purchase 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is a 41-year-old man from Bugesera District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of  RWF 30,000 to purchase ten rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. 

Vincent started selling lights in May, 2012 and he has sold 110 lights to date, providing clean energy to 550 people. He is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business, to earn more money for himself, his wife Grace, and their two children.

loans.use: to pay for ten, low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Katenga Turibamwe Group

texts.en:
Jovvy is 49 years of age. She is married with five children, and two dependants who are orphans. She is part of the Katenga Turibamwe group a development group in rural Bushenyi. This is the second time she is taking a loan of ugx. 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings. 

She trades in goats and coffee, with an additional income from decorations. She began her business in 2003, and it is located in a trading centre of a rural area. Most of her clients are located around the coffee factory. 

She hopes to build a family house to accommodate her children and dependants in a more descent housing. Though she faces a problem of fluctuation of prices, she is involved in many businesses and is very hard working.She hope the group will pay diligently to uphold the partnership and she thanks Kiva lenders for the interest they took in their businesses.

loans.use: To buy coffee that she will dry and sell at the factory.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald resides at Nyabubare cell. He is a long-time client of Ugafode. He runs a restaurant in town as his business. 

Ronald has applied for a loan of UGX 2,500,000 to enable him to buy building materials to complete his rental house, which will give him more income in future than staining the restaurant alone.

He hopes when the money comes as additional income, he will no longer strain his business and therefore increase his income. Ronald is standing on the right, the person to his left is the UGAFODE staff. He hopes to pay back the loan well such that he maintains the partnership.

loans.use: To complete his rental house.

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en:
Pascal is a 25-year-old man from Rwamagana District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of  RWF 30,000 to purchase ten rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. 

Pascal started selling lights in June, 2012 and he has sold 70 lights to date, providing clean energy to 350 people. He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business, to earn more money for himself and his wife.

loans.use: to pay for ten, low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Omar Enrique

texts.es: El Sr.  Omar  de 39  años de edad es casado y tiene tres  personas que dependen económicamente de él.  el Sr   trabaja en una empresa  pequeña   desempeñándose como pintor de Primera   puesto que se ha ganado a base de esfuerzo,  es un hombre de familia siempre buscando y procurando lo mejor para sus hijos. En esta ocasión   está  solicitando un crédito  para poder impermeabilizar su casa y  poner vidrio al Barandal  ya que cuando le instalaron  el portón  no le alcanzo para poner el vidrio,  El sabe que su familia  se merece  lo mejor es por eso que ha tratado siempre de brindarles lo que ellos necesitan y  ofrecerles  la mejor comodidad,   El agradecerá la ayuda que se pueda brindar.
texts.en: Omar, 39, is married and has 3 dependents.  He works as a painter for a small company, a position that he got through a lot of effort.  He is a family man who is always seeking and procuring the best for his children.  At this time, he is requesting a loan to waterproof his home and install glass in the gated entrance, because when he installed the gate he lacked the funds to put in the glass.  He knows that his family deserves the best, and this is why he has always tried to provide them with what they need and offer them the best comfort.  He is grateful for the help that is being provided.

loans.use: to buy waterproofing supplies and glass for his gated entrance

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta, a 58-year-old widow and mother of three children, has resided for over 30 years in Salimpono, Panaon, Misamis, Occidental. She has made a living operating a retail store that sells a variety of food and home-use products. She earns PHP 5,000 a month from this business. Aside from the earnings, she also raises piglets for sale. She joined GDMPC last year and she is now requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy feed and to build a livestock shelter.
She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy feed and to build a livestock shelter.

loans.name: Eseza

texts.en: Eseza is married with four children, all of whom go to school. She has a business selling charcoal and has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from MCDTSACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She works from her home seven days a week and says her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. Eseza aspires to become a wholesaler and also to pay for her children's education through to university level. Her family's house does not have access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a single father aged 22 years with one child who is 2 years old. He lives in rural setting of Rakai district. He is a businessman who deals in bark-cloth selling (traditional clothing) and he has been in his business since 2001. He started this business in order to earn a living since he dropped out of school at an early age.

Henry sells his products to traders in Kampala city where he takes them once every month. He has acquired this loan in order to purchase stock for his business. He hopes to expand his business and start supplying in big volume and he has a hope of buying a bigger plot of land.

Henry faces challenges in his business which include delay of payments by his customers who sometimes buy on credit and high transport costs. He describes himself as a hardworking man.

loans.use: To buy bark-cloth in raw form so that he can refine it for sale

loans.name: Rwere-Nyabihinga Kwebisaho Group

texts.en:
Patrick is a married man, aged 35 years, and he has four children. He stays in Rwere – Rwetondo ward. He has been a member of Rwere – Nyabihinga Kwebisaho Group and with UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) for over six years.

He got to know about KIVA recently, when he was advanced a previous loan with his group. At that time, he received a loan of ugx.1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings.

With his share of this new loan, Patrick is going to diversify his business of brick making, through adding value to the business. He is going to employ people to make more earthen bricks. This will help him provide service to the people around him, and also generate income to meet the needs of his family. Thanks to Kiva and UGAFODE, for giving this opportunity and helping the low income earners who have managed to engage in sustainable development.

loans.use: To hire labour to make bricks

loans.name: Kanyamutwe Women's Grp Group

texts.en:
Ntura is a member of Kanyamutwe Womens’ Group of Kebisoni– Rukungiri District. He comes from a Village in Kakinga Parish - Kebisoni Sub - county. He has been a client of UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) for five years now. 

The money he has been getting from UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) helped him to start a small retail business which he has managed to grow into a big shop. He has also ventured in the coffee trade and a piggery business. When KIVA partnered with UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI), he learned about it and became educated about such funds and was interested because he would be partnering with so many lenders.  

He secured a loan of ugx.1,000,000 Uganda Shillings through the group, which he expects to help him improve and expand his businesses by buying several daily house hold use items needed by his customers. He is a committed client, hard-working, and married with nine children.

He is confident he will be able to educate all his children, which he wouldn't have done without the financial boost from Ugafode.The extra two people are group members who have signed the waiver but are not taking the loan this cycle.

loans.use: To buy retail stock

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en: Vicent is a young hardworking man of 35 years. He hails from the village of Kyanyanda in Isingiro district. He grew up without his parents after both of them died when he was very young. He was brought up by his grandmother who also died when he was 12 years old. He worked on people’s farms  looking after goats. Because of his trustworthiness, he was given some goats as gifts and that laid a foundation for his success. Vicent looked after these goats and they increased to over 40 in number. He used the goats to pay for the bride price and also to acquire land for his banana farming. Last month he again sold over half of his goats to construct a permanent house. He is requesting a loan of ugx. 3,000,000 to complete his house for the benefit of his family. In the photograph is Vicent with his wife.

loans.use: To complete construction of his house

loans.name: Rwamugooma Uwesso Grp Group

texts.en:
Venansio is a married woman with six children. She lives in the village of Ruhinda in the Rukungiri District. She previously borrowed 500,000 UGX from UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI). She used the money to start up a small shop and fence some land for livestock farming. 
She has since developed her business until this month when she applied for another loan with the Rwamugoma Uweso Group. She secured a loan of ugx. 1,000,000 with UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) and was enrolled on the KIVA Programme. She said that the money is going to help her improve her farm and add some stock in the shop and she is grateful to KIVA and UGAFODE for the partnership. She is a hard working woman.

loans.use: To hire labourers to plough her farm

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty was born in 1982 in the rural Rukungiri district. Betty is a widow since her husband died in 2010 and she has been struggling to earn a living and support her two children, who she stays with.

Betty has a retail shop in a busy place Rukungiri town, on which she and her children rely. She started constructing a house with the intention of raising her children there. Betty found out that she could not finish her house using her business income, so she decided to join UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) for a loan in order to complete her house.

Betty thanks UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) for the sincere assistance, which will enable her to complete her house and make her dream come true to raise her children in a descent environment.

loans.use: To buy building materials

loans.name: Manzi

texts.en:
Manzi is a new client to UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (UGAFODE), from Kajara, Ntungamo District. 

The client lost his goats due to foot and mouth disease. Manzi is a farmer and he has approached UGAFODE to boost his goats business where he buys, fattens, and sells them for profit. He has put in a well structure to protect the goats. 

He hopes to maintain the relationship by paying well and, thereafter, accessing more loans to raise his income and profits, which he could not do without the help of Kiva lenders, through UGAFODE. The second gentleman on the left is the UGAFODE credit officer.

loans.use: to buy goats for sell.

loans.name: Anastasie

texts.en:
Anastasie is a 49-year-old woman from Gicumbi District in the Northern Province of Rwanda. 

She is seeking a loan of RWF 30,000 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which she will resell to people without electricity in her village. Every week or so, these customers will return to her to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. 

Anastasie started selling lights in December, 2012 and he has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. With the money she makes from selling and recharging lights, she will pay the school fees of her five children (Aimable, Christella, Patrick, Clement, and Eric).

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Felicien

texts.en:
Felicien is a 25-year-old man from Bugesera District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a loan of  RWF 30,000 to purchase ten, rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. 

Felicien started selling lights in May, 2012 and he has sold 70 lights to date, providing clean energy to 350 people. He is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business, to earn more money for himself, his wife Marie, and their one child.

loans.use: to pay for ten, low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a 27-year-old man from Bugesera District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. 

He is seeking a top-up loan of RWF 30,000 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just RWF 100. Emmanuel started selling lights in May, 2012 and he has sold 170 lights to date, providing clean energy to 850 people. He is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself, his wife Speciose, and their child.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Tserendolgor

texts.en: Tserendolgor, 24 years old, lives with her husband and 2-year-old daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a five-walled Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling). She is a music teacher but currently is not working to look after her daughter. Her husband is currently unemployed. They decided to purchase an automobile to render taxi service to local people. She is requesting a loan of 1300000 MNT to cover the cost of buying an automobile. The borrower and her husband believe that getting the loan for purchasing a car will surely help improve their living standard.

loans.use: to purchase an automobile

loans.name: Rose

texts.es: Rose tiene 36 años, está separada y vive en la casa de su padre al lado de  su hermana y sus dos sobrinos.Rose se dedica a la venta de bebidas gaseosas, cervezas, jugos envasados y agua mineral de distintas marcas. Todos los lunes realiza su pedido a las distribuidoras con las que trabaja y procede a colocarlas en la congeladora para que puedan estar listas para el consumo de personas mayores de edad. Además de vender bebidas también vende hielo y chupetes de frutas regionales, trabaja en esta actividad por más de 4 años y complementa su labor con la venta de pollo asado los fines de semana. Ahora es una gran vendedora y tiene muchos clientes, tiene muchos planes para su futuro personal y el de su negocio como poner un bar y más adelante consolidar una distribuidora, pero por el momento solo quiere incrementar su negocio y que sea reconocido. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000, está agradecida y contenta al saber que sigue contando con el apoyo financiero que necesita para avanzar con el progreso de su negocio. Con el monto solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de bebidas tanto gaseosas, cervezas, jugos envasados y agua mineral.
texts.en:
Rose, 36, is separated and lives in her father's house along with her sister and two nephews.  She has a business selling soft drinks, beer, bottled juices and mineral water in a variety of brands.  Every Monday she makes her order with the distributors whom she works, and puts the products in the refrigerator so that they will be ready for her adult customers to consume.  In addition to selling drinks, she also sells ice and popsicles made from local fruit.  She's been doing this work for more than 4 years, and she complements this business with her work selling roasted chicken on the weekends.  

Now Rosa is a great seller, and she has a lot of customers.  She has a lot of plans for her personal future and for that of her business, such as establishing a bar, and further in the future becoming a distributor.  However, at this time, she only wants to expand her business and become well-known.  At this time, she is requesting 2,000 Peruvian soles.  She is grateful and content to know that she can continue to have your financial support when she needs it, so that she can continue to make progress with her business.  With the sum requested, she will buy a large quantity of beverages, including soft drinks, beer, juices, and mineral water.

loans.use: to buy beverages for her business, including soft drinks, beer, juices, etc.

loans.name: Thet

texts.en:
Thet (in the photo) sells dessert and fast food in the village. Her husband, Sophy, is a remoque taxi driver. In addition, he is also a chef. 

Thet is in the process of building her house, but the house is not finished yet. Hence, she needs to ask for a loan to complete the work. 

Thet and her husband live in a village across the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have three children - two sons and one daughter. 

About 'remoque': In the past, we called these taxis 'tuk-tuks' (a three-wheeled motorcycle taxi). But, now the government does not allow use of this name. That’s why we call the taxi 'remoque' instead of 'tuk-tuk'.

loans.use: to finish building her house.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita lives with her family at Punta, Pana-on, Misamis, Occidental. She is 48 years old, married and has five children. Her husband earns income from working in the private sector while she manages their farm of fruits, bananas and vegetables. In 2008, she joined GDMPC to gain access to micro finance services and help her improve her business. Recently, she borrowed 5,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit to buy fertilizer, such as manure. She hopes to gain a bigger harvest this cropping season in order to gain more income for the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia lives with her seven children in Punta, Pana-on, Misamis, Occidental. Her unmarried children have helped her in her flower-growing business for years since her husband died. She raises flowers and sells them in the market in town, earning 3,000 PHP every month. As a member of GDMPC micro credit since 2008, she recently borrowed 5,000 PHP to buy imported seedlings of flowers and fertilizer, such as manure. She plans to expand her flower farming business to gain more customers and profits and provide better living conditions for the entire family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy imported seedlings of flowers and fertilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is from Seti, Jimenez, Misamis, Occidental. She is 46 years old and married with one child. To make a living, Rita owns and operates a general store. Rita has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns 3,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Rita joined GDMPC. Rita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to buy rice and corn grits for sale in addition to her groceries. She hopes to gain more income for the better future of his only child.

loans.use: to  buy rice and corn grits for sale

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en: Rolando is 36 years old and married with three children. He lives in Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis, Occidental where he operates a  business that provides motor transportation to the community. He has been doing this for more than five years. Last year, he joined GDMPC micro credit and he recently borrowed 19,000 PHP to buy a new set of tires and pay for maintenance. He planned to acquire another motorized unit to be used in expanding the services he provides.

loans.use: to buy new set of tires and pay for maintenance

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en: Ma. Theresa is living in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis, Occidental. She is 49 years old and married with four children. She owns and manages a general store, selling groceries in her local community to make a living. She has been doing this for more than seven years. She became a member of GDMPC in the year 2011 and it helps her to improve being an entrepreneur. Recently, she borrowed 35,000 PHP from GDMPC micro credit to acquire rice and corn grits and feed for sale. She plans to make her store a general merchandise business some day.

loans.use: to acquire rice and corn grits and feed for sale

loans.name: Acquilina

texts.en:
Acquilina is from Dinas, Sinacaban. She is 60 years old, widowed, and has four children. 

For more than 20 years, to make a living, Acquilina has cultivated coconuts, bananas, and fruits for sale. She earns PHP 3,500 a month for these activities. 

In 2010, Acquilina joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC). Recently, she requested a loan of PHP 12,000, which will be used to buy fertilizer, such as manure, and to pay for weeding costs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, such as manure, and to pay for weeding costs.

loans.name: Vivencia

texts.en:
Vivencia is 42 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Vivencia has a fishing business in the Philippines. Vivencia requested a PHP 11000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Vivencia has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Vivencia would like to save enough to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Doña Yolanda tiene una edad de 39 años agricultora desde muy temprana edad ya que en su familia es una tradición y que además es medio de ingreso para su familia en general. Su familia es muy numerosa compuesta por 7 hijos de los cuales 4 estudian en secundaria en diferentes grados de educación, 2 en la escuela y un menor con tan solo un año de edad. En compañía de su esposo se trasladan hasta sus cultivos de café para dar mantenimiento y asistencia ya que también practican hace más de 5 años la apicultura (cría de abejas mieleras)trasladándose hacia las colmenas las cuales están ubicadas a 40 minutos de su casa de habitación en la montaña. Esta actividad la aprendió de sus padres a los cuales agradece el apoyo y el esfuerzo que en su juventud pusieron para que ella pudiese cursar la primaria completa.   

Hoy Doña Yolanda solicita a COMIXMUL un financiamiento para poder mejorar sus cultivos de café en cuanto al mantenimiento como ser: poda, abono, limpia y fertilización para poder obtener una excelente cosecha al final de la temporada.

Sus metas son las de poder asegurar sus cultivos de café ya que es un medio de ingreso para su familia el cual se debe de mantener sano y limpio de plagas. Sus sueños son los de poder ver a sus hijos graduados en un nivel universitario con carreras de provecho ya que de ellos será el patrimonio que hoy en día ellos están  construyendo para mejorar su administración y llevarlo a otro nivel.
texts.en:
Yolanda, 39, has been working in agriculture from a very young age because it’s her family tradition and also her source of income for her family in general.  Her family is very numerous; she has 7 children four of which attend various grades in secondary school, two are in elementary school and the youngest is only a year old.  She and her husband head out to their fields to care for their coffee crop; they’ve also been working as beekeepers for five years producing honey.  The hives are located in the mountains 40 minutes from home.  She learned this activity from her parents who she thanks for the support and effort they exerted during her youth so that she could complete primary school.

Yolanda is asking Comixmul for a loan to improve her coffee crop and to provide maintenance for it with pruning, fertilizing, weeding and providing manure so that at the end of the season she will obtain an excellent harvest.

Her goals are to be able to safeguard her coffee crop from infestations and to keep it healthy because it’s a source of family income.  Her dreams are to see her children graduate from university with beneficial careers and to build and improve the estate she's creating which in future will be theirs so they can better manage it and take it to another level.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Rosadillia

texts.en:
Rosadillia is 41 years old, married, with three children who are all in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Rosadillia has a firewood retail business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy more stocks to sell.

Rosadillia has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell.

loans.name: Jeimy

texts.es: Jeimy tiene 29 años, esta casada y vive en el terreno de su suegra, ahí construyó su casa en base a mucho esfuerzo y trabajo, es en este lugar donde día a día comparte la alegría de educar a sus hijos y de trabajar con muchas ganas para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Jeimy se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catálogo, su especialidad son las cremas corporales y perfumes. Tiene en su casa un exhibidor pequeño en donde también ofrece a la venta estos productos a quienes la buscan en su hogar. Lleva realizando este trabajo por 6 años y lo hace sola. Tambien vende prendas de vestir y gaseosas, hielo y gelatina. Por todas estas actividades recibe ingresos adicionales que le ayudan a sostener su economía. Le gusta mucho lo que hace pues tiene libertad para manejar su tiempo y organizarse de acuerdo a la disponibilidad de sus clientes, y ahora es una gran generadora de ingresos en la economía de su hogar, espera poner boutique para ofrecer sus productos con mayor comodidad y en mayor cantidad. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000, está muy emocionada al saber que hay personas que le brindan un respaldo económico para continuar desarrollando su actividad laboral, así mismo se compromete a ser una socia puntual y responsable. Con el monto solicitado comprará más productos de belleza como perfumes, talcos y cremas corporales.
texts.en:
Jeimy, 29, is married and lives on her mother-in-law’s property; she built her house there with much effort and work.  This is the place where she shares the joy of raising her children and working hard to provide her family with better quality of life.  

Jeimy sells cosmetics via catalog; her specialty is body cream and perfume.  She has a small display case at home to also sell these products to those who come by her house looking for her.  She’s been doing this work for six years and she works alone.  She also sells clothes, soft-drinks, ice and gelatin.  All of these activities generate additional income that helps her sustain her economy.  She likes what she does very much because she has the freedom to manage her own time and to organize herself according to customer needs and now she’s become a great income generator at home.  She hopes to open a boutique to sell her products more comfortably and in larger amounts.
